Text Description: The dish is a composition of various meats and Vegetable and other ingredients, such as a sausage-like roll consisting of minced pork and prawn (or fish) seasoned with five-spice powder, rolled inside a tofu skin and deep-fried, lup cheong, cucumber, century egg, ginger, deep-fried egg, deep-fried tofu, fishball and many others.

Name: Tonkatsu
Text Description: The dish consists of a breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet. It involves coating slices of pork with panko (bread crumbs), and then frying them in oil

Name: Cotoletta alla milanese
Text Description: The dish consists of veal rib chop or sirloin bone-in and made into a breaded cutlet, fried in butter.

Name: Cotoletta alla bolognese
Text Description: The dish consists of a veal cutlet coated with eggs, flour and breadcrumbs. It is first fried in lard or butter, then covered with a slice of ham and a handful of Parmesan cheese, then briefly sprinkled with meat broth to flavor and moisten it. Finally, it is baked in the oven until the cheese has melted.

Name: Hash browns
Text Description: The dish consists of finely julienned potatoes that have been fried until golden brown.

Name: Aloo tikki
Text Description: The dish it is made of boiled potatoes, peas, and various curry spices. The dish is served hot along with a side of saunth, tamarind, and coriander-mint sauce, and sometimes dahi (yogurt) or chickpeas.

Name: Croquette
Text Description: The dish is a deep-fried roll, consisting of a thick binder combined with a filling, which is then breaded.

Name: Korokke
Text Description: The dish is made by mixing cooked chopped meat, seafood, or Vegetable with mashed potato or white sauce, usually shaped like a flat patty, rolling it in wheat flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs, then deep-frying this until brown on the outside.

Name: Kripik
Text Description: The dish is a bite size cracker which made from dried cassava, Vegetable, and fish with deep frying process, seasoned with salt, chili powder, and sugar.

Name: Krupuk
Text Description: The dish is a deep fried crackers made from starch and other ingredients that serve as flavouring.

Name: Bánh mì
Text Description: The dish is a short bread with thin, crisp crust and a soft texture with meats and vegetable filling, coriander, cucumber, pickled carrots, combined with other condiments.

Name: Bistek
Text Description: The dish is made of strips of beef sirloin or tenderloin, usually flattened with a meat tenderizing tool, it is marinated then braised in soy sauce, calamansi juice (or some other citrus fruit like lime or lemon), smashed whole garlic cloves, ground black pepper, bay leaves, caramelized red onion rings, and (optionally) muscovado or brown sugar. In some recipes, fresh white onion rings are used instead to preserve its crunchiness.

Name: Mandu
Text Description: The dish is dumpling, which can be steamed, boiled, pan-fried, or deep-fried.

Name: Gyoza
Text Description: The dish is dumpling, which can be steamed, boiled, pan-fried, or deep-fried.

Name: Jiaozi
Text Description: The dish consists of a ground meat or vegetable filling wrapped into a thinly rolled piece of dough, which is then sealed by pressing the edges together.

Name: Khinkali
Text Description: The dish is made of twisted knobs of dough, stuffed with meat, fish or Vegetable and spices.

Name: Manti
Text Description: The dumplings typically consist of a spiced meat mixture, usually lamb or ground beef, wrapped in a thin dough sheet which is then boiled or steamed.

Name: Momo
Text Description: The dumplings are prepared with ground/minced meat, potatoes, and leek filling.

Name: Varenyky
Text Description: The filled dumplings made by wrapping unleavened dough around a filling and cooked in boiling water.

Name: Buuz
Text Description: The dish is steamed dumpling filled with meat.

Name: Shumai
Text Description: The dish is a type of dumpling made of ground pork.

Name: Siomay
Text Description: The dish is a steamed fish dumpling with Vegetable served in peanut sauce.

Name: Pannenkoek
Text Description: The dish is a style of pancake which are usually larger (up to a foot in diameter) and much thinner but not as thin as crêpes. They may incorporate slices of bacon, apples, cheese, or raisins. Plain ones are often eaten with treacle (syrup made of sugar beets), unspiced variety of apple butter or (powdered) sugar and are sometimes rolled up to be eaten by hand or with cutlery.

Name: Bing
Text Description: The dish is a wheat flour-based bread with a flattened or disk-like shape.

Name: Oyaki
Text Description: The dish is a dumpling made from a fermented buckwheat dough wrapped around a stuffing of Vegetable, fruit, or anko bean paste and then roasted on an iron pan.

Name: Dorayaki
Text Description: The dish consists of two small pancake-like patties made from castella wrapped around a filling of sweet bean paste.

Name: Buchimgae
Text Description: The dish made by pan-frying a thick batter mixed with egg and other ingredients until a thin flat pancake-shaped fritter is formed.

Name: Jeon
Text Description: The dish is a fritter made by seasoning whole, sliced, or minced fish, meat, Vegetable, etc., and coating them with wheat flour and egg wash before frying them in oil.

Name: Bindae-tteok
Text Description: The dish is made by grinding soaked mung beans, adding vegetable and meat and pan-frying it into a round, flat shape.

Name: Hotteok
Text Description: The dough is made from wheat flour, water, milk, sugar, and yeast. Handful-sized balls of this stiff dough are filled with a sweet mixture, which may contain brown sugar, honey, chopped peanuts, and cinnamon. The filled dough is then placed on a greased griddle, and pressed flat into a large circle, this is done with a stainless steel circle and wooden handle as it cooks.

Name: Neer dosa
Text Description: The dish is a crêpe prepared from rice batter. Usually, it is served with coconut chutney, sambar, saagu and non vegetarian curries like chicken, mutton, fish and egg curry.

Name: Serabi
Text Description: The dish is similar to a pancake, made of a rice flour-based batter with coconut milk or coconut cream and shredded coconut as an emulsifier. Mostly it tastes sweet, as these pancake-like desserts are usually eaten with a golden-brown coconut sugar syrup.

Name: Murtabak
Text Description: The dish is often described as spicy folded omelette pancake with bits of vegetable. The most common form of this dish is made from pan fried crepes usually stuffed with beaten eggs, chopped leeks, chives, or green onion (scallions) and minced meat, which is then folded and cut to squares.

Name: Terang Bulan
Text Description: This dish is a type of pancake. The batter is made from a mixture of flour, eggs, sugar, baking soda, coconut milk and water. The batter is cooked upon a thick round iron frying pan in plenty of palm margarine to avoid it sticking to the pan. Then other ingredients are sprinkled as filling; the most common or traditional is crushed peanut granules with sugar and sweetcorn kernels (available from cans), but modern innovations such as chocolate sprinkles and cheddar cheese are also available.

Name: Apam balik
Text Description: This dish is a type of pancake. The batter is made from a mixture of flour, eggs, sugar, baking soda, coconut milk and water. The batter is cooked upon a thick round iron frying pan in plenty of palm margarine to avoid it sticking to the pan. Then other ingredients are sprinkled as filling; the most common or traditional is crushed peanut granules with sugar and sweetcorn kernels (available from cans), but modern innovations such as chocolate sprinkles and cheddar cheese are also available.

Name: Chataamari
Text Description: The dish is made of rice crepe with meat and egg topping.

Name: Bánh xèo
Text Description: The dish is a savoury fried pancake made of rice flour, water, and turmeric powder. Some common stuffings include pork, prawns, diced green onion, mung bean, and bean sprouts.

Name: Blintz
Text Description: The dish is a rolled pancakes that are filled with sweetened cheese, sometimes with the addition of raisins, or fruit preserves and then slightly sautéed.

Name: Kaiserschmarrn
Text Description: The dish is a light, caramelized pancake made from a sweet batter using flour, eggs, sugar, salt, and milk, fried in butter.

Name: Oladyi
Text Description: The dish is a small thick pancakes or fritters. The batter is made from wheat or (nowadays more rarely) buckwheat flour, eggs, milk, salt, and sugar with yeast or baking soda. The batter may also contain kefir, soured milk or yoghurt. The dish may also include various additions, such as apple or raisins.

Name: Krapfen
Text Description: The dish is a doughnut with no central hole, made from sweet yeast dough fried in lard or cooking oil, with a jam filling, and usually covered in powdered sugar.

Name: Yorkshire pudding
Text Description: The dish is a baked pudding made from a batter of eggs, flour, and milk or water.

Name: Crumpet
Text Description: The dish is a small griddle bread made from an unsweetened batter of water or milk, flour, and yeast.

Name: Crempog
Text Description: The dish is made with flour, buttermilk, eggs, vinegar and salted butter. Traditionally made on bakestones or griddles.

Name: Palatschinke
Text Description: The dish is thin pancake made by creating a batter from eggs, wheat flour, milk, and salt and frying it in a pan with butter or oil.

Name: Poffertjes
Text Description: The dish resembles small, fluffy pancakes, they are made with yeast and buckwheat flour. Typically, this dish is sweet treats served with powdered sugar and butter, and sometimes syrup or advocaat. A savoury variant with gouda cheese is also made.

Name: Racuchy
Text Description: The dish is made from flour, milk, eggs, sugar and a pinch of salt. It is made with yeast or, in other versions, baking powder or baking soda. The dish pan fried in oil.

Name: Potato pancake
Text Description: The dish is a shallow-fried pancake of grated or ground potato, matzo meal or flour and a binding ingredient such as egg or applesauce, often flavored with grated garlic or onion and seasonings. They may be topped with a variety of condiments, ranging from the savory (such as sour cream or cottage cheese), to the sweet (such as apple sauce or sugar), or they may be served plain.

Name: Bannock
Text Description: The dish is a flatbread or quick bread made with baking powder or baking soda as a leavening agent, giving them a light and airy texture.

Name: Johnnycake
Text Description: The dish is an unleavened cornbread made of cornmeal, salt, and water. Early cooks set thick corn dough on a wooden board or barrel stave, which they leaned on a piece of wood or a rock in front of an open fire to bake.

Name: Cachapa
Text Description: The dish is made from maize flour. It can be made like pancakes of fresh corn dough, or wrapped in dry corn leaves and boiled. It is traditionally eaten with a handmade cheese, a soft, mozzarella-like cheese, and occasionally with fried pork on the side.

Name: Farinata
Text Description: The dish is a type of thin, unleavened pancake or crêpe made from chickpea flour.

Name: Sorbet
Text Description: This dish is a frozen dessert made using ice combined with fruit juice, fruit purée, or other ingredients, such as wine, liqueur, or honey. Generally, this dish do not contain dairy products.

Name: Seekh kebab
Text Description: This dish is a type of kebab made with Indian spices, spiced minced or ground meat, usually lamb, beef, or chicken, formed into cylinders on skewers and grilled. It is typically cooked on a mangal or barbecue, or in a tandoor.

Name: Chelow kabab
Text Description: This dish consists of steamed rice (čelow) and one of the many varieties of kebab. This dish is served with accompaniments such as butter, sumac powder, basil, onions, and grilled tomatoes.

Name: Kabab koobideh
Text Description: This dish is a type of kofta kabab made from ground lamb or beef, often mixed with ground pepper and chopped onions.

Name: Kabab barg
Text Description: This dish is a Persian style barbecued and marinated lamb, chicken or beef kabab dish. The main ingredients of this dish are beef tenderloin, lamb sirloin, or less commonly chicken breast, along with onions and olive oil.

Name: Jujeh kabab
Text Description: This dish consists of grilled chunks of chicken which are sometimes with bone and other times without bone. It is common to marinate the chunks in minced onion, lemon juice and saffron.

Name: Sate
Text Description: This dish consists of seasoned, skewered and grilled meat, served with a sauce. This dish may consist of diced or sliced chicken, goat, mutton, beef, pork, fish, other meats, or tofu; bamboo skewers are often used, while rustic style of preparations employ skewers from the midrib of the coconut palm frond.

Name: Pisang Molen
Text Description: The dish is a fritter made by deep frying battered banana or plantain in hot cooking oil.

Name: Pisang Goreng
Text Description: The dish is made by banana. The banana is often battered and then deep fried in ample palm oil.

Name: Maruya
Text Description: The dish is made by bananas cooked with batter.

Name: Kluai khaek
Text Description: The dish is made from fried, floured banana commonly topped with white sesame.

Name: chuối chiên
Text Description: The dish after deep frying, banana fritters are drizzled with rum or rice wine and ignited to further crisp them.

Name: Agedashi dōfu
Text Description: The dish is a hot tofu dish. Soft or medium-firm silken tofu (kinugoshi) is cut into cubes, before being lightly dusted with potato starch or cornstarch and then deep fried until golden brown. It is then served in a hot broth (tentsuyu) made of dashi, mirin, and shō-yu (Japanese soy sauce), with finely-chopped negi (a type of spring onion) and grated daikon or katsuobushi (dried skipjack tuna flakes) sprinkled on top.

Name: Tofu skin
Text Description: The dish is a food item made from soybeans. During the boiling of soy milk, in an open shallow pan, a film or skin composed primarily of a soy protein-lipid complex forms on the liquid surface.

Name: Chanpurū
Text Description: The dish consists of tofu combined with some kind of vegetable, meat, or fish.

Name: Doenjang jjigae
Text Description: This dish is made from the primary ingredient of soybean paste, and additional optional ingredients Vegetable, seafood, and meat.

Name: Douhua
Text Description: This dish is a sweet or savoury snack made with silken tofu. It is also referred to as tofu pudding, soybean pudding, or tofu brains.

Name: Dubu-kimchi
Text Description: This dish consists of tofu (dubu) and stir-fried kimchi. Soft, warm, blanched tofu is served with well-fermented, tangy baechu-kimchi (napa cabbage kimchi) stir-fried with pork.

Name: Ganmodoki
Text Description: The dish is a fried tofu fritter made with Vegetable such as carrots, lotus roots, and burdock with sometimes egg.

Name: Hiyayakko
Text Description: The dish is a chilled tofu dressed with toppings.

Name: Inarizushi
Text Description: This dish is a pouch of fried tofu typically filled with vinegared-rice part of sushi alone or additionally filled with carrot and shiitake mushrooms.

Name: Kupat tahu
Text Description: The dish is a rice cake served with peanut sauce topped with crispy crackers.

Name: Pidan doufu
Text Description: This dish is a cold tofu dish consisting of slices of silken tofu topped with diced thousand-year-old eggs, minced garlic and spring onion, and a splash of soy sauce and Chinese vinegar.

Name: Mun tahu
Text Description: This dish is a soft tofu braised in savoury thick white sauce, mixed with minced chicken and shrimp. It is mildly flavoured with garlic, ginger and onion, seasoned with small amount of soy sauce, salt and pepper. The colour of the sauce is whitish due to minimal addition of soy sauce. This white sauce is thickened using batter of tapioca powder or maize powder; resulting in a thick, slightly runny, gelatinized white sauce.

Name: Sapo tahu
Text Description: This dish is traditionally cooked and served in claypot. It may be served as a vegetarian dish, or with chicken, seafood (especially shrimp), minced beef or pork.

Name: Stinky tofu
Text Description: This dish is a form of fermented tofu that has a strong odor. It is usually sold at night markets or roadside stands as a snack, or in lunch bars as a side dish, rather than in restaurants. Traditionally the dish is fermented in a brine with Vegetable and meat, sometimes for months.

Name: Taho
Text Description: The dish is made from soft tofu with sweet brown-colored sugar syrup and sago pearls.

Name: Tahu campur
Text Description: The dish is made from fried tofu with potato or cassava cakes, dressed with lettuce, noodles, and beef stew.

Name: Tahu gejrot
Text Description: The dish is made of fried tofu served with a thin and watery dressing made by blending palm sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, and chili.

Name: Tahu sumedang
Text Description: The dish is made of deep-fried tofu, usually served with separate green chili.

Name: Tofu skin roll
Text Description: The dish's outer layer is made of tofu skin, and it is usually served in a small plate in twos or threes. It has a number of cooking styles, and is normall fried or steamed. The fillings include pork, Vegetable, fish, and beef.

Name: Tokwa't baboy
Text Description: The dish consists of pork ears, pork belly and deep-fried tofu, and is served in a mixture of soy sauce, pork broth, vinegar, chopped white onions, scallions and red chili peppers.

Name: Yong tau foo
Text Description: The dish is a Hakka Chinese dish consisting primarily of tofu filled with ground meat mixture or fish paste, and is eaten either dry with a sauce or served as a soup dish.

Name: Akara
Text Description: The dish is a fritter made from cowpeas or beans, sometimes seasoned with salt, pepper, and chopped onions molded into the shape of large scone.

Name: Ada
Text Description: The dish consisting of rice parcels encased in a dough made of rice flour, with sweet fillings, steamed in banana leaf and served as an evening snack or as part of breakfast. Grated coconut and rice flour are the two main ingredients.

Name: Bánh bột lọc
Text Description: The dish is a small, clear-looking, chewy tapioca dumplings that can be eaten as appetizers or small snacks.They are usually filled with shrimp and pork belly, often being topped with fried shallots and served with sweet chili fish sauce.

Name: Bánh chuối
Text Description: The dish is a sweet banana cake or bread pudding. Although its exact ingredients may vary, it is usually made with ripe bananas or starchy banana, rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, white bread, shredded young coconut, condensed milk, butter, egg, and vanilla extract. In the finished dish, the cooked banana often appears purplish-red in color.

Name: Bánh cuốn
Text Description: The dish is made from a thin, wide sheet of fermented rice batter filled with a mixture of cooked seasoned ground pork, minced wood ear mushroom, and minced shallots. Sides for this dish usually consist of chả lụa (Vietnamese pork sausage), sliced cucumber, and bean sprouts, with the dipping sauce which is fish sauce called nước chấm (fish sauce).

Name: Bánh da lợn
Text Description: The dish is a steamed layer cake made from tapioca starch, rice flour, mashed mung beans, taro, or durian, coconut milk and/or water, and sugar. It is sweet and gelatinously soft in texture, with thin (approximately 1 cm) colored layers alternating with layers of mung bean, durian, or taro filling.

Name: Bánh khoai mì
Text Description: The dish is a cake made from grated cassava, sugar, coconut milk, and a small amount of salt.

Name: Bánh tẻ
Text Description: The dish is a variety of small steamed rice cake. It is made of rice flour, wrapped with Lá dong leaves into a long, thin cylindrical shape, and boiled thoroughly.

Name: Corunda
Text Description: The dish is wrapped in a long corn or reed plant leaf, and folded, making a triangular shape or spherical shape. They are typically steamed until golden and eaten with sour cream and red salsa.

Name: Dhokla
Text Description: This dish is a savoury sponge dish that is made with a fermented batter that is steamed to a cake-like consistency. The batter consists of a mixture of rice with the pulse Bengal gram, but has several variants with the gram replaced by chickpeas, pigeon peas, or urad beans.

Name: Jjim
Text Description: This is a cuisine term from a region that refers to dishes made by steaming or boiling meat, chicken, fish, or shellfish which have been marinated in a sauce or soup. The cooking method for most of this dishes nowadays has changed to boiling the ingredients in broth and reducing the liquid.

Name: Agwi-jjim
Text Description: This dish is a stew made with a fish called blackmouth angler. The dish is seasoned with hot chili pepper powder, fermented soybean paste, soy sauce, minced garlic, and chopped scallions to make it spicy and hot.

Name: Andong jjimdak
Text Description: This dish is a stew made with chicken, various Vegetable marinated in a soy sauce based sauce.

Name: Galbi-jjim
Text Description: This dish is a stew made with short rib, generally beef or pork.

Name: Gyeran-jjim
Text Description: This dish is a custardy, casserole-like side dish, often seasoned with salted shrimp or salted pollock roe and topped with scallions and toasted sesame seeds. This dish ideally light and fluffy.

Name: Enduri pitha
Text Description: This dish has rice flour, turmeric leaves, black gram, coconut or chhena, jaggery, and black pepper as its main ingredients. It is a light snack and has laxative effect because of the turmeric leaves that are used to wrap the dish.

Name: Manda pitha
Text Description: This dish is a steamed dumpling. The outer covering is made of steamed rice flour and the inner filling consists of coconut, moong, jaggery, black pepper, and chhena.

Name: Seon
Text Description: The dish is made from steamed Vegetable such as zucchini, cucumber, eggplant or Napa cabbage and stuffed with meat.

Name: Urap
Text Description: The dish is a salad dish of steamed Vegetable mixed with seasoned and spiced grated coconut for dressing.

Name: Mantau
Text Description: The dish is a white and soft type of steamed bread or bun. It is made with milled wheat flour, water and leavening agents.

Name: Tingmo
Text Description: The dish is a steamed bun with shape similar to flower rolls with soft and fluffy texture.

Name: Wotou
Text Description: The dish is a type of steamed bread made from cornmeal.

Name: Bánh bao
Text Description: The dish is a ball-shaped bun containing pork or chicken meat, onions, eggs, mushrooms and vegetable.

Name: Baozi
Text Description: This dish is a type of yeast-leavened filled bun. There are many variations in fillings (meat or vegetarian) and preparations, though the buns are most often steamed.

Name: Bakpau
Text Description: The dish is a bun filled with minced pork, or alternatively chocolate, strawberry, cheese, mung bean, red bean, minced beef, or diced chicken.

Name: Gaobuli
Text Description: This dish is a bun with wrinkles on the outside.

Name: Shengjian mantou
Text Description: This dish is a small, pan-fried bun with pork filling.

Name: Tangbao
Text Description: This dish is a soup buns, a large, soup-filled buns made by wrapping dough which then steamed into soup.

Name: Da bao
Text Description: This dish is an extra large version of steamed bun made by fermented dough with less dense texture with pork or chicken minched meat and hard boiled egg fillings.

Name: Dampfnudel
Text Description: The dish is a dumpling made from flour, yeast, butter or margarine, and eggs with sugar.

Name: Hoppang
Text Description: This dish is a convenience food version of steamed bread and is typically filled with smooth, sweetened red bean paste.

Name: Jjinppang
Text Description: This dish is a steamed bun, typically filled with red bean paste with bits of broken beans and bean husk.

Name: Lotus seed bun
Text Description: This dish is a steamed yeast-leavened dough that contains lotus seed paste.

Name: Longevity peach
Text Description: This dish is a white bun with red dyed tip with a crease along the side, mimicking shape of the peach.

Name: Mandarin roll
Text Description: The dish is a steamed white-colored bun with a twisted shape.

Name: Rava idli
Text Description: The dish is a snack made of coarse ground wheat or rice with chopped cilantro, curry leaves, ghee, crushed ginger, and other nuts.

Name: Ang ku kueh
Text Description: The dish is red tortoise shaped with skin made of rice flour and sweet potato, whereas the fillings are made of mung bean, peanuts and sugar.

Name: Taro cake
Text Description: The dish is a dense texture cake made from vegetable taro, cut into rectangular slices and pan-fried.

Name: Turnip cake
Text Description: The dish is a radish cake made from shredded radish and cut into rectangular slices before being pan-fried for serving.

Name: Treacle sponge pudding
Text Description: The dish is a steamed sponge cake with treacle cooked on top of it.

Name: Uirō
Text Description: The dish is a steamed cake made of glutinous rice flour and sugar. It is chewy, similar to mochi, and subtly sweet. Flavors include red bean paste, green tea (matcha), yuzu, strawberry and chestnut.

Name: Karukan
Text Description: The dish is a traditional confection in the form of a long block.

Name: Clorot
Text Description: The dish is a sweet snack (kue or kuih) made of sweet and soft rice flour cake with coconut milk, wrapped with janur or young coconut leaf in cone shape.

Name: Kue mangkok
Text Description: The dish is a traditional steamed cupcake that requires few ingredients, typically around four to five, and is cooked by steaming.

Name: Seri muka
Text Description: The dish is a two-layered dessert with steamed glutinous rice at the bottom and a green pandan-flavored custard on top.

Name: Lucky tattie
Text Description: The dish is made of a white fondant solid core flavoured with cassia, and steamed and covered with cinnamon powder.

Name: Chawanmushi
Text Description: The dish is a savory egg custard made by steaming an egg mixture flavored with soy sauce, dashi, and mirin.

Name: Germknödel
Text Description: The dish is a fluffy yeast dough dumpling filled with spiced plum jam and served with melted butter and a mix of poppy seeds and sugar on top.

Name: Eo-mandu
Text Description: The dish is a half-moon-shaped dumpling prepared with filleted whitefish, most typically brown croakers, instead of flour dough as the wrapping.

Name: Patrode
Text Description: The dish is made from colocasia leaves stuffed with gram or rice flour and flavourings such as spices, tamarind, and jaggery (raw sugar).

Name: Har gow
Text Description: The dish is a traditional dumpling served as dim sum. It is made of shrimp meat, and steamed in a flour wrapper. After cooking, the wrapper becomes somewhat translucent.

Name: Steamed cheeseburger
Text Description: This dish is a type of hamburger topped with cheese that is cooked via steaming.

Name: Steamed clams
Text Description: The dish is a seafood dish consisting of clams cooked by steaming.

Name: Pearl meatballs
Text Description: The dish usually made of ground pork and Vegetable, then covered in glutinous rice and steamed.

Name: Steamed meatball
Text Description: The dish is usually made of minced beef, with water chestnut to add texture and with coriander and a few slivers of chan pei or dried orange peel used as seasoning. A layer of tofu skin, or sometimes peas, are used to raise the meatballs from the bottom of the dish and prevent them from sitting in the cooking juices.

Name: Cabinet pudding
Text Description: The dish is a steamed, sweet, moulded pudding made from some combination of bread or sponge cake or similar ingredients in custard, cooked in a mould faced with decorative fruit pieces such as cherries or raisins, served with some form of sweet sauce.

Name: Chocolate pudding
Text Description: The dish is a class of desserts in the pudding family with chocolate flavors. There are two main types: a boiled then chilled dessert, texturally a custard set with starch and a steamed/baked version, texturally similar to cake.

Name: Custard
Text Description: The dish is a variety of culinary preparations based on sweetened milk, cheese, or cream cooked with egg or egg yolk to thicken it, and sometimes also flour, corn starch, or gelatin.

Name: Figgy pudding
Text Description: The dish is any of many medieval Christmas dishes, usually sweet or savory cakes containing honey, fruits and nuts. In later times, rum or other distilled alcohol was often added to enrich the fruitiness of the flavour.

Name: Moin moin
Text Description: The dish is a steamed or boiled bean pudding made from a mixture of washed and peeled beans and onions, fresh red peppers, spices, and often fish, eggs,chicken and/or crayfish.

Name: Persimmon pudding
Text Description: The dish is a dessert pudding made with persimmons. There is a lot of variety in the recipes, some are made with eggs, others add sweet potatoes or pumpkin. There's no set recipe, although common ingredients include some type of cornmeal or flour, brown sugar or molasses, and spices like cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger.

Name: Steak and kidney pudding
Text Description: The dish is a main course in which beef steak and beef, veal, pork or lamb kidney are enclosed in suet pastry and slow-steamed on a stovetop.

Name: Sticky toffee pudding
Text Description: The dish is a dessert consisting of a moist sponge cake made with finely chopped dates (optional), covered in a toffee sauce and often served with a vanilla custard or vanilla ice-cream.

Name: Christmas pudding
Countries: ["Antigua and Barbuda", "Bahamas", "Barbados", "Cuba", "Dominica", "Dominican Republic", "Grenada", "Haiti", "Jamaica", "Saint Kitts and Nevis", "Saint Lucia", "Saint Vincent and the Grenadines", "Trinidad and Tobago","United States", "Canada", "United Kingdom"]
Text Description: The dish is sweet, dried-fruit pudding traditionally served as part of Christmas dinner.

Name: Jam roly-poly
Text Description: The dish is a flat-rolled suet pudding, which is spread with jam and rolled up then steamed or baked and traditionally served with custard..

Name: Spotted dick
Text Description: The dish is made with suet and dried fruit (usually currants or raisins) and often served with custard.

Name: Sussex pond pudding
Text Description: The dish is made of a suet pastry, filled with butter and sugar, and is boiled or steamed for several hours. Modern versions of the recipe often include a whole lemon enclosed in the pastry.

Name: Sanna
Text Description: The dish is a spongy, steamed, and savoury unfilled dumpling originally made of red rice, black lentil and coconut.

Name: Jeungpyeon
Text Description: The dish is made by steaming rice flour dough prepared with makgeolli (rice wine).

Name: Mujigae-tteok
Text Description: The dish is a layered tteok (rice cake) of different colors resembling a rainbow.

Name: Bappir
Text Description: The dish is a twice-baked barley bread.

Name: Biscotti
Text Description: The dish is the term for any type of biscuit or cookie. It characterised oven-baked goods that were baked twice, so they became very dry and could be stored for long periods of time.

Name: Bread pudding
Text Description: The dish is a bread-based dessert. It is made with stale bread and milk or cream, generally containing eggs, a form of fat such as oil, butter or suet and, depending on whether the pudding is sweet or savory, a variety of other ingredients. Sweet version of the dish may use sugar, syrup, honey, dried fruit, nuts, as well as spices such as cinnamon, nutmeg, mace, or vanilla. The bread is soaked in the liquids, mixed with the other ingredients, and baked.

Name: Biscocho
Text Description: This bread is baked twice and usually coated with butter and sugar, or garlic in some cases.

Name: Crouton
Text Description: The dish is a piece of toasted or fried bread, normally cubed and seasoned. The dish is used to add texture and flavor to salads—notably the Caesar salad— as an accompaniment to soups and stews, or eaten as a snack food.

Name: Detroit-style pizza
Text Description: The dish is a rectangular pan pizza with a thick, crisp, chewy crust. It is traditionally topped to the edges with mozzarella or brick cheese, which caramelizes against the high-sided heavyweight rectangular pan.

Name: Fat rascal
Text Description: The dish baked as a buttery, flat cake baked in a covered pan among the ashes of a peat fire.

Name: Mandelbrot
Text Description: The dish is typically formed by baking a loaf which is then cut into small slabs and twice-baked in order to form a crunchy exterior. The basic ingredients are flour, sugar, eggs and oil. Additional ingredients vary between bakers, but common additions include almonds, walnuts, cinnamon, chocolate chips or diced candied fruit.

Name: Melba toast
Text Description: The dish is a dry, crisp and thinly sliced rusk, often served with soup and salad or topped with either melted cheese or pâté.

Name: New York-style cheesecake
Text Description: The dish is a baked cream cheese that is firm on the outside with a soft and creamy texture on the inside. These dishes are often made in a greased cake pan and are relatively fluffy in texture. The crust used with this style is most commonly made from shortbread that is crushed and mixed with sugar and butter.

Name: Paximathia
Text Description: The dish is a hard bread that is prepared with whole wheat, chick pea or barley flour.

Name: Rusk
Text Description: The dish is a hard, dry biscuit or a twice-baked bread. In some cultures, the dish is made of cake, rather than bread.

Name: Baked potato
Text Description: The dish is a preparation of potato with baking method. It may be served with fillings, toppings or condiments such as butter, cheese, sour cream, gravy, baked beans, and tuna, among others.

Name: Zwieback
Text Description: The dish is a type of crisp, sweetened bread, made with eggs and baked twice.

Name: Aachener Printen
Text Description: This pastry is originally sweetened with honey, but are now generally sweetened with a syrup made from sugar beets.

Name: Abernethy biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a type of digestive biscuit, a baked good originally designed to be eaten as a support to proper digestion.

Name: Acıbadem kurabiyesi
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit made of almonds, sugar and egg whites. The traditional recipes include a small amount of bitter almonds

Name: Afghan
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit made from flour, butter, cornflakes, sugar and cocoa powder, topped with chocolate icing and a half walnut. The recipe has a high proportion of butter, and relatively low sugar, and no leavening (rising agent), giving it a soft, dense and rich texture, with crunchiness from the cornflakes, rather than from a high sugar content. The high butter content gives a soft melt-in-the-mouth texture, and the sweetness of the icing offsets the low sugar and the cocoa bitterness.

Name: Alfajor
Text Description: The dish is a traditional confection typically made of flour, honey, and nuts.

Name: Almond biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a type of biscuit that is made with almonds. They are a common biscuit in many different cuisines and take many forms.

Name: Amaretti di Saronno
Text Description: The dish is a type of amaretto, a bitter-sweet flavored macaroon. It is one of many types of traditional amaretti, but the only one made with apricot kernels (the others are usually made with almonds).

Name: Animal cracker
Text Description: The dish is a particular type of cracker, baked in the shape of an animal, usually an animal either at a zoo or a circus, such as a lion, a tiger, a bear, or an elephant. The most common variety is light-colored and slightly sweet, but darker chocolate-flavored and colorful frosted varieties are also sold.

Name: Anzac biscuit
Text Description: This biscuit is made using rolled oats, flour, sugar, butter (or margarine), golden syrup, baking soda, boiling water and optionally desiccated coconut.

Name: Aparon
Text Description: This dish is a wafer drizzled with caramelized sugar and optionally, sesame seeds. It is uniquely made from unconsecrated communion wafers.

Name: Baci di dama
Text Description: The dish is a type of sandwich biscuit consisting of two hazelnut biscuits joined together by a chocolate filling.The most common variations are made with almonds, pistachios, and cocoa in place of hazelnuts.

Name: Ballokume
Text Description: The dish consists of butter, sugar, eggs, and cornflour.

Name: Barquillo
Text Description: The dish is made from the basic cookie ingredients of flour, sugar, egg whites and butter rolled out thinly and then shaped into a hollow cylinder or a cone.

Name: Basler Läckerli
Text Description: The dish is made by baking a thin layer of dough, which is then topped with a sugar glaze while still hot and cut into rectangular pieces.

Name: Bath Oliver
Text Description: The dish is a hard, dry biscuit or cracker made from flour, butter, yeast and milk; often eaten with cheese.

Name: Berger Cookies
Text Description: The dish is frosted on its flat bottom, giving the final cookie an overall rounded shape. Each weighs 1.25 ounces, with the cake-like under-cookie weighing a quarter of an ounce, and the chocolate/fudge frosting weighing an ounce.

Name: Berner Haselnusslebkuchen
Text Description: The dish is made of a clay-like mass of roasted and ground hazelnuts and about one eighth ground almonds, as well as a little sugar, honey, cinnamon, candied lemon and orange peel, held together by egg white.

Name: Bizcochito
Text Description: The dish is a kind of crisp butter cookie made with lard, flavored with sugar, cinnamon, and anise. The dough is rolled thin and cut into the shape of the Christian cross, a star, or a circle, symbolizing the moon.

Name: Black and white cookie
Text Description: The dish is round cookies iced or frosted in two colors, with one half vanilla and the other chocolate. It is slightly dome-shaped (convex), has frosting on a fluffy angel cake base

Name: Boortsog
Text Description: The dish is a type of fried dough food. It is shaped into either triangles or sometimes spheres. The dough consists of flour, yeast, milk, eggs, butter, salt, sugar, and margarine.The dish is often decorated with a criss-cross pattern by pressing the bottom of a small strainer on the dough before it is fried.

Name: Bourbon biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a sandwich biscuit consisting of two thin rectangular dark chocolate-flavoured biscuits with a chocolate buttercream filling.

Name: Bredele
Text Description: The dish can include cake with egg white and aniseed,  orange and cinnamon, small pain and spice cakes that are made with sugar rather than honey.

Name: Broas
Text Description: The dish is typically slathered in butter and sprinkled with white sugar and grated cheese. It is a very light chiffon or sponge cake known for its soft and fluffy texture.

Name: Butter cookie
Text Description: The dish hes a variety of shapes such as circles, squares, ovals, rings, and pretzel-like forms, and with a variety of appearances, including marbled, checkered or plain.

Name: Camachile cookie
Text Description: The dish is characteristically shaped like the fruits of the camachile tree (Pithecellobium dulce).

Name: Caramel shortbread
Text Description: The dish is confectionery composed of a shortbread biscuit base topped with caramel and milk chocolate.

Name: Carrot cake cookie
Text Description: The dish is cake that contains carrots mixed into the batter.

Name: Cat tongue
Text Description: The dish is a small, long, and flat biscuit resembling a cat's tongue.

Name: Cavallucci
Text Description: The dish is a pastry made with anise, walnuts, candied fruits, coriander, and flour. The chewy pastries are similar to a cookie or biscuit and traditionally use Tuscan millefiori honey as an essential ingredient in the dough.

Name: Caycay
Text Description: The dish is a crunchy layered cookie coated in syrup (latik) or honey and rolled in coarsely ground toasted peanuts.

Name: Charcoal biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit based on a powdered willow charcoal or activated carbon mixed with ordinary flour, and made into dough with butter, sugar and eggs.

Name: Chocolate chip cookie
Text Description: The dish is a drop cookie that features chocolate chips or chocolate morsels as its distinguishing ingredient.

Name: Chocolate-coated marshmallow treats
Text Description: The dish is a confection consisting of a biscuit base topped with marshmallow-like filling and then coated in a hard shell of chocolate.

Name: Cowboy cookies
Text Description: The dish is a type of drop cookie made with oatmeal, chocolate chips, pecans, and coconut.

Name: Cuchuflí
Text Description: The dish is a tubular-shaped desserts made from sugar, egg whites, flour, butter, and vanilla that are often filled with dulce de leche or other sweet fillings.

Name: Cornish fairing
Text Description: The dish is a sweet and spicy ginger biscuit, made with standard biscuit ingredients such as flour, caster sugar and butter, together with mixed spice, ginger, cinnamon and golden syrup.

Name: Coyotas
Text Description: The dish is a large, flat cookie traditionally filled with brown sugar. It also comes in various flavors like guava, caramel, chocolate, strawberry, milk candy, peach, and pineapple.

Name: Cream cracker
Text Description: The dish is made of wheat flour, vegetable oil, and yeast and commonly served with cheese as form of biscuit.

Name: Cuccidati
Text Description: The dish is made from a pastry dough, covered with icing and topped with rainbow sprinkles.

Name: Custard cream
Text Description: The dish is a type of sandwich biscuit filled with a creamy, custard-flavoured centre.

Name: Digestive biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a semi-sweet biscuit that was first developed by two doctors to aid digestion.

Name: Drabbelkoek
Text Description: The dish is a sort of round and hard cookie which made by dribbling strings of the liquid dough in hot butter.

Name: Dutch letter
Text Description: The dish is a type of pastry that is typically prepared using a mixture of flour, eggs and butter or puff pastry as its base and filled with almond paste (or persipan), dusted with sugar and shaped in an "S" or other letter shape.

Name: Empire biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a type of sweet biscuit that has a layer of jam in between two biscuits, typically shortbread. The top is covered with white water icing, usually decorated with a glace cherry in the centre, but Dew Drops are common too.

Name: Fig roll
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit or cookie consisting of a rolled cake or pastry filled with fig paste.

Name: Finskepinner
Text Description: The dish is a shortbread cookie characterized by its long shape, crispy texture, and its frequent consumption during Christmas.

Name: Florentine biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a made of nuts (typically hazelnuts and almonds) and candied cherries mixed with sugar melted together with butter and honey, cooked in an oven. They are often coated on the bottom with chocolate, which is traditionally scored in a wave pattern with the tines of a fork for decoration.

Name: Flour kurabiye
Text Description: The dish is a kind of cookie that is made from butter, sunflower oil (or another mild flavored oil), baking powder, and the namesake ingredient flour. Generally, vanilla powder is also added.

Name: Fortune cookie
Text Description: The dish is a crisp, sugary cookie wafer made from flour, sugar, vanilla, and sesame seed oil with a piece of paper inside.

Name: Fudge cookie
Text Description: The dish is a is a cookie that is prepared with fudge or that has the flavor, consistency or texture of fudge.

Name: Rosquillo
Text Description: The dish is a cookie made from flour, eggs, shortening, sugar, and baking powder.

Name: Galletas de patatas
Text Description: The dish is a thick and square-shaped biscuit with upturned edges.

Name: Garibaldi biscuit
Text Description: The dish consists of currants squashed and sandwiched between two thin oblongs of biscuit dough before baking.

Name: Gazelle ankles
Text Description: The dish is a crescent-shaped cookies made of flour-based dough filled with almond paste aromatized with orange blossom water.

Name: Qurabiya
Text Description: The dish is a shortbread-type biscuit, usually made with ground almonds.

Name: Gingerbread
Text Description: The dish refers to a broad category of baked goods, typically flavored with ginger, cloves, nutmeg, and cinnamon and sweetened with honey, sugar, or molasses.

Name: Gingerbread man
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit or cookie made from gingerbread, usually in the shape of a stylized human being following seasonal themes.

Name: Ginger snap
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit flavoured with ginger. The dish is flavoured with powdered ginger and a variety of other spices, most commonly cinnamon, molasses and clove.

Name: Half-moon cookie
Text Description: The dish  is a semicircle- or crescent-shaped butter cookie. It has a soft crumbly texture and a sweet flavor with a salty aftertaste.

Name: Hamantash
Text Description: The dish is a triangular filled-pocket pastry. Most popular fillings are various jams, especially apricot and raspberry, but also date, raisins, apple, vanilla pastry cream with chocolate chips, cherry, fig, chocolate, dulce de leche, halva, caramel, or cheese.

Name: Jacobina
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit that are distinctively cubical in shape.

Name: Jammie Dodgers
Text Description: The dish is a  biscuit made from shortcake with a raspberry or strawberry flavoured jam filling.

Name: Joe Frogger
Text Description: The dish is a type of cookie flavored with molasses, rum, and spices (ginger, allspice, nutmeg, cloves) and has a soft, chewy center.

Name: Jodenkoek
Text Description: The dish is a big, flat, round shortbread biscuit with a diameter of about 10 centimeters (4").

Name: Jumble
Text Description: The dish is a butter cookies made with a basic recipe of flour, sugar, eggs, and butter. They can be flavored with vanilla, anise, caraway seed, or other flavoring like almond. They were formerly often made in the form of rings or rolls.

Name: Kaasstengels
Text Description: The dish is a cheese snack in the shape of sticks. It tastes savoury and salty instead of sweet.

Name: Kahk
Text Description: The dish is a small circular biscuit. It is covered with powdered sugar and can be stuffed with ʿagameyya (a mixture of honey, nuts, and ghee), lokum, walnuts, pistachios, or dates, or simply served plain.

Name: Khapse
Text Description: The dish is a deep-fried biscuit. The dough is usually made with flour, eggs, butter and sugar and is then shaped into different shapes and sizes. Some are sprinkled with powdered sugar, while other shapes, such as the donkey ear-shaped, are decorative.

Name: Kiâm-piánn
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit which is characterized by a crispy texture and a savory taste with a hint of pepper, which becomes subtly sweet upon chewing.

Name: Kichel
Text Description: This dish is a slightly sweet cracker or cookie. Made from eggs, flour, and sugar, the dough is rolled out flat and cut into bow-tie shapes.

Name: Kleicha
Text Description: The dish comes in several traditional shapes and fillings. The most popular are the ones filled with dates. There are also sweet discs, as well as half moons filled with nuts, sugar and/or desiccated coconut. They are usually flavoured with cardamom and sometimes rose water, and glazed with egg wash, which may sometimes be scented and coloured with saffron.

Name: Koulourakia
Text Description: The dish is a butter-based pastry, traditionally hand-shaped, with egg glaze on top. They have a sweet delicate flavor with a hint of vanilla. They are well known for their sprinkle of sesame seeds and distinctive ring shape.

Name: Krumiri
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit made without water from wheat flour, sugar, butter, eggs and vanilla, in the form of a slightly bent, rough-surfaced cylinder.

Name: Krumkake
Text Description: The dish is a waffle cookie made of flour, butter, eggs, sugar, and cream. While hot, the dish is rolled into small cones around a wooden or plastic cone form. The dish can be eaten plain or filled with whipped cream (often multekrem) or other fillings.

Name: Kue gapit
Text Description: This dish is a kind of cracker generally made from tapioca flour. Its name comes from the cooking process, in which it is grilled between iron molds like a waffle.

Name: Kue satu
Text Description: This dish is a traditional cookie made of sweet white-colored mung bean powder that crumbles when bitten.

Name: Ladyfinger
Text Description: This dish is a low-density, dry, egg-based, sweet sponge cake biscuit roughly shaped like large fingers.

Name: Lebkuchen
Text Description: The dish honey-sweetened cakes, moulded cookies or bar cookies.

Name: Lengua de gato
Text Description: The dish is made from butter, flours, sugar, eggs, and milk. They are very thin and crunchy.

Name: Lincoln biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a circular shortcake biscuit, most commonly decorated on one side with a pattern of raised dots.

Name: Linga
Text Description: The dish made from flour, sugar, salt, shortening, and sesame seeds. They are characteristically flat and baked until they are a deep brown color. They range in shape and size from small and circular to large and oblong. They are usually dipped in hot drinks like coffee or tsokolate before eating.

Name: Ma'amoul
Text Description: The dish is a filled butter cookie made with semolina flour. The filling can be made with dried fruits like figs, dates, or nuts such as pistachios or walnuts, and occasionally almonds.

Name: Malted milk
Text Description: The dish named after their malt flavouring and milk content. The biscuit design varies spending on manufacturers, commonly seen designs include two milk churns and a cow. They are typically baked for a short period of time (about 5 minutes) at high temperature to keep them crisp without the use of holes unlike other biscuits such as shortbread.

Name: Mamón tostado
Text Description: The dish is a fusion of flour, shortening, eggs, and sugar and is similarly airy, but it is baked until dry and crunchy.

Name: Maple leaf cream cookie
Text Description: The dish is a sandwich cookies. The cream filling is maple-flavoured, and may contain real maple syrup.

Name: Marie biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit with name embossed upon top surface made from wheat flour, sugar, palm oil, and vanilla-flavoured.

Name: Masa podrida
Text Description: The dish made from flour, salt, baking powder, brown sugar, shortening, and eggs. It has a dry crumbly texture similar to half-moon cookies.

Name: Nice biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a plain or coconut-flavoured biscuit. It is thin, rectangular in shape, with serrated edges, lightly covered with a scattering of large sugar crystals and often with the word "NICE" imprinted on top in sans-serif capital letters. It is often served as an accompaniment to hot drinks, such as tea.

Name: Nocciolini di Canzo
Text Description: The dish is a sweet crumbly small cookie. It is made from hazelnut flour (local hazelnuts and sugar) and egg white. The appearance of this sweet is a small half-sphere. They are usually eaten as a snack but, due to their small size, they can also be used as cake decoration.

Name: Oatmeal raisin cookie
Text Description: The dish is made from an oatmeal dough with raisins. Its ingredients also typically include flour, sugar, eggs, salt, and spices.

Name: Paciencia
Text Description: The dish is made from beaten egg whites, flour, and calamansi with hemispherical shape.

Name: Paborita
Text Description: The dish is a disc-shaped biscuit with a flaky texture made from wheat flour, sugar, skim milk, salt, baking pwoeder, alum, and cooking oil

Name: Panellets
Text Description: The dish is a ball-shaped snack made from chestnuts and sweet potatoes covered in pinenuts.

Name: Paprenjak
Text Description: The dish contains a unique mix of honey and black pepper. The main ingredients are sugar syrup or honey, butter or fat, eggs, nuts (walnuts, hazelnuts), pepper and various spices (clove, cinnamon, nutmeg).  Apart from the ingredients, it is unique with its mould-pressed motifs used to decorate the biscuit.

Name: Peanut butter cookie
Text Description: The dish is a type of cookie that is distinguished for having peanut butter as a principal ingredient.

Name: Petit-Beurre
Text Description: The dish is a type of shortbread surface of the biscuit is smooth and has twenty-four indents (four lines with six columns) intermixed with the inscription of the dish name in three lines.

Name: Pepernoot
Text Description: The dish is light brown, square shaped, and made from the same ingredients as taai-taai: rye flour, sugar and anise, and sometimes also cinnamon, and clove. They are fairly chewy, though they harden gradually when exposed to the air.

Name: Pinolate
Text Description: The dish is a type of cookie light golden color and studded with golden pine nuts (pinoli in Italian). Made with almond paste and egg whites, they are moist, soft and chewy.

Name: Piñata cookie
Text Description: The dish is a sugar cookie that is shaped and colored like a rainbow colored horse and filled with various small candies which spill out when the cookie is broken.

Name: Polvorón
Text Description: The dish is a type of heavy, soft, and very crumbly shortbread made of flour, sugar, milk, and nuts (especially almonds).

Name: Pineapple tart
Text Description: The dish is a small, bite-size tart filled with pineapple jam made with butter and egg yolk.

Name: Pizzelle
Text Description: The dish is a type of waffle cookies made with flour, eggs, sugar, butter or vegetable oil, and flavoring (usually anise or anisette, less commonly vanilla or lemon zest). They can be hard and crisp or soft and chewy[citation needed] depending on the ingredients and method of preparation.

Name: Kue putri salju
Text Description: The dish is dried cake shaped like crescents and covered with powdered sugar.

Name: Rainbow cookie
Text Description: The dish is layered almond flavored cookie and cake, typically with rainbow color

Name: Reshteh khoshkar
Text Description: The dish is a cookie amde of rice flour, and filled with sugar, walnuts or hazeulnuts, cardamom, cinnamon, ginger, and spice.

Name: Ricciarelli
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit made from almonds, sugar, honey, egg whites.

Name: Rich tea
Text Description: The dish is a type of sweet biscuit; the ingredients generally include wheat flour, sugar, vegetable oil and malt extract.

Name: Roscas
Text Description: The dish is a type of pastry cookies made from lard, anise, flour, sugar, butter and eggs.

Name: Rosette
Text Description: The dish is thin, cookie-like fritters made with iron molds. The batter is a blend of wheat flour, eggs, sugar and whole milk. They are formed with a rose iron. This specialized tool has a long handle and with a metal shape, commonly stars, flowers, snowflakes or Christmas trees. The metal is heated in hot oil before it is dipped in batter. Returning the iron to the oil, the batter is detached from the mold when it is partially cooked and gently flipped to finish cooking. They are usually topped with sugar or honey, or the edges of them are dipped into frosting.

Name: Rum ball
Text Description: The dish is a truffle-like confectionery cake of cookie butter flavoured with chocolate and rum. They are roughly the size of a golf ball and often coated in chocolate sprinkles, desiccated coconut, or cocoa. These treats contain rum. Because they are not baked, the alcohol flavour and kick are not neutralized during preparation. They are especially popular during the holiday season.

Name: Russian tea cake
Text Description: The dish is a kind of pastry, often eaten around Christmas. It is have a relatively simple recipe, generally consisting entirely of flour, water, butter, and ground nuts, the nut variety depending upon the cookie type. After baking, they are rolled in powdered sugar while still hot, then coated again once the cookie has cooled.

Name: Sandwich cookie
Text Description: The dish is a type of cookie made from two thin cookies or medium cookies with a filling between them.

Name: Kue semprong
Text Description: The dish is a wafer snack made by clasping egg batter using an iron mold (Waffle iron) which is heated up on a charcoal stove.

Name: Shortbread
Text Description: The dish is made from one part white sugar, two parts butter and three to four parts plain wheat flour. It does not contain any leavening, such as baking powder or baking soda. It is widely associated with Christmas and Daft days festivities.

Name: Silvana
Text Description: The dish is frozen cookie consisting of a layer of buttercream sandwiched between two cashew-meringue wafers coated with cookie crumbs.

Name: Snickerdoodle
Text Description: The dish is a type of cookie made with flour, fat, sugar, and salt, and rolled in cinnamon sugar. Eggs may also sometimes be used as an ingredient, with cream of tartar and baking soda added to leaven the dough. They are characterized by a cracked surface and can be either crisp or soft depending on the ingredients used.

Name: Speculaas
Text Description: The dish is a type of spiced shortcrust biscuit baked with spices. They are usually flat and are often moulded to carry certain traditional images.

Name: Springerle
Text Description: The dish is a type of biscuit or cookie with an embossed design made by pressing a mold onto rolled dough and allowing the impression to dry before baking. This preserves the detail of the surface pattern.

Name: Spritzgebäck
Text Description: The dish is a type biscuit or cookie made of a rich shortcrust pastry. When made correctly, the cookies are crisp, fragile, somewhat dry, and buttery.

Name: Square cookie
Text Description: The dish is primary include baked milk powder, butter or lard, sesame seeds, and sugar. The preparation involves mixing low-gluten flour with these ingredients to form a dough, which is then divided into small portions. Separately, medium-gluten flour is kneaded to create the outer layer. Each portion of the filling is wrapped in the outer layer, flattened, folded multiple times, and then baked until crispy. The resulting texture and flavor, characterized by the rich taste of butter and sesame, are what make these cookies particularly appealing.

Name: Stroopwafel
Text Description: The dish is a thin, round cookie made from two layers of sweet baked dough held together by syrup filling.

Name: Sugar cookie
Text Description: The dish is a cookie with the main ingredients being sugar, flour, butter, eggs, vanilla, and either baking powder or baking soda.They may be formed by hand, dropped, or rolled and cut into shapes. They may be decorated with additional sugar, icing, sprinkles, or a combination of these. Decorative shapes and figures can be cut into the rolled-out dough using a cookie cutter.

Name: Tahini cookie
Text Description: The dish is a cookie made of flour, sugar and butter and usually topped with almonds or pine nuts.

Name: Tareco
Text Description: The dish is a little tough biscuit, made of wheat flour, eggs and sugar; that, when put into the oven, get the disk shape.

Name: Teiglach
Text Description: The dish is small, knotted pastries boiled in a honeyed syrup.

Name: Tirggel
Text Description: The dish is made from flour and honey, they are thin, hard, and sweet.

Name: Toruń gingerbread
Text Description: The dish is a type of gingerbread, typically flavored with ginger, cloves, nutmeg, and cinnamon and sweetened with honey, sugar, or molasses.

Name: Ube crinkles
Text Description: The dish is made from purple yam, flour, eggs, baking powder, butter, and sugar. They are characteristically deep purple in color and are typically rolled in powdered sugar or glazed. They have a crunchy exterior and a soft chewy center.

Name: Ugoy-ugoy
Text Description: The dish is a type of layered biscuits. They are typically rectangular or ribbon-like in shape and are topped with granulated sugar.

Name: Uraro
Text Description: The dish is made from cassava like flour. They have a dry and powdery texture and are usually flower-shaped.

Name: Vanillekipferl
Text Description: The dish ia a type of small, crescent-shaped biscuits. They were originally made with walnuts, but almonds or hazelnuts can also be used. They get their typical flavour from a heavy dusting of vanilla sugar.

Name: Wafer
Text Description: The dish is a crisp, often sweet, very thin, flat, light biscuit, often used to decorate ice cream, and also used as a garnish on some sweet dishes. They frequently have a waffle surface pattern but may also be patterned with insignia of the food's manufacturer or may be patternless.

Name: Wibele
Text Description: The dish is a type of very small, sweet biscuits. The dough is made from egg white, icing sugar, flour and vanilla sugar.

Name: Countess
Text Description: The dish is a small shortbread cake, somewhat sweet. It accompanies a dessert such as fruit sorbets or fruit salads and traditionally uses a fruit juice or champagne.

Name: E.L. Fudge
Text Description: The dish is a type of butter-flavored shortbread sandwich cookies with a fudge creme filling.

Name: Hallongrotta
Text Description: The dish is similar to shortbread cookies with an added filling. It is an easily baked molded cookie. The cookies are typically made with butter, flour, baking powder, sugar and vanilla. The cookies are usually filled with raspberry jam.

Name: Hello Panda
Text Description: The dish is a type of filling biscuits, each biscuit consists of a small hollow shortbread layer, filled with crème of various flavors. On some biscuits are printed cartoon style depictions of giant pandas doing various activities, such as fencing and archery, and also in the United States, other activities such as hockey and baseball.

Name: Lorna Doone
Text Description: The dish is a brand of golden, square-shaped shortbread cookie.

Name: Royal Dansk
Text Description: The dish consisting of butter, flour, and sugar. It is often categorized as a "crisp cookie" due to its texture, caused in part by the quantity of butter and sugar. It is generally necessary to chill its dough to enable proper manipulation and handling. At their most basic have no flavoring, but they are often flavored with vanilla, chocolate, and coconut, and/or topped with sugar crystals.

Name: Sablé
Text Description: The dish is a type of round shortbread cookie.

Name: Shrewsbury cake
Text Description: The dish is a type of dessert. They are made from dough that contains sugar, flour, egg, butter and lemon zest; dried fruit is also often added. It can be small in size for serving several at a time, or large for serving as a dessert in themselves.

Name: Sandie
Text Description: The dish is a type of sugar cookie or shortbread cookie prepared using standard sugar cookie ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter, eggs, and vanilla. They are sometimes dusted with powdered sugar after cooking.

Name: Viennese whirls
Text Description: The dish is a type of biscuit consisting of soft shortbread cakes piped into a whirl shape and come in various shapes with different fillings and decorations.

Name: Alexandertorte
Text Description: The dish is a cake that consists of pastry strips filled with raspberry preserves or raspberry jam. It is traditionally eaten as a dessert after lunch or dinner, but it can also be served at tea time. It should be made a day or so before it is planned to serve, because the icing must be hard before the cake is cut.

Name: Apple strudel
Text Description: The dish is a type of layered pastry consists of an oblong layered pastry jacket with an apple filling inside. The filling is made of grated cooking apples (usually of a tart, crisp and aromatic variety) sugar, cinnamon, and bread crumbs. It uses an unleavened dough. The basic dough consists of flour, oil (or butter) and salt although as a household recipe, many variations exist.

Name: Bahulu
Text Description: The dish is a type of pastry. There are three versions available, the most common being star-shaped and the more elusive shaped like rolls and layered.

Name: Bakewell pudding
Text Description: The dish is a type of dessert consisting of a flaky pastry base with a layer of sieved jam and topped with a filling made of egg and almond paste.

Name: Bakpia pathok
Text Description: The dish usually stuffed with mung beans, but have recently come in other fillings as well, e.g. chocolate, durian and cheese.

Name: Banitsa
Text Description: The dish is prepared by layering a mixture of whisked eggs, plain yogurt, and pieces of white brined cheese between filo pastry and then baking it in an oven.

Name: Bear claw
Text Description: The dish is a sweet, yeast-raised pastry. It include the basic ingredients such as eggs, yeast, flour, milk, sugar, and butter. It is also made with "sweet dough" which is "bread dough with more shortening than usual". It is usually filled with almond paste, and sometimes raisins, and often shaped in a semicircle with slices along the curved edge, or rectangular with partial slices along one side.

Name: Bedfordshire clanger
Text Description: The dish is an elongated suet crust dumpling. It was traditionally boiled in a cloth like other suet puddings, though some modern recipes use a shortcrust or other pastry and suggest baking it like a pasty. The dumpling can be filled with liver and onion, bacon and potatoes, pork and onions, or other meat and Vegetable, and flavoured with the garden herb sage.

Name: Bethmännchen
Text Description: The dish is a pastry made from marzipan with almond, powdered sugar, rosewater, flour and egg.

Name: Bichon au citron
Text Description: The dish is a pastry that it is made of puff pastry. A major distinguishing feature is that it is filled with lemon curd. The outer layer of sugar is sometimes partially caramelized.

Name: Bierock
Text Description: The dish is a yeast dough pastry pocket sandwich with savory filling. The soft yeast rolls contain some sugar, butter and eggs, and either warm water, milk, or a mix of both. The filling is a basic mix of onion, ground beef and cabbage which can be made more complicated by the addition of different cheese blends, condiments and seasonings like caraway seeds.

Name: Birnbrot
Text Description: The dish is a bread with a filling of dried pears. Besides dried pears the filling also contains raisins, walnuts and other dried fruit such as apples or figs. The filling is additionally flavored with candied fruit, coriander, cinnamon, star anise, anise, clove and some sort of alcohol.

Name: Bizcocho
Text Description: The dish is the name given range of pastries, cakes or cookies.

Name: Bossche bol
Text Description: The dish is effectively a large filled choux pastry, about 12 cm in diameter, filled with whipped cream and coated entirely or almost entirely with (usually dark) chocolate fondant icing.

Name: Bougatsa
Text Description: The dish is a breakfast food (sweet or savoury), or mid-morning snack, or midday snack. It has several versions with their own filling, with the most popular the cream that has semolina custard filling used as a sweet food and dessert.

Name: Boyoz
Text Description: The dish is a pastry. The most widely preferred is plain, without addition of meat or cheese or spinach stuffings.

Name: Bridie
Text Description: The dish is a meat filled pastry consisting of minced steak, butter, and beef suet seasoned with salt and pepper. It is sometimes made with minced onions. Before baking, the filling is placed on pastry dough, which is then folded into a semi-circular shape; finally, the edges are crimped. If the baker pokes one hole in the top of it, this indicates that it is plain, or without onions; two holes mean that it does contain onions

Name: Briouat
Text Description: The dish is a sweet or savory flaky pastry. It is filled with meat (mostly chicken or lamb) or fish and shrimp, mixed with cheese, lemon and pepper. They are wrapped in a paper-thin dough in a triangular or cylindrical shape. It can also be sweet, filled with almond or peanut paste and fried, then dipped in warm honey flavored with orange blossom water. It is fried or baked and then sprinkled with herbs, spices and sometimes with powdered sugar.

Name: Bruttiboni
Text Description: The dish is a type of hazelnut or almond-flavoured biscuit. These biscuits are made by incorporating meringue, which is an egg white and sugar mixture, with roasted chopped nuts. The biscuits are crunchy on the outside with a soft texture in the middle.

Name: Bundevara
Text Description: The dish is a sweet pie made of rolled phyllo, filled with sweetened grated pumpkin pulp and baked in an oven. Occasionally nutmeg, cinnamon or similar spices may be added, or raisins or grated lemon rinds. It is usually dusted with icing sugar and/or vanilla sugar, and is served hot or cold. The pumpkins (or squashes) with more intense coloured pulp (richer in carotene) are more appreciated.

Name: Butterkaka
Text Description: The dish is composed of rolled buns. The buns are made in the usual way, by rolling out the yeast dough, adding the almond–cinnamon filling, rolling it up, and cutting the log into smaller rolls. These are laid beside each other, with one cut surface down, in a baking pan (usually circular), and during the process of rising and baking, the buns stick together. It is often garnished with vanilla custard and glaze.

Name: Canelé
Text Description: The dish is a small pastry flavored with rum and vanilla with a soft and tender custard center and a dark, thick caramelized crust. It takes the shape of a small, striated cylinder up to five centimeters in height with a depression at the top.

Name: Carac
Text Description: The dish is a tart-like dessert pastry traditionally made of ingredients such as chocolate, cream, fondant, and shortbread pie crust. It consists of a pie crust filled with a light ganache of blended cream and chocolate that is covered with green colored icing or fondant.

Name: Chatti pathiri
Text Description: The dish uses pastry sheets or pancakes made with flour, egg, oil and water. The filling can be sweet, made with sweetened seasoned beaten eggs, nuts and raisins, or savoury, with the traditional meat filling used in samosas or savoury puffs. The flour is kneaded into soft dough and rolled into thin pancakes which are softened in milk and arranged in layers with filling between them and baked. It is considered an essential part of any festival, pre- and post-wedding events.

Name: Cheesymite scroll
Text Description: The dish is a savoury baked food. It consists of a spiral of baked bread similar to a pain aux raisins with a thick, dark brown food spread and cheese in place of raisins.

Name: Chouquette
Text Description: The dish are small pieces of pastry consisting of small spheres of choux pastry, sugared and baked. The dish was known in the 16th century, and was originally applied to small savoury spheres. Since the late 17th century it have been sweet.

Name: Choux pastry
Text Description: The dish is a delicate pastry dough used in many pastries. The essential ingredients are butter, water, flour and eggs. Instead of a raising agent, it employs its high moisture content to create steam, as the water in the dough evaporates when baked, puffing the pastry.

Name: Cinnamon roll
Text Description: The dish consists of a rolled sheet of yeast-leavened dough onto which a cinnamon and sugar mixture (and brown sugar, raisins or other ingredients in some cases) is sprinkled over a thin coat of butter. The dough is then rolled, cut into individual portions and baked.

Name: Coca
Text Description: The dish with four main varieties: sweet, savoury, closed and open. All of them use dough as the main ingredient, which is then decorated. This dough can be sweet or savoury. If it is sweet, eggs and sugar are added, and if it is savoury, yeast and salt. As regards the topping or filling, fish and Vegetable are usual at the coast whilst inland they prefer fruit, nuts, cheese and meat. It is almost any kind of bread-based product. Its size can vary from 5 cm up to 1 metre. There are various presentations: Sweet or savory, depending on the ingredients and condiments.Open or covered. The covered type with its filling on the inside. It can be both sweet and salty. The open type is the typical with its content on top. Most are like this.

Name: Conejito
Text Description: The dish is a pastry filled with custard, and not fried. The dough is made with flour, eggs, sugar, milk, leavening, and butter. The filling is made with corn starch, egg yolks, milk, sugar, and vanilla.

Name: Conversation tart
Text Description: The dish is a type of tart made with puff pastry that is filled with sweet almond custard cream and topped with royal icing.

Name: Cornulețe
Text Description: The dish is a pastry aromatised with vanilla or rum extract/essence, as well as lemon rind, and stuffed with Turkish delight, jam, chocolate, cinnamon sugar, walnuts, and/or raisins, with the shape representing a crescent

Name: Cream horn
Text Description: The dish is a pastry made with flaky pastry and whipped cream. The shape is made by winding overlapping pastry strips around a conical thin sheet metallic mold. After baking, a spoonful of jam or fruit is added and the pastry is then filled with whipped cream. The pastry can also be moistened and sprinkled with sugar before baking for a sweeter, crisp finish.

Name: Crêpes Suzette
Text Description: The dish is a dessert consisting of crepes with a sauce of caramelized sugar and butter, tangerine or orange juice, zest, and orange liqueur on top.

Name: Crocetta di Caltanissetta
Text Description: The dish is a traditional sweet pastry. It is made by almonds, sugar, sweet lemon purée, oranges or other fruit typical of the area, pistachio and icing sugar.

Name: Cronut
Text Description: The dish is a doughnut-like pastry made from croissant-like dough filled with flavored cream and fried in grapeseed oil.

Name: Croquembouche
Text Description: The dish is a dessert consisting of choux pastry puffs piled into a cone and bound with threads of caramel. It may also be decorated with other confectionery, such as sugared almonds, chocolate, and edible flowers.

Name: Curry puff
Text Description: This dish is a small pie consisting of curry with chicken and potatoes in a fried or baked pastry shell.

Name: Danish pastry
Text Description: This dish is a multilayered sweet pastry made with yeast dough of what flour, milk, eggs, sugar, and large amount of butter or margarine. Rolled out thinly and covered with a thin slices of butter between each layers.

Name: Egg yolk pastry
Text Description: The dish is a traditional cake of which the filling is made of salted duck egg yolk and red bean paste. It use naturally fermented salted egg yolks marinated in red soil with grape seed oil, and they are made with many layers.

Name: Empanada
Text Description: The dish is a baked or fried pastry with meat, cheese, tomato, corn, or other ingredients filling.

Name: Ensaïmada
Text Description: The dish is a pastry product made with flour, water, sugar, eggs, dough, and a reduced pork lard.

Name: Fazuelos
Text Description: The dish is a thin rolled pastry made of fried dough comprising flour, eggs, sugar, and oil. The dough is rolled thinly, cut into strips, and briefly fried. A syrup of water, orange blossom, and sugar is then prepared for additional flavor.

Name: Flaugnarde
Text Description: The dish is a baked dessert with fruit arranged in a buttered dish and covered with a thick flan-like batter. It is made with apples, peaches, pears, plums, prunes or other fruits. Resembling a sweet batter pudding or large pancake, the dish is dusted with confectioner's sugar and can be served either warm or cold.

Name: Flaó
Text Description: The dish is a cheesecake or tart. In some regions flaons are a type of crescent-shaped pie filled with jam and honey, or some type of cheese, varying according to the location. Honey was used traditionally, but in modern times sweet flaons are usually sweetened with sugar.

Name: Flies' graveyard
Text Description: The dish is nicknames of pastry, for sweet pastries filled with currants or raisins, which are jokingly said to resemble dead flies.

Name: Franzbrötchen
Text Description: The dish is a small, sweet pastry baked with butter and cinnamon. Sometimes other ingredients are used as well, such as chocolate or raisins. It is usually served for breakfast, but is also enjoyed along with coffee and cake. The ingredients of the dough include flour, butter, yeast, milk, sugar, and a pinch of salt. The filling is a mixture of sugar and cinnamon. Several times in succession, the dough is folded and rolled out thinly, and coated with butter. As soon as the dough is sufficiently outstretched to a filmy layer, it is moistened with a little water, sprinkled with a melange of sugar and cinnamon and finally rolled up.

Name: Gâteau Basque
Text Description: The dish is a traditional dessert, typically filled with black cherry jam or pastry cream. Typically it is constructed from layers of a butter-sugar wheat flour pastry dough with a filling of either black cherry jam or almond or vanilla pastry cream.

Name: Shorgoghal
Text Description: The dish is a traditional pastry in a round shape filled with anise or fennel seed, cumin, cinnamon, turmeric, salt and pepper.

Name: Gibanica
Text Description: The dish is usually made with cottage cheese and eggs. Recipes can range from sweet to savoury, and from simple to festive and elaborate multi-layered cakes.

Name: Gujhia
Text Description: The dish is a sweet, deep-fried pastry that is a popular dessert. This delicacy is made using either semolinaor all-purpose flour, which is stuffed with a mixture of sweetened milk solids, also called mawa and dried fruits. The dumpling is then fried in butter to give it a crispy texture.

Name: Gustavus Adolphus pastry
Text Description: The dish is a pastry. Recipes for the pastry vary locally but most versions have a portrait of the king on the top, usually made of chocolate or marzipan.

Name: Hwangnam-ppang
Text Description: The dish is a small pastry with a filling of red bean paste. It is made from a mixture of eggs and wheat flour, with the red bean filling being almost 70% of the pastry. A chrysanthemum would be traditionally imprinted on the top.

Name: Haddekuche
Text Description: The dish is a traditional pastry that resembles with a diamond-themed pattern imprinted on the pastry itself.

Name: Heong Peng
Text Description: These pastries, which resemble slightly flattened balls, contain a sweet sticky filling made from malt and shallots, which is covered by a flaky baked crust and garnished with sesame seeds on the surface.

Name: Hot cross bun
Text Description: The dish is a spiced bun, usually containing small pieces of fruit and marked with a cross on the top.

Name: Jachnun
Text Description: The dish is a pastry traditionally eaten in the morning with a local condiment, boiled eggs and a local spicy sauce.
