It is generally split horizontally and served toasted. It is frequently eaten with sweet or savoury toppings such as butter, fruit jam, honey, eggs, sausage, bacon, or cheese.

Name: Farl
Text Description: Any of various quadrant-shaped flatbreads and cakes, traditionally made by cutting a round into four pieces, made especially with oatmeal or wheat flour.

Name: French roll
Text Description: Refers to bread rolls in different regions around the world.

Name: Flatbrød
Text Description: A traditional unleavened bread which is usually eaten with fish, salted meats and soups. It is dry and free from water so it is possible to store it for a long period of time. The basic ingredients are barley flour, salt, and water, though many varieties exist which incorporate other staples.

Name: Flatkaka
Text Description: Unleavened rye flatbread that is soft, round, thin and dark with a characteristic pattern from the pan. Traditionally, it was baked on hot stones or straight on the embers of the fire, later on small but heavy cast iron frying pans, and today, when making the dish at home, people sometimes bake them directly on an electric hot plate to get the desired result.

Name: Fougasse
Text Description: It is used to make a regional version of a calzone, commonly filled with cheese and small strips of bacon inside the pocket made by folding the bread over. Other variations include dried fruit, a type of blue cheese and nuts, or olives and goat cheese.

Name: Fugazza
Text Description: A thick pizza crust topped with onions, cheese, and sometimes olives. It is derived from a combination of Neapolitan pizza with Italian focaccia bread.

Name: Graham bread
Text Description: The bread include Graham flour, milk, molasses, yeast, and salt.

Name: Cong you bing
Text Description: A savory, unleavened flatbread folded with oil and minced scallions (green onions). It is made from dough instead of batter. It is pan-fried, which gives it crisp edges and a chewy texture.

Name: Guokui
Text Description: The dish is a kind of flatbread made from flour. The dish is said to have been invented by a laborer who cooked flatbread in his iron helmet over a wood fire. It is round in shape, about a foot long in diameter, an inch in thickness, and weighs about 2.5 kg.

Name: Hallulla
Text Description: The dish is a popular bread. It is a flat round bread baked with vegetable (but sometimes also animal) shortening and is used for several traditional sandwiches. The traditional recipe includes wheat flour, yeast, sugar, salt, vegetable shortening, milk and water.

Name: Hardtack
Text Description: The dish is a type of dense biscuit or cracker made from flour, water, and sometimes salt. It is inexpensive and long-lasting. It is used for sustenance in the absence of perishable foods, commonly during long sea voyages, land migrations, and military campaigns.

Name: Himbasha
Text Description: The dish is a celebration bread that is slightly sweet. It often served at special occasions. The dough is given a decorative touch before baking. The design varies in detail, but in general, is given the shape of a wheel with indentations to create several spokes. Common additions to the recipe include candied orange, ginger, or ground cardamom seeds, although plain varieties are not unheard of.

Name: Hoagie roll
Text Description: The dish is a type of long roll used to prepare sandwiches. They are sometimes toasted before being used to prepare a sandwich. Ingredients used in it preparation may include flour, egg, milk, vegetable oil, salt, sugar and yeast. Some versions include sesame seeds atop the roll, which may add extra flavor and textural elements. Gluten-free and vegan recipes have been devised.

Name: Hot and spicy cheese bread
Text Description: The dish is a popular cheese bread. The bread is sold at farmer's markets across the city and at local bakeries. Today, the bread is made with a brioche-like yeasted dough, mixed with cheese, and topped with crushed hot red peppers. It also contains chives and parsley. The bread is often eaten as a snack bread, pulled apart and eaten while walking around the farmers market.

Name: Ka'ak
Text Description: The dish refer to several different types of baked goods. The bread is similar to a dry and hardened biscuit and mostly ring-shaped.

Name: Kamir
Text Description: The dish is a round-shaped bread that almost similar to pancake, consists of flour, butter, and egg mixture, sometimes mixed with other fillings ingredients such as banana, tapai, strawberry, pineapple, jackfruit, cheese, and chocolate.

Name: Khanom bueang
Text Description: The dish is an ancient snack known as crispy pancakes. It is a popular form of street food. These crepes resemble tacos. They are usually first topped or filled with meringue, followed by sweet or salty toppings such as shredded coconut, strips of fried eggs or egg yolks, or chopped scallions.

Name: Khakhra
Text Description: The dish is a thin cracker. It is made from mat bean, wheat flour and oil.

Name: Kitcha
Text Description: The dish is a relatively thin unleavened bread. It is generally made with wheat flour, water, and salt. It is cooked in a hot pan free-form until one side is cooked. It is then picked up and cooked on the other side. Slight burning on each side is often seen. It will take the shape of the pan in which it is cooked (much like a pancake, though it bears no relation).

Name: Kulcha
Text Description: The dish is a term for a disc-shaped loaf of leavened bread. It describes a disc-shaped loaf of bread, bun or even biscuit. It made from maida flour, water, a pinch of salt and a leavening agent (yeast, sourdough or old dough), mixed together by hand to make a soft dough. This dough is covered with a wet cloth and left to rest for an hour or so in a warm place. The result is a slight leavening of the dough but not much. The flour is kneaded again by hand and then rolled out using a rolling pin into a flat, round shape. In commercial establishments, it is baked in an earthen clay oven until done. After cooking, it is taken off the fire and optionally brushed with butter or ghee for a shiny, appetizing appearance.

Name: Lagana
Text Description: The dish is a flatbread. Traditionally, it was prepared unleavened (without the yeast), but leavened is nowadays more common. It is typically flat, oval-shaped, with surface decorated by impressing fingertips.

Name: Lahoh
Text Description: The dish is a spongy, flat pancake-like bread. It is a type of flat bread. It is traditionally and typically prepared from a thick batter of sorghum flour, White cornmeal/cornflour, warm water, yeast, and a pinch of salt. The mixture is beaten by hand until soft and creamy. The batter is then left to ferment overnight to cook and then eat for breakfast. There is a sweet-tasting variety of the dish, one made with eggs.  It is traditionally baked on a metallic circular stove. Lacking that, it can also be baked in an ordinary pan.

Name: Lángos
Text Description: The dish is a deep fried flatbread, but in the past it was made of the last bits of the bread-dough and baked at the front of a brick or clay oven, to be served hot as the breakfast of the bread-baking day.

Name: Laobing
Text Description: The dish is a type of unleavened flatbread popular. It can be the size of a large pizza, about one centimeter thick, and is doughy and chewy in texture. It is made by pan frying a rolled and layered unleavened dough consisting of salt, flour, and water. Most are plain, although some have scallions or brown sugar inside the pastry. It is usually cut into slices and served as a staple food, or can be stir-fried with meat and vegetable to make stir-fried pancakes.

Name: Laufabrauð
Text Description: The dish is a traditional kind of bread. It consists of round, very thin flat cakes with a diameter of about 15 to 20 cm (6 to 8 inches), decorated with leaf-like, geometric patterns and fried briefly in hot tallow or oil.

Name: Limpa
Text Description: The dish is a sweet rye bread. It is a yeast-leavened spice loaf, sweetened with brown sugar and molasses which comes in a large variety in regard to whether or not butter-enriched, and which spices are being used. Traditional bread spices are anise, caraway, fennel seeds, and bitter orange. Typically baked during the Christmas season, the festive wort breads/loaves are flavoured with spices like anise, caraway, and fennel seeds, and often orange rinds, raisins or sultanas, and dark beer, in addition to the wort. Its distinct taste and look is in large part due to the addition of wort to the dough, making it similar to a malt loaf. It is a typical dish for a traditional Christmas Eve. It pairs well with jams and jellies, or cream cheese.

Name: Lavash
Text Description: This dish is a thin flatbread that is usually leavened. Traditionally the dough is rolled out flat and slapped against the hot walls of a clay oven, but modern recipes may adapt for cooking on a wok.

Name: Lefse
Text Description: The dish is made with riced potatoes, can include all purpose (wheat) flour, and includes butter, and milk, cream, or lard.

Name: Lye roll
Text Description: The dish is typically covered with salt, preferably pretzel salt.

Name: Maluj
Text Description: The dish is typically made with flour, cooking oil, yeast, fenugreek, and salt.

Name: Maltese bread
Text Description: The dish is typically eaten with spread olive oil, where the bread is rubbed with tomatoes or tomato paste, drizzled with olive oil and filled with a choice or mix of tuna, olives, capers, onion, bigilla and ġbejna.

Name: Markook
Text Description: The dish is a type of thin bread. The dough is unleavened and usually made with only flour, water, and salt, and after being rested and divided into round portions, flattened and spread across a round cushion until it is thin then flipped onto the saj.

Name: Mohnflesserl
Text Description: The dish is in the form of a braided bun. It is typically sprinkled with poppy seeds , salt, and sometimes served glazed.

Name: Michetta
Text Description: The dish is a bread recognizable by its bulged shape.

Name: Pain de campagne
Text Description: The dish is a bread made with a combination of white flour with whole wheat flour and/or rye flour, water, leavening and salt.

Name: Melonpan
Text Description: The dish is a sweetbun covered in a layer of crispy cookie dough.

Name: Matzah
Text Description: The dish is an unleavened flatbread made from flour and water. It is also an integral element of a relogious festival.

Name: Shotis puri
Text Description: The dish is a bread made of white flour and shaped like a canoe.

Name: Marraqueta
Text Description: The dish is a bread roll made with wheat flour, salt, water and yeast and has a crusty exterior.

Name: Japanese milk bread
Text Description: The dish is a bread made of flour, whole milk, butter, yeast, salt, sugar and often eggs.

Name: Sheermal
Text Description: The dish is a saffron-flavored traditional flatbread.

Name: Shaobing
Text Description: The dish is a type of baked, unleavened, layered flatbread. It is can be made with or without stuffing, and with or without sesame on top.

Name: Sgabeo
Text Description: The dish is leavened bread dough, cut into strips, fried and salted on the surface that is traditionally eaten plain or stuffed with cheese or cold cuts.

Name: Scallion bread
Text Description: The dish is characterized by its green onion topping and use of traditional lard, featuring a soft, fluffy texture and a distinctive aroma

Name: Scone
Text Description: The dish is usually made of either wheat flour or oatmeal, with baking powder as a leavening agent, and baked on sheet pans.

Name: Sangak
Text Description: The dish is is a plain, rectangular or triangular whole wheat leavened flatbread.

Name: Sandwich roll
Text Description: The dish is a type of white bread usually made from wheat flour, yeast, water and salt

Name: Salt-rising bread
Text Description: The dish is a dense white bread leavened by naturally occurring wild bacteria rather than by yeast.

Name: Samoon
Text Description: The dish is a type of yeast bread. It is baked in traditional stone ovens.

Name: Manda roti
Text Description: This dish is extremely thin and limp, and served folded like a handkerchief.

Name: Rugbrød
Text Description: The dish is made with rye flour as the basic ingredient, which produces a plain or "old-fashioned" bread with a uniform, somewhat heavy structure.

Name: Roti canai
Text Description: The dish is a flatbread made from dough that is composed of fat (usually ghee), flour, and water; some recipes also include sweetened condensed milk.

Name: Roti buaya
Text Description: The dish is two piece sweetened bread in the shape of a crocodile.

Name: Piadina romagnola
Text Description: The dish is a thin flatbread, usually made with white flour, lard or olive oil, salt, and water.

Name: Paratha
Countries: ["India", "Sri Lanka", "Bangladesh", "Fiji", "Guyana", "Malaysia", "Maldives", "Thailand", "Myanmar", "Nepal", "Pakistan", "Bahrain", "Cyprus", "Egypt", "Iran", "Iraq", "Israel", "Jordan", "Kuwait", "Lebanon", "Oman", "Palestine", "Qatar", "Saudi Arabia", "Syria", "United Arab Emirates", "Yemen", "Singapore", "Suriname", "Trinidad and Tobago"]
Text Description: The dish is a kine of unleavened flatbreads made by baking or cooking whole-wheat dough on a tava, and finishing off with shallow-frying.

Name: Panettone
Text Description: The dish is characterized by its cupola shape, which extends from a cylindrical base and is usually about 12–15 cm (4.7–5.9 in) high for a dish weighing 1 kg (2.2 lb).

Name: Pane di Altamura
Text Description: The dish is a type of naturally leavened bread made from remilled durum wheat semolina.

Name: Pandesal
Text Description: The dish is a bread roll made of flour, yeast, sugar, oil, and salt.

Name: Obwarzanek krakowski
Text Description: The dish is a braided ring-shaped bread that is boiled and sprinkled with salt and sesame or poppy seeds before being baked.

Name: Msemmen
Text Description: The dish is a flatbread folded into square pancakes with multiple internal layers and cooked on a griddle, usually served with honey or a cup of aromatic morning mint tea or coffee.

Name: Montreal-style bagel
Text Description: The dish contains malt, egg, and no salt, and is boiled in honey-sweetened water before being baked.

Name: Mollete
Text Description: The dish is a soft round white bread, usually served lightly toasted with olive oil and raw garlic or spread with lard.

Name: Pain de mie
Text Description: The dish is a white or brown bread with a thin, soft crust.

Name: Pao Alentejano
Text Description: The dish is a traditional wheat bread containing only wheat flour, yeast or leftover bread dough, salt, and water.

Name: Pan brioche
Text Description: The dish is a kind of bread similar to a pastry of whose high egg and butter content gives it a rich and tender crumb.

Name: Pane ticinese
Text Description: The dish is composed of several small loaves or rolls made to be broken off by hand—and by the addition of oil to the dough, which makes the bread particularly soft.

Name: Papadam
Countries: ["India", "Pakistan", "Bangladesh", "Nepal", "Sri Lanka", "Antigua and Barbuda", "Bahamas", "Barbados", "Cuba", "Dominica", "Dominican Republic", "Grenada", "Haiti", "Jamaica", "Saint Kitts and Nevis", "Saint Lucia", "Saint Vincent and the Grenadines", "Trinidad and Tobago"]
Text Description: The dish is made from dough of black gram bean flour, which is either deep fried or cooked with dry heat by being flipped over an open flame until crunchy.

Name: Parotta
Text Description: The dish is a flaky and layered flatbread, and is prepared by kneading maida/wheat flour, egg (in some recipes), oil or ghee and water.

Name: Peg bread
Text Description: The dish is a bread that usually served along with tea in the morning.

Name: Pistolet
Text Description: The dish is a bread with light, airy and delicate on the inside, with a crisp crust.

Name: Portuguese sweet bread
Text Description: The dish is a bread made by flour, milk, sugar, eggs, yeast, sea salt, butter or olive oil.

Name: Potato bread
Text Description: The dish is a form of bread in which potato flour or potato replaces a portion of the regular wheat flour.

Name: Potbrood
Text Description: The dish is a bread traditionally baked in a cast-iron pot in a pit made in the ground and lined with hot coals.

Name: Proja
Text Description: The dish is made of corn flour, baking powder, sunflower oil, sparkling water and salt.

Name: Pumpernickel
Text Description: The dish is a typically dense, slightly sweet rye bread traditionally made with sourdough starter and coarsely ground rye.

Name: Pumpkin bread
Text Description: The dish is a type of moist quick bread made with pumpkin.

Name: Puran poli
Text Description: The dish is a flatbread made of a variant of chick pea, wheat flour, sugar, a type of clarified butter, jaggery.

Name: Roti bolen
Text Description: The dish is a kind of baked bread pastry with crust layers similar to those of croissant, made from flour with butter or margarine layers, filled with cheese and banana.

Name: Qistibi
Text Description: The dish is a roasted flatbread with various fillings inside. The dough should be unleavened. The most popular filling is mashed potato but it may also be ragout or millet.

Name: Rieska
Text Description: The dish is an unleavened, usually barley-based, soft flatbread. The simple version contains only flour, salt, and water, but industrial bakeries usually use yeast as well.

Name: Röggelchen
Text Description: The dish is a small pastry in the form of a double roll made from two pieces of dough. The rye content must be at least 50% of the flour. The rye dough consists of a bread roll dough to which rye flour or sourdough is added.

Name: Roti
Text Description: The dish is a round flatbread made from stoneground whole wheat flour

Name: Coco bread
Text Description: The dish is a bread that contains milk or coconut milk and is starchy and slightly sweet in taste.

Name: Goat curry
Text Description: The dish is a curry dish prepared with goat meat.

Name: Chicken curry
Countries: ["India", "Antigua and Barbuda", "Bahamas", "Barbados", "Cuba", "Dominica", "Dominican Republic", "Grenada", "Haiti", "Jamaica", "Saint Kitts and Nevis", "Saint Lucia", "Saint Vincent and the Grenadines", "Trinidad and Tobago", "Thailand", "Cambodia", "Philippines", "Myanmar", "Malaysia"]
Text Description: The dish consists of chicken stewed in an onion- and tomato-based sauce, flavoured with ginger, garlic, tomato puree, chilli peppers and a variety of spices.

Name: Escabeche
Text Description: The dish is made of marinated fish, meat or Vegetable, cooked or pickled in an acidic sauce (usually with vinegar), and flavored with paprika, citrus, and other spices.

Name: Arsik
Text Description: The dish is a kind of spicy fish stew, usually using common carp.

Name: Run down
Text Description: The dish consists of a stew made up of reduced coconut milk, with different types of seafood , plantain, yam, tomato, onion, and seasonings.

Name: Gizzada
Text Description: The dish is contained in a small, crisp pastry shell with a pinched crust and filled with a sweet and spiced coconut filling.

Name: Water biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a kind of thin, hard and brittle biscuit, and usually served with cheese or wine.

Name: Taro dumpling
Text Description: The dish is made from a thick layer of taro that has been boiled and mashed. The filling is made from seasoned ground pork. The dumpling is deep fried, and the outermost layer of taro becomes crisp, light, and fluffy.

Name: Stamp and Go
Text Description: The dish is made with salt fish.

Name: Solomon Gundy
Text Description: The dish  is made with smoked red herring and is minced and spiced with Scotch Bonnet peppers and seasonings.

Name: Rum cake
Countries: ["Antigua and Barbuda", "Bahamas", "Barbados", "Cuba", "Dominica", "Dominican Republic", "Grenada", "Haiti", "Jamaica", "Saint Kitts and Nevis", "Saint Lucia", "Saint Vincent and the Grenadines", "Trinidad and Tobago"]
Text Description: The dish is similar to a fruitcake, with a lighter texture.

Name: Bulla cake
Text Description: The dish is a rich cake made with molasses and spiced with ginger and nutmeg, sometimes dark-colored and other times light-colored.

Name: Rock cake
Text Description: The dish is a small cake with a rough surface resembling a rock.

Name: Toto
Text Description: The dish is a kind of  small coconut cake prepared with shredded coconut, brown sugar, flour, baking soda and powder, and coconut milk.

Name: Caviar
Text Description: The dish is eaten as a garnish or spread.

Name: Kholodets
Text Description: The dish is a savory gelatin made with a meat stock or broth, set in a mold to encase other ingredients.These often include pieces of meat, seafood, vegetable, or eggs.

Name: Salo
Text Description: The dish consists of salt-cured slabs of pork subcutaneous fat with or without skin and with or without layers of meat.

Name: Stroganina
Text Description: The dish consists of raw, thin, long-sliced frozen fish.

Name: Zakuski
Text Description: The dish may include cold cuts, cured fishes, mixed salads, kholodets, pirogs or pirozhki, various pickled vegetables such as beets, cucumbers, sauerkraut, pickled mushrooms, deviled eggs, hard cheeses, caviar, canapés, open sandwiches, and breads.

Name: Okroshka
Text Description: The dish is a mix of mostly raw vegetables (like cucumbers, radishes and spring onions), boiled potatoes, eggs, cooked meat such as beef, veal, sausages or ham and kvass.

Name: Rassolnik
Text Description: The dish is a kind of soup made from pickled cucumbers, pearl barley, and pork or beef kidneys.

Name: Shchi
Text Description: The dish is a kind of cabbage soup.

Name: Solyanka
Text Description: A thick sour soup with cabbage, salted cucumbers, meat, poultry, fish, or mushrooms

Name: Sorrel soup
Text Description: A soup made from water or broth, sorrel leaves, and salt. Usually includes further ingredients such as egg yolks or whole eggs (hard-boiled or scrambled), potatoes, carrots, parsley root, and rice.

Name: Ukha
Text Description: A clear soup, made from various types of fish such as bream, wels catfish, northern pike, or even ruffe

Name: Dressed herring
Text Description: A layered salad composed of diced spekesild covered with layers of grated boiled eggs, Vegetable (potatoes, carrots, beetroots), chopped onions, and mayonnaise

Name: Mimosa salad
Text Description: Salad with main ingredients are cheese, eggs, canned fish, onion, and mayonnaise

Name: Olivier salad
Text Description: Salad dish consisted of diced boiled potatoes, carrots and brined dill pickles (or cucumber), together with vegetable or fruit, meat, mixed with with salt, pepper and mustard, and dressed with mayonnaise

Name: Vinegret
Text Description: Salad dish consisted of diced cooked Vegetable (red beets, potatoes, carrots), chopped onions, as well as sauerkraut and/or brined pickles.

Name: Syrniki
Text Description: Pancake made of creamy fermented milk, mixed with flour, eggs and sugar, sometimes adding vanilla extract, mix well and then pan-fried or shallow-fried.

Name: Veal Orloff
Text Description: The dish consists of thinly sliced braised loin of veal, with duxelles and soubise layered between the slices, topped with Mornay sauce, and browned in the oven.

Name: Chicken Kiev
Text Description: A dish made of chicken fillet pounded and rolled around cold butter, then coated with egg and bread crumbs, and either fried or baked.

Name: Beef Stroganoff
Text Description: A dish of sautéed pieces of beef in a sauce of mustard and smetana (sour cream).

Name: Makarony po-flotski
Text Description: The dish made of cooked pasta (typically macaroni, penne or fusilli) mixed with stuffing made of stewed ground meat (usually beef or pork) and fried onions, and seasoned with salt and black pepper

Name: Pozharsky cutlet
Text Description: A breaded ground chicken or veal patty

Name: Korovai
Text Description: A large round braided bread, traditionally baked from wheat flour and decorated with symbolic flags and figurines, such as suns, moons, birds, animals, and pine cones

Name: Zefir
Text Description: The dish is made by whipping fruit and berry purée (mostly apple puree) with sugar and egg whites with subsequent addition of a gelling agent like pectin, carrageenan, agar, or gelatine

Name: Varenye
Text Description: Whole fruit preservation made by cooking berries, other fruits, or more rarely nuts, Vegetable, or flowers, in sugar syrup (sometimes honey)

Name: Pyshka
Text Description: This dish is similar to doughnut, either ring-shaped or without a hole.

Name: Angel wings
Text Description: A traditional sweet crisp pastry made out of dough that has been shaped into thin twisted ribbons, deep-fried and sprinkled with powdered sugar.

Name: Smetana
Text Description: A dairy product produced by souring heavy cream

Name: Charlotte
Text Description: Baked pudding made of bread, sponge cake, crumbs or biscuits/cookies that are mold and then filled with a fruit puree or custard. It can be served hot or cold

Name: Rasstegai
Text Description: This pastry has a hole in the center, which is stuffed with a wide variety of fillings – from liver with eggs to rice with mushrooms. However, the traditional stuffing is minced fish such as sturgeon or salmon.

Name: Kulich
Text Description: This bread is round and tall, and dough decorations were made on top of it.

Name: Kutia
Text Description: This dish is a ceremonial grain dish with sweet gravy traditionally served during the Christmas – Feast of Jordan holiday season or as part of a funeral feast. The main ingredients are wheatberries, poppy seeds, honey or sugar, various nuts and sometimes raisins.

Name: Guryev porridge
Text Description: This dish is a sweet porridge prepared from semolina and milk with the addition of candied nuts (hazelnut, walnuts, almonds), honey and dried fruits (or fruit preserves).

Name: Pease pudding
Text Description: This dish is made of boiled legumes, typically split yellow peas, with water, salt and spices, and often cooked with a bacon or ham joint.

Name: Kasha
Text Description: This dish can be baked but most often is boiled, either in water or milk. The main ingredients are cereal (buckwheat, wheat, barley, oats, millet or rye).

Name: Medovik
Text Description: It is a dessert which is known for its lengthy preparation time. It consists of layers of cake with a cream filling and is often covered with nuts or crumbs made from leftover cake. While the thin layers harden shortly after coming out of the oven, the moisture of the filling softens it again over time.

Name: Paskha
Text Description: It is a molded dessert that is made of cheese (such as cottage cheese), cream, and usually raisins, candied fruit, and almonds and that is traditionally served at Easter.

Name: Curd snack
Text Description: The main part this snack is made from cheese, which is mixed with sugar, sweeteners or other ingredients and milled into a homogenous paste that is pressed into the desired shape and filled with jam or other fillings. The formed bars then pass through the so-called "glaze waterfall" that coats them in chocolate or another type of glaze. Finally, the snacks are cooled in a cooling tunnel and packed.

Name: Pastila
Text Description: It is a small squares of pressed fruit paste or a light, airy puffs with a delicate apple flavor.

Name: Achu
Text Description: The dish is a soup made with cocoyam. Spices, water, palm oil, limestone, and fish are other ingredients.

Name: Pryanik
Text Description: These sweets refer to a range of traditional sweet-baked goods and are made from flour and honey.

Name: Ahriche
Text Description: It is a dish of tripe usually consisting of ganglion, caul, lung or heart of an animal wound with intestines on a stick of oak and cooked on hot coals

Name: Alloco
Text Description: It is commonly made from cut plantains in slices, fry them until they are yellow, smash them between two plates and fry them again.

Name: Amala
Text Description: It is made of yam, cassava flour, or unripe plantain flour.

Name: Asida
Text Description: It is a lump of dough, obtained by stirring wheat flour into boiling water, sometimes with added butter or honey.

Name: Boerewors
Text Description: This dish is made from coarsely minced beef, minced pork, lamb and or goat. It also contains spices (usually toasted coriander seed, black pepper, nutmeg, cloves and allspice).

Name: Bichak
Text Description: This dish is a stuffed baked or fried pastry that comes in different forms (round, triangle, quadrangle) appetizer.

Name: Yassa
Text Description: This dish is a spicy dish prepared with onions and either marinated poultry, marinated fish or marinated lamb.

Name: Waterblommetjiebredie
Text Description: This dish is made of meat, typically lamb, stewed together with the Aponogeton distachyos flowers.

Name: Wat
Text Description: This dish is a stew that may be prepared with chicken, beef, lamb, a variety of Vegetable, spice mixtures.

Name: Usban
Text Description: This dish is a traditional kind of sausage stuffed with a mixture of rice, herbs, lamb, chopped liver and heart. This dish is usually served alongside the main meal of rice or couscous, often on special occasions.

Name: Umngqusho
Text Description: This dish is based on dried corn and sugar beans, usually served with hard body chicken.

Name: Tapalapa
Text Description: This dish is a traditional bread based on the baguette, though it is slightly smaller, and baked in a large, traditional wood-burning oven made of mud brick. The main ingredients are flour (both wheat and millet are used), salt, water and yeast. The resulting bread is heavier and more filling than a typical baguette.

Name: Tomato bredie
Text Description: This dish is cooked for a very long time, and its seasonings include cinnamon, cardamom, ginger and cloves as well as chilli.

Name: Thieboudienne
Text Description: This dish is prepared with fish, broken rice and tomato sauce cooked in one pot. Additional ingredients often include onions, carrots, cabbage, cassava, hot pepper, lime and peanut oil, and stock cubes.

Name: Tapioca pudding
Text Description: This dish is a sweet pudding made with tapioca and either milk or cream. Coconut milk is also used in cases in which the flavour is preferred or in areas in which it is a commonplace ingredient for cooking. It is made in many cultures with equally varying styles, and may be produced in a variety of ways.

Name: Tajine
Text Description: This dish consists of meat, fruit, Vegetable, and spices that are cooked together very slowly.

Name: Sosatie
Text Description: This dish is a traditional dish of meat (usually lamb or mutton) cooked on skewers. The ingredients can include cubes of lamb, beef, chicken, dried apricots, red onions and mixed peppers.

Name: Chakalaka
Text Description: This dish is usually spicy, that is traditionally served with bread, pap, samp, stews, or curries.

Name: Chakhchoukha
Text Description: This stew is made from torn or rolled pieces of cooked semolina dough that are served in a flavorful tomato-based sauce.

Name: Cocada amarela
Text Description: This dessert is made from eggs and coconut. It has a distinctive yellow colour due to the large quantity of eggs used.

Name: Dabo kolo
Text Description: This dish is a finger food consisting of small pieces of spiced fried dough. It is prepared by frying small pieces of dough cut from rolls.

Name: Dambou
Text Description: This dish is consumed at any time but mainly during festive occasions such as outdoorings and weddings. For a simple dish, cooks mostly use either: rice flour or fine hard wheat semolina (couscous semolina) or millet, wheat or corn couscous.

Name: Delele
Text Description: This dish is prepared with baking soda and well known for its slimy texture. It can be dried before cooking, but more frequently it is cooked fresh.

Name: Draw soup
Text Description: This dish is made from okra, ogbono (Irvingia gabonensis), or ewedu leaves (jute). The name derives from the thick viscosity characteristic of the broth as it draws out of the bowl when eaten either with a spoon or, more characteristically, by dipping a small piece of solid sticky dough into it.

Name: Droëwors
Text Description: This snack is based on the traditional, coriander-seed spiced sausage. It is usually made as a thin sausage rather than thick sausage, as the thinner sausage dries quicker and is thus, less likely to spoil before it can be preserved.

Name: Eba
Text Description: This dish is rich in starch and carbohydrates. It is a cooked starchy vegetable food made from dried grated cassava flour. It is often eaten with rich soups and stews, with beef, stockfish or mutton. The dish is often described as having a slightly sour, sharp taste.

Name: Echicha
Text Description: This dish is made by steaming the dried cocoyam and Pigeon pea until they are soft, then mixing the two thoroughly with a sauce made of palm oil, seed of the oil bean tree, onions, fresh pepper, and salt.

Name: Edikang ikong
Text Description: This dish is a nutritious soup and expensive to prepare, and has been described as being mostly eaten by rich people. Ingredients used in this dish include beef and dried fish, bush meat, crayfish, cow tripe, kanda, pumpkin leaves, water leaves, ugu, onion, periwinkle, palm oil, salt and pepper

Name: Eru
Text Description: This dish is made up of finely shredded leaves of a species of vine. This dish is cooked with waterleaf or spinach, palm oil, crayfish, and either smoked fish, cow skin or beef.

Name: Ekwang
Text Description: This dish is a freshly grated cocoyams wrapped in cocoyam leaves with fresh or smoked fish, meat, palm oil, crayfish, and seasoning.

Name: Ewa aganyin
Text Description: The dish is a beans cooked until extermely soft and then mashed, usually accompanied with peppers, onion, ginger, dried chilies, and palm oil.

Name: Fesikh
Text Description: The dish is a salted pickled fermented and dried gray mullet or whitefish.

Name: Fit-fit
Text Description: The dish is a shredded flat bread with spiced butter and jalapeno peppers.

Name: Frikkadel
Text Description: The dish is a baked or deep-fried meatballs prepared with onion, bread, eggs, vinegar, and spices.

Name: Genfo
Text Description: The dish is a stiff porridge served with dipping sauce and mixture of butter and red peppers.

Name: Mugoyo
Text Description: The dish is a sweet potates and beans.

Name: Ogi
Text Description: The dish is a maize or corn pudding soaked in water and grinded to remove husks.

Name: Mandazi
Text Description: The dish is a fried bread also known as bofrot or puff puff made from water, sugar, yeast, and coconut milk.

Name: Lamington
Text Description: The dish is a butter cake or sponge cake coated with outler layer of chocolate sauce and grated coconut.

Name: Shark chutney
Text Description: The dish is a boiled skinned shark, mashed and cooked with juice and lime.

Name: Peanut stew
Text Description: The dish is a stew made from peanut butter sauce.

Name: Mala Mogodu
Text Description: The dish is a combination of chopped tripe and intestines served with dumpling.

Name: Lablabi
Text Description: The dish is a chickpeas in a thin garlic and cumin broth with crusty bread.

Name: Kapana
Text Description: The dish is a grilled meat by grilling it on an open fire.

Name: Kamounia
Text Description: The dish is a beef and liver stew prepared with cumin.

Name: Hertzoggie
Text Description: The dish is a jam-fileed tartlet or cookie commonly served on a cup pastry base.

Name: Gored gored
Text Description: The dish is a raw beef dish with cube shape.

Name: Gatsby
Text Description: The dish is a bread roll filled with chips, calamaris, seafood, and fillings with sauces.

Name: Isi ewu
Text Description: The dish is a soup made with a goat's head with nutmeg, onion, potash, palm oil.

Name: Shiro
Text Description: The dish is a chickpeas stew with broad bean. minced onions, garlic, and ginger or chopped tomatoes.

Name: Kokonte
Text Description: The dish is a brow, grey, and deep grean stew made of dried cassava or yam.

Name: Méchoui
Text Description: The dish is a whole sheep or lamb spit-roasted on a barbecue.

Name: Shahan ful
Text Description: The dish is a slow-cooked fava beans in water, cruhed into a coarse paste.

Name: Seswaa
Text Description: The dish is made of beef or goat leftover cuts, boiled in a pot.

Name: Shish taouk
Text Description: The dish is a chicken kebab ccoked in a satay form.

Name: Ogbono soup
Text Description: The dish is a soup made with dried seeds, cooked with water, palm oil, with fish or meat seasonings.

Name: Mealie bread
Text Description: The dish is a bread baked with creamed corn with butter.

Name: Qatayef
Text Description: The dish is a sweet dumpling filled with cream or nuts, or a folded pancake.

Name: Peppersoup
Text Description: The dish is a fish or meat soup, made with chili peppers, salt, scent leave and calabash nutmeg.

Name: Okpa
Text Description: The dish is made from nut, flour, pepper, palm oil, and seasoning with yellow or white color.

Name: Spicy cow feet
Text Description: The dish is a soup made of upper cut of cow feet with palm oil, potash, nutmegs, and seasonings.

Name: Ndolé
Text Description: The dish is a stewed nuts, containing beef or fish as the source of protein.

Name: Mulukhiyah
Text Description: The dish is a soup made of jute leaves resulting in thick liquid or broth, chopped with garlic, cilantro, and dressed with oil.

Name: Mrouzia
Text Description: The dish is a sweet and salty meat with blend of spices of honey, cinnamon, and almonds.

Name: Moambe chicken
Text Description: The dish is a savory chicken with spices and palm butter.

Name: Mesfouf
Text Description: The dish is made of peas and beans with sweet taste accompanied by butter and olive oil.

Name: Merguez
Text Description: The dish is a lamb or beef based fresh sausage.

Name: Matbucha
Text Description: The dish is a condiment or cooked salad consisting of cooked tomatoes with roasted bell peppers seasoned with garlic and chili pepper.

Name: Malva pudding
Text Description: The dish is a spongy caramelised texture pudding, made with apricot jam, served with custard and/or ice cream.

Name: Kuli-kuli
Text Description: The dish is a crispy snack made from peanuts with a mixture of cassave flakes, sugar and water.

Name: Koeksister
Text Description: The dish is a confectionery made of fried dough infused in syrup or honey.

Name: Kenkey
Text Description: The dish is a sourdough dumplings served pepper, fried fish, soup, or stew.

Name: Kelewele
Text Description: The dish is a fried plaintains seasoned with spices, with crisp textures.

Name: Kedjenou
Text Description: The dish is a spicy stew with a slow-cooked in a sealed pot, prepared with chicken or hen and Vegetable.

Name: Kachumbari
Text Description: The dish is a fresh tomato and onion salad dish with chopped tomatoes, onions, and chili peppers.

Name: Iru
Text Description: The dish is a type of fermented of processed locust bens used as a condiment in cooking.

Name: Hawawshi
Text Description: The dish is a pita stuffed with minced meat and spiced with onions, pepper, parsley, and sometimes chilies.

Name: Harira
Text Description: The dish is a soup made with lemon juic and egg to brighten the color and spice up the flavor.

Name: Brik
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed pastry, deep fried with triangular pastry shape. It is made by slapping a sticky lump of dough onto a hot non-stick surface in overlapping circles to produce the desired size and cooked for a short amount of time. Typical fillings include tuna, ground meat, raw egg, chicken, or anchovies garnished with harissa, capers, or cheese.

Name: Kibbeh nayyeh
Text Description: The dish is a minced raw lamb or beef mixed with fine spices.

Name: Kashk bademjan
Text Description: The dish is made with eggplant and dairy products served as a dip and garnished with saffron, sauteed onions, garlic, and often walnuts.

Name: Freekeh
Text Description: The dish is a roasted and rubbed macarroni wheat.

Name: Ageh
Text Description: The dish is a piece of fried tofu stuffed with noodles.

Name: Tihlo
Text Description: The dish is a barley dough balls covered with meat and sauce.

Name: Chả giò
Text Description: The dish is a fried egg roll with ground meat, usually pork.

Name: Chiles en nogada
Text Description: The dish is a pepper chiles stuffed with a mixture of shredded meat, aromatics, fruits and spices, topped with a walnut-based cream.

Name: Cordon bleu
Text Description: The dish is a meat wrapped around cheese then breaded and pan-fried or deep-fried.

Name: Deviled egg
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed eggs, curry eggs, or dressed eggs, are hard-boiled, peeled egg mixed with other ingredients such as mayonnaise and mustard, or other toppings.

Name: Drob
Text Description: The dish is a lamb offals with green onions, herbs, eggs, and bread, soaked in water or milk. It can be accompanied with other ingredients like Vegetable.

Name: Eggah
Text Description: The dish is an egg dish spiced with pepper, cinnamon, cumin, coriander seeds, turmeric, nutmeg, and fresh herbs.

Name: Figolla
Text Description: The dish is a unique shaped stuffed pastry with filling served as sweet. The biscuit base is predominantly made of plain flour, butter/margarine, caster sugar, vanilla essence, eggs, lemon rind and water. The filling is made of ground almonds, caster sugar, egg whites, and almond essence. Some may also add orange rind or more lemon.

Name: Galantine
Text Description: The dish of boned, stuffed meat, most commonly poultry or fish, usually poached and served cold coated with meat jelly.

Name: Ghapama
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed pumpkin stew prepared by removing the guts of the pumpkin and stuffed with boiled rice and dried fruits.

Name: Gołąbki
Text Description: The dish is a cabbage leaves wrapped around a filling of minced pork or beef, chopped onions, and rice.

Name: Samgye-tang
Text Description: The dish is a chicken soup filled with garlic, rice, jujube, and ginseng.

Name: Sakhu sai mu
Text Description: The dish is a tapioca balls made with starch with pork fillings.

Name: Stuffed crust pizza
Text Description: The dish is a pizza with other ingredients added into the outer edge of the crust.

Name: Stuffed pizza
Text Description: The dish is a pizza which has typical deeper dough and another layering of dough covering the toppings.

Name: Scaccia
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed flatbread made with very thin rectangular layer of dough, folded itself with cheese, onion, tomato, and eggplant.

Name: Badrijani
Text Description: The dish is a fried eggplant stuffed with spiced walnut and garlic paste, topped with pomegrenate seeds.

Name: Paçanga böreği
Text Description: The dish is a fried pastry filled with cheese, tomato, parsley and pepper.

Name: Walnut stuffed figs
Text Description: The dish is a figs, warm water to soak the figs, walnuts, milk, water, sugar, butter.

Name: Tufahije
Text Description: The dish is a walnut-stuffed apples poached in sugar water.

Name: Stuffed apples
Text Description: The dish is an apple sutffed with lamb meat and rice.

Name: Stuffed quinces
Text Description: The dish is made from quinces stuffed with meat lamb and rice.

Name: Stuffed dates
Text Description: The dish is a heated dates filled with meat, mint, and parsley with different stuffing including butters and goat cheese.

Name: Pizza snack rolls
Text Description: The dish is a rolled pizza consisting of bite-sized breaded pizza pockets with a fillings of tomato sauce, imitation cheese, and various pizza toppings.

Name: Calzone
Text Description: The dish is a oven-baked turnover pizza made with leavened dough.

Name: Tortellini
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed with a mix of meat parmesan cheese, egg, and nutmeg, served in broth.

Name: Tortelloni
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed pasta with a large shape and filled with cheese.

Name: Pavese agnolotti
Text Description: The dish is a egg-based stuffed pasta served dry or using goose broth.

Name: Paccheri
Text Description: The dish is a pasta in a shape of very large tube.

Name: Schlutzkrapfen
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed pasta made of white flour or buckwheat flour, eggs, and olive oil with cheese or mushrooms filling, sometimes with red meat.

Name: Maultasche
Text Description: The dish is a sheets of pasta dough filled with minced meat, smoked meat, spinach, bread crumbs, onions, and flavored with varios herbs and spices.

Name: Manicotti
Text Description: The dish is a large pata tubes, cooked stuffed and baked with cheese mixed with chopped parsley, ground meat such as veal.

Name: Casunziei
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed pasta, consisting of filling sealed between two layers of thin pasta dough, folded in a typical half-moon shape.

Name: Casoncelli
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed pasta which edges are pressed. It is combined with a mixture of breadcrumbs, eggs, parmesan cheese, ground beef, salarmi, or sausage.

Name: Cannelloni
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed pasta with tube shape generally served baked with a filling and covered by sauce.

Name: Agnolotti
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed pasta made with small pieces of flattened dough folded over a filling of roasted meat or Vegetable.

Name: Zrazy
Text Description: The dish is a meat roulade with a rolled shape and made from thin slices of beef, flavored with salt and pepper and stuffed with Vegetable, mushrooms, eggs, and potatoes.

Name: Bánh lá
Text Description: The dish is a leaf cake, consisting of parcel of a variety of rice stuffed with some fillings and wrapped in a leaf or leaves.

Name: Bò nướng lá lốt
Text Description: The dish is a grilled beef served on a leaf which has a spicy smell but medicinal taste.. It is commonly served in a barbecue technique.

Name: Egg roll
Text Description: The dish is a cylindrical, savory roll with shredded cabbage, chopped meat, or other fillings inside a thick wrapping wheat flour skin, fried in hot oil.

Name: Barbajuan
Text Description: The dish is a fritter stuffed with chard, rice, cheese, and other fillings.

Name: Pasteles
Text Description: The dish is a pastel filled with beans, fruit, chilies, corn, nuts, meat, fish, and wrapped in corn husk.

Name: Gordita
Text Description: The dish is a dough stuffed with cheese, meat, or other fillings. The dough is most commonly made of nixtamalized corn flour, but can also be of wheat flour. In the deep-fried version, it is separated in small portions, then each one is filled with meat, and shaped like an oblong disc. The pastry is immersed in boiling oil until golden and crispy on the outside. After cooking, it is allowed to stand to drain excess oil, then a small slit is cut into one side to allow vapor and excessive heat to release, and lime juice and salsa are poured inside, which gives this pastry its characteristic flavor. The baked version is prepared almost identically to the preparation of a certain flatbread, except it is thicker.

Name: Gyeran-mari
Text Description: The dish is made with beaten eggs mixed with several finely diced ingredients, fried and rolled.

Name: Llapingacho
Text Description: The dish is a fried potato pancake served with peanut sauce, they are stuffed with cheese and cooked until crispy brown.

Name: Poornalu
Text Description: The dish is a sweet and dumpling made from rice flour stuffed with jagger paste and dry fruits.

Name: Pootharekulu
Text Description: The dish is a sweet wrapped in a wafer-thin rice starch layer resembling paper and is stuffed with sugar, dry fruits, and nuts.

Name: Bagel dog
Text Description: The dish is a hot dog wrapped in bagel-style breading before or after cooking.

Name: Sorullos
Text Description: The dish is a fried cornmeal-based with stuffed cheese.

Name: Taquito
Text Description: The dish is a small rolled-up flatbread then shallow or deep fried, topped with condiments such as sour cream, avocado-based dipping, and vegetable.

Name: Chebureki
Text Description: The dish is a fried turnovers with a filling of ground or minced meat and onions.

Name: Carimañola
Text Description: The dish is a torpedo-shaped fritter stuffed with cheese, seasoned ground meat or shredded chicken and fried.

Name: Aloo paratha
Text Description: The dish is a flatbread stuffed with potato filling.

Name: Gobi paratha
Text Description: The dish is a flatbread stuffed with flavoured cauliflower and other vegetable.

Name: Stuffed clam
Text Description: The dish is a bread crumb and minced clam mixture that is baked on the half shelf of a clam.

Name: Levengi
Text Description: The dish is a fish or chicken stuffed with walnuts, onions, and various condiments, and baked in the oven.

Name: Hallaca
Text Description: The dish is a corn dough stuffed with a stew of beef, pork, or chicken and other ingredients such as raisins, capers, olives, onions, and bell peppers.

Name: Helzel
Text Description: The dish is a sausage made from poultry neck skin stuffed with flour, bread crumbs, and fried onions, sewn up with a thread.

Name: İmam bayıldı
Text Description: The dish is an eggplant stuffed with onion, garlic, and tomatoes, simmered in olive oil.

Name: Jalangkote
Text Description: The dish is a fried dumpling stuffed with rice, vegetable, potatoes, and eggs. Spicy, sweet and sour sauce will be dipped into prior to be eaten.

Name: Jalapeño popper
Text Description: The dish are jalapeno peppers that have been hollowed out, stuffed with a mixture of cheese, spices, ground meat, and breaded and deep-fried.

Name: Haggis
Text Description: The dish is a savoury pudding containing sheep's pluck, minced with chopped onion, oatmeal, suet, spices, and salt.

Name: Kachori
Text Description: The dish is a deep-fried, spicy, stuffed pastry made with baked mixture of mungbean and onions, besan, coriander, red chili powder, salt, and other spices.

Name: Kalitsounia
Text Description: The dish is a small cheese or herb snacks with different filling and serving variations.

Name: Karađorđeva šnicla
Text Description: The dish is a breaded cutlet dish with rolled veal, pork, or chicken steak, stuffed with dairy then breaded and fried.

Name: Karnıyarık
Text Description: The dish is a eggplant stuffed with a mix of sauteed chopped oninons, garlic, blackpepper, tomatoes.

Name: Kibinai
Text Description: The dish is a pastry filled with mutton and onion.

Name: Stuffed squash
Text Description: This dish consists of various kinds of squash or zucchini stuffed with rice and sometimes meat and cooked on the stovetop or in the oven.

Name: Krautshäuptchen
Text Description: This dish is a stuffed cabbage, served with boiled potatoes and mustard sauce or bechamel sauce.

Name: Mirchi Bada
Text Description: This dish is made by stuffing a green chili with spices, mashed potato, and flour, then it is wrapped in batter and fried until golden brown.

Name: Mücver
Text Description: This dish is made from grated zucchini. They are typically pan-fried in oil and their batter often includes a mixture of eggs, onion, dill, parsley, flour, and sometimes potatoes and cheese.

Name: Nacatamal
Text Description: This dish is made with corn dough which is stuffed with meat like pork, turket, or chicken, then wrapped in plantain leaves and steamed.

Name: Papa rellena
Text Description: This dish is a potato-based dough into which a filling made of chopped beef and onions, whole olives, hard-boiled eggs, cumin and other spices is stuffed.

Name: Szczecin pasztecik
Text Description: This dish is a variety of pastry, a machine-produced deep-fried yeast dough stuffed with a meat or vegetarian filling, served in specialised bars as a fast food.

Name: Plátanos rellenos
Text Description: This dish consists of plantain stuffed with meat and seasonings and fried.

Name: Pocket sandwich
Text Description: This is a sandwich which is made using a single piece of folded or hollowed bread, such as a pita, which is made from dough cooked with fillings inside.

Name: Porchetta
Text Description: This dish is a is a savory, fatty, and moist boneless pork roast. The carcass is deboned and spitted or roasted traditionally over wood for at least eight hours, fat and skin still on.

Name: Tortang talong
Text Description: This dish is an omelette made by pan-frying grilled whole eggplants dipped in an egg mixture.

Name: Rissole
Text Description: This dish is a ball or flattened cake of chopped meat, fish, or Vegetable mixed with herbs or spices, then coated in breadcrumbs and fried.

Name: Roulade
Text Description: This dish is a filled rolled meat. It typically consists of a slice of steak rolled around a filling such as cheese, Vegetable, or other meats.

Name: Sajji
Text Description: This dish traditionally consists of lamb, marinated only in salt with a few spices. It is served with rice that is cooked inside the animal, which is then baked.

Name: Beef bun
Text Description: This dish is a bun that has a ground beef filling, sometimes including pieces of onions.

Name: Buttered pineapple bun
Text Description: This dish is a sweet bun made to resemble a pineapple with a slice of butter stuffed inside.

Name: Cocktail bun
Text Description: This dish is a sweet bun with a filling of shredded coconut.

Name: Peanut butter bun
Text Description: This dish is a sweet bun that has layers of peanut butter fillings, sometimes with light sprinkles of sugar mixed with the peanut butter for extra flavor.

Name: Banana boat
Text Description: A traditional campfire treat consisting of a banana cut lengthwise and stuffed with marshmallow and chocolate, then wrapped in aluminium foil and cooked in the embers left over from a campfire.

Name: Cream bun
Text Description: This dish is made with an enriched dough bread roll that is split after baking and cooling and filled with cream. There are many variations of this dish.

Name: Jelly doughnut
Text Description: This dish is a doughnut with a fruit preserve filling.

Name: Pampushka
Text Description: This dish is a small savoury or sweet yeast-raised bun or doughnut. Traditionally they are baked, but may also be fried. The savoury version have no filling, while the sweet version may be filled with fruits, berries, or poppy seeds, and topped with powdered sugar.

Name: Stuffed racuchy
Text Description: This dish is a type of pancake stuffed with slices of apple and served with sugar. In more modern versions, other druit can be used like bananas. There is also a savoury sweet version of this dish, filled with potatoes.

Name: Rellenitos de plátano
Text Description: This is a dish of sweet mashed plantains stuffed with a mixture of refried beans, chocolate, and cinnamon.

Name: Şöbiyet
Text Description: This dish is a dessert made with phyllo dough stuffed with clotted cream and nuts (walnut or pistachio).

Name: Swiss roll
Text Description: This dish is a type of rolled sponge cake filled with whipped cream, jam, icing, or any type of filling.

Name: Turon
Text Description: This dish is a snack made of thinly sliced bananas, rolled in a spring roll wrapper, fried till the wrapper is crisp and coated with caramelized brown sugar.

Name: Unnakai
Text Description: This dish is a spindle shaped sweet dessert made chiefly of banana.

Name: Egg in the basket
Text Description: This dish is an egg fried in a hole in a slice of bread.

Name: Lobster Thermidor
Text Description: This dish is made with lobster meat cooked in a rich wine sauce, then stuffed back into a lobster shell and browned.

Name: Stuffed mussels
Text Description: This dish is made with plump orange mussels that contain herbed and spiced rice.

Name: Stuffed squid
Text Description: This dish is made of made of olive oil, onion, garlic, rice, tomatoes, salt, black pepper, mint leaves, parsley, and tomato juice, with squid as the main ingredient.

Name: Chorley cake
Text Description: This dish is made using currants, sandwiched between two layers of unsweetened shortcrust pastry.

Name: Cuban pastry
Text Description: This dish is a baked puff pastry filled with either sweet or savory fillings. Traditional options include cream cheese, guava with cheese, pineapple, and coconut.

Name: Hot Pockets
Text Description: This dish is a brand of microwaveable turnovers generally containing one or more types of cheese, meat, or Vegetable.

Name: Pigs in blankets
Text Description: This dish consists of small sausages wrapped in bacon.

Name: Runza
Text Description: This dish is a yeast dough bread pocket with a filling consisting of ground beef, cabbage or sauerkraut, onions, and seasonings.

Name: Sausage bread
Text Description: This dish is typically made from pizza dough and includes sausage, mozzarella cheese (or a similar substitute cheese) and other ingredients such as mushrooms, onions, other vegetable, and various herbs, spices and sauces depending on the recipe.

Name: Šoldra
Text Description: This dish is a bread with dough stuffed with various sausages, such as smoked meat sausage, white wine sausage, and ham/pork sausage.

Name: Stromboli
Text Description: This dish is a type of baked turnover filled with various cheeses and usually cold cuts (typically meats) or vegetable, served hot.

Name: Cabbage roll
Text Description: This dish consists of cooked cabbage leaves wrapped around a variety of fillings. There are many variations of this dish.

Name: Holishkes
Text Description: This dish is prepared from blanched cabbage leaves wrapped in a parcel-like manner around minced meat and then simmered in tomato sauce. Sometimes rice is added to the meat filling.

Name: Cheese roll
Text Description: This dish is created by covering a slice of bread in a prepared filling consisting mainly of grated or sliced cheese, and then rolling it into a tube shape before toasting.

Name: Chicken fillet roll
Text Description: This dish is a baguette filled with a fillet of processed chicken.

Name: Devils on horseback
Text Description: This dish is a hot appetizer of dried fruit stuffed with such ingredients as cheese or nuts, wrapped in bacon, prosciutto or pancetta.

Name: Galette-saucisse
Text Description: This dish is a street food item consisting of a hot sausage, traditionally grilled, wrapped in a buckwheat crepe.

Name: Kati roll
Text Description: This street food dish is a skewer-roasted kebab wrapped in a flatbread.

Name: Pepperoni roll
Text Description: This dish consists of a fairly soft white yeast-leavened bread roll with pepperoni baked in the middle.

Name: Prawn roll
Text Description: This dish is made using a soft white roll approximately 6 inches or 15 cm long, stuffed with a dozen or more peeled prawns, lettuce and remoulade, Thousand Island or cocktail-style sauce.

Name: Gỏi cuốn
Text Description: This dish consists of pork, prawn, Vegetable, rice vermicelli, and other ingredients wrapped in rice paper.

Name: Popiah
Text Description: This dish is a fresh spring roll filled with an assortment of fresh, dried, and cooked ingredients, eaten during a festival and other celebratory occasions.

Name: Ballotine
Text Description: This dish is traditionally a de-boned thigh and/or leg part of the chicken, duck or other poultry stuffed with forcemeat and other ingredients. It is tied to hold its shape and sometimes stitched up with a trussing needle.

Name: Boliche
Text Description: This dish is a pot roast dish consisting of eye round beef roast stuffed with ham.

Name: Cachopo
Text Description: This dish consists of two large veal fillets and includes ham and cheese, and typically has a side of french fries. It is eaten fried and hot after being breaded in eggs and breadcrumbs, and it is usually served garnished with potatoes, peppers, or mushrooms.

Name: Stuffed ham
Text Description: This dish is a variety of ham in which cabbage, kale, onions, spices and seasonings are chopped and mixed, then stuffed into deep slits slashed in a whole corned or smoked ham.

Name: Jucy Lucy
Text Description: This dish is a stuffed cheeseburger with the cheese inside of the meat instead of on top, resulting in a melted core of cheese.

Name: Sapu Mhicha
Text Description: This dish is made up of buffalo leaf tripe stuffed with bone marrow.

Name: Stuffed intestines
Text Description: This dish is a type of sausage which made with minced meat, cow or lamb's intestines, rice, tomato paste, onion, chickpeas, salt, black pepper, allspice, and cinnamon.

Name: Tripoux
Text Description: This dish is made with small bundles of sheep tripe, usually stuffed with sheep's feet, sweetbreads and various herbs and garden Vegetable. There are a number of variations on this dish, but they generally all involve savoury ingredients held together with sheep tripe and braised over low heat.

Name: Turducken
Text Description: This dish consists of a deboned chicken stuffed into a deboned duck, further stuffed into a deboned turkey.

Name: Makdous
Text Description: This dish is a miniature, tangy eggplants stuffed with walnuts, red pepper, garlic, olive oil, and salt. Sometimes chilli powder is added.

Name: Sheikh al-mahshi
Text Description: This dish consists of zucchini stuffed with minced lamb meat and nuts, bathed in a yogurt sauce (the original) or tomato sauce (derivative).

Name: Stuffed eggplant
Text Description: This dish is common in many countries. The main ingredient is eggplant, which is stuffed with various fillings depending on the region. These can include meat (such as lamb), rice, Vegetable, or even mozzarella cheese.

Name: Stuffed cucumber
Text Description: This dish is used in various cuisines around the world. The main ingredient is cucumber, which is stuffed with various fillings depending on the region. Some dishes incorporate preserved cucumbers, while others use fresh cucumbers.

Name: Stuffed tomatoes
Text Description: This dish is a stuffed tomato filled with various ingredients, usually including rice.

Name: Stuffed mushrooms
Text Description: This dish is prepared using edible mushrooms as its primary ingredient. Many fillings can be used, and the dish is typically baked or broiled.

Name: Stuffed peppers
Text Description: This dish is common in many cuisines. It consists of hollowed or halved bell peppers filled with any of a variety of fillings, often including meat, Vegetable, cheese, rice, or sauce.

Name: Arctic roll
Text Description: This dish is an ice cream cake made of vanilla ice cream wrapped in a thin layer of sponge cake to form a roll, with a layer of raspberry flavoured sauce between the sponge and the ice cream.

Name: Black sesame roll
Text Description: This dish is a refrigerated dessert. The dessert preparation starts by drying a thin layer of black sesame paste, which forms a refrigerated sheet. Once set, each sheet is rolled up individually into a sesame roll.

Name: Breakfast roll
Text Description: A bread roll filled with elements of a traditional fried breakfast, like sausages, bacon, pudding, mushrooms, and sauces, commonly served at convenience stores, supermarkets, and casual eateries.

Name: California roll
Text Description: This dish is an inside-out rice roll containing imitation crab (or rarely real crab), avocado, and cucumber.

Name: Chiko Roll
Text Description: Deep fried pastry roll filled with cabbage and barley, as well as carrot, green beans, beef, beef tallow, wheat cereal, celery and onion

Name: Chimichanga
Text Description: The dish is typically prepared by filling a flour tortilla with various ingredients, most commonly rice, cheese, beans, and a meat, such as chopped or shredded meat, marinated meat, dried beef, or shredded chicken, and folding it into a rectangular package

Name: Seattle roll
Text Description: A rice roll dish consists of raw salmon and cream cheese, usually along with cucumber and/or avocado, and sometimes masago or tobiko(fish roe)

Name: Rullepølse
Text Description: The dish consists of a piece of pork belly, or beef flank or lamb and it is flattened out and is spread with herbs and seasoning (salt, pepper, allspice), chopped onions, and in some variants, parsley. It is then rolled up and placed in a brine for a number of days, before being placed in a special press, cooled, and sliced thinly.

Name: Tootsie Roll
Text Description: A candy made of sugar, corn syrup, partially hydrogenated soybean oil, condensed skim milk, cocoa, whey, soy lecithin, and artificial and natural flavors

Name: Salted Nut Roll
Text Description: A candy bar surrounded in a layer of caramel and then covered with salted Virginia peanuts

Name: Pork roll
Text Description: The dish is a processed roll meat contains lightly smoked pork, salt, preservative, and spices. It is prepared by slicing it, if it is not already sliced, and then frying, searing, or griddling the slices.

Name: Pancetta
Text Description: A salt-cured pork belly meat product

Name: Nut roll
Text Description: A sweet yeast dough is rolled flat, and filled with spread usually walnuts spread or poppy seed. The filled dough is rolled up, forming a log or loaf shape, then baked.

Name: Makizushi
Text Description: This dish is generally roll-wrapped in nori (seaweed) but is occasionally wrapped in a thin omelette, soy paper, cucumber, or shiso (perilla) leaves. This dish is often cut into six or eight pieces, constituting a single roll order.

Name: Minnesota sushi
Text Description: This dish is a type of roll made by wrapping a slice of ham with cream cheese around a pickle, and then slicing it into bite-sized pieces.

Name: Fruit Roll-Ups
Text Description: This dish is a brand of snack. It is a flat, corn syrup-based, fruit-flavored snack rolled into a tube, spread on a backing sheet of cellophane to prevent the product from sticking to itself.

Name: Fruit by the Foot
Text Description: This dish is a fruit snack with sugar, maltodextrin, corn syrup, pear puree concentrate, and palm oil as its main ingredients. Its primary flavors used to be derived from artificial colors and flavors, however, they have switched to pear juice and fruit colors in recent years.

Name: Farsu magru
Text Description: This dish is a traditional meat roll prepared using relatively small amount of meat ingredients. It is also characterized by the way in which the lean, low-fat cuts of meat that are typically used in the dish contrast with the stuffing, which has a higher fat content.

Name: Negimaki
Text Description: This dish consists of broiled strips of meat marinated in teriyaki sauce and rolled with scallions. Originally beef was used, but this dish is also commonly made with other meat such as chicken.

Name: Blanquette de veau
Text Description: This dish is a veal stew. In the classic version, the meat is simmered in a white stock and served in a sauce enriched with cream and egg.

Name: Bockwurst
Text Description: This dish is traditionally made from ground pork or veal. It is flavored with salt, white pepper and paprika. Other herbs, such as marjoram, chives and parsley, are also often added. It is often smoked as well.

Name: Calf's liver and bacon
Text Description: This dish is made with slices of bacon that are fried, and slices of veal liver (often covered in flour) are sauteed in the rendered fat. The bacon and slices of liver are placed in a dish and covered with a gravy made with the fond.

Name: Carpaccio
Text Description: This is a dish of meat or fish (such as beef, veal, venison, salmon or tuna), thinly sliced or pounded thin, and served raw, typically as an appetiser.

Name: Hortobágyi palacsinta
Text Description: This dish is a savoury crepe filled with meat (usually veal or beef). The crepes are filled with a stew, tucking in the ends.

Name: Jellied veal
Text Description: This dish is a cold cut dish made from veal, sometimes pork, stock, onion and spices such as allspice, bay leaf and white pepper. It is eaten cold from the fridge, often with potatoes and pickled beetroot or sliced on crisp bread.

Name: Pariser schnitzel
Text Description: This dish is prepared from a thin slice of veal, salted, which is dredged in flour and then dipped in beaten egg. It is then fried in a pan in clarified butter or lard until the outside of the dish turns golden brown. This dish does not incorporate bread crumbs.

Name: Parmigiana
Text Description: This dish is made with fried, sliced eggplant layered with cheese and tomato sauce, then baked.

Name: Paupiette
Text Description: The dish is a piece of meat, beaten thin, and rolled with a stuffing of vegetables, fruits, or sweetmeats

Name: Piccata
Text Description: The meat is cut into thin slices and flattened to an even thickness with a tenderizer. It is seasoned and dredged in flour before being browned in butter or olive oil.

Name: Ragout fin
Text Description: consists of veal, sweetbread, calf brain, tongue and bone marrow, chicken breast and fish, everything boiled either in a vinegar stock or diced and stewed in butter, and then mixed with stewed button mushrooms and thickened with egg yolk

Name: Saltimbocca
Text Description: This dish consists of veal that has been wrapped (lined) with prosciutto and sage and then marinated in wine, oil or salt water, depending on the region or one's own taste.

Name: Scaloppine
Text Description: It consists of thinly sliced meat, most often beef, veal, or chicken, that is dredged in wheat flour and sautéed in one of a variety of reduction sauces.

Name: Wallenbergare
Text Description: A dish consisting of a breaded ground veal patty, flavored with cream and egg yolk, pan-fried until golden and traditionally served with potatoes, lingonberries, and peas.

Name: Wiener schnitzel
Text Description: It is a dish made from a thin, breaded, and pan-fried veal cutlet, known for its crispy golden crust and traditionally served with lemon wedges and sides like potatoes or salad.

Name: Zürcher Geschnetzeltes
Text Description: It is a dish made with thin slices of sautéed veal, white wine, cream, onions, and sometimes mushrooms, often served with rösti.

Name: Waterzooi
Text Description: This is a stew often made with fish, either freshwater or sea, though chicken is more common today. The stew contains fish or chicken, Vegetable (including carrots, onions, celery, leeks, and potatoes), and herbs (parsley, thyme, bay leaves, and sage).

Name: Türlü
Text Description: This dish is made of stewed Vegetable and may also include stewed meat. The basic ingredients of this dish vary greatly. It usually includes potatoes, eggplants and okra. Meat versions are made with beef or lamb, or also with pork in some regions.

Name: Pot-au-feu
Text Description: The dish is comprised of slowly boiled meat and Vegetable with broth.

Name: Andrajos
Text Description: This dish is a stew made of tomato, onion, garlic, red pepper and rabbit, thickened with cake flour. Hare and cod are often used instead of rabbit.

Name: Asam pedas
Text Description: This dish is a sour and spicy fish stew dish. It is often cooked with asam (tamarind) fruit juice with chilli and spices.

Name: Balbacua
Text Description: This dish is a beef stew made from beef, collagen-rich beef parts (oxtail, skin, and joints), and various spices cooked for several hours until very tender.

Name: Bamia
Text Description: This is a dish made with okra, lamb, and tomatoes as primary ingredients. Additional ingredients used can include tomato sauce or tomato paste, onion, garlic, cilantro (coriander), pomegranate molasses, vegetable oil, cardamom, salt and pepper.

Name: Bicol express
Text Description: This dish is a stew made from long chili peppers or small chili peppers, coconut milk/coconut cream, shrimp paste or stockfish, onion, pork, ginger and garlic.

Name: Flaki
Text Description: This dish is a soup usually made with thin, cleaned strips of beef tripe.

Name: Főzelék
Text Description: This dish is a vegetable stew or soup, similar to pottage. It is simply cooked, typically by simmering, not mashing.

Name: Fricot
Text Description: This dish is a stew made with potatoes, onions, and whatever meat was available, cooked in a stew and topped with dumplings.

Name: Gaisburger Marsch
Text Description: This dish is a beef stew where the meat, cooked in a strong beef broth, is cut into cubes and served with cooked potatoes and Spätzle.

Name: Galinhada
Text Description: This dish is a stew of rice with chicken.

Name: Garbure
Text Description: This dish is a thick stew traditionally based on cabbage and confit d'oie, though the modern version is usually made with ham, cheese and stale bread.

Name: Gheimeh
Text Description: This dish is a stew consisting of diced mutton, tomatoes, split peas, onion, and dried lime, garnished with golden, thinly sliced crispy potatoes. The stew is sometimes garnished with fried eggplant and is usually served with white rice.

Name: Goat water
Text Description: This dish is a stew prepared using goat meat, onions, herbs and chible (scallions/spring onions and thyme), hot green pepper, salt and pepper to taste, garlic, cloves, oil, water, marjoram, ground mace, and flour. It is sometimes served with rice or crispy bread rolls.

Name: Goulash
Text Description: This dish is a soup or stew of meat and vegetables seasoned with paprika and other spices.

Name: Guatita
Text Description: This dish is a a stew whose main ingredient is pieces of tripe (cow stomach). There are various vegetarian versions of the dish in which wheat gluten is substituted for tripe.

Name: Guyanese pepperpot
Text Description: This dish is a stew that is usually reserved for special occasions because it needs to cook for several hours, and mostly eaten on Christmas Day or during the Christmas holiday season, and sometimes on Boxing Day.

Name: Hachée
Text Description: This dish is a traditional stew based on diced meat, fish or poultry, and vegetables. It is usually served with potatoes.

Name: Hamin
Text Description: This dish is a Sabbath stew made from whole grains, cubes of meat, chickpeas or beans, onion and cumin.

Name: Hasenpfeffer
Text Description: This dish is a traditional stew made from marinated rabbit or hare, cut into stewing-meat sized pieces and braised with onions and a marinade made from wine and vinegar.

Name: Hot pot
Text Description: This is a dish whereby a heat source placed on the dining table keeps a pot of soup stock simmering, and accompanied with an array of foodstuffs and ingredients and food offerings provided for the diners to dip into the flavorful broth.

Name: Irish stew
Text Description: This dish is a stew that is traditionally made with root vegetables and lamb or mutton, but also commonly with beef.

Name: Hochepot
Text Description: This dish is a stew made with oxtail, shoulder of mutton, salted bacon, and vegetables. The stewed vegetables are served whole.

Name: Patlıcanlı kebap
Text Description: This dish consists of pieces of eggplant layered alternately with fine-chopped (not minced) meat such as beef and lamb. It may be assembled on a skewer and cooked over a fire.

Name: Jota
Text Description: This dish is a stew made with beans and sauerkraut or sour turnip, potatoes, bacon, and spare ribs.

Name: Kadhi
Text Description: This dish is a yogurt-based dish made by simmering yogurt with besan (gram flour) and spices until it forms a thick, tangy gravy.

Name: Kaldereta
Text Description: This dish is a stew where the goat meat is stewed with vegetables and liver paste. Vegetables may include tomatoes, potatoes, olives, bell peppers, and hot peppers.

Name: Kalops
Text Description: This dish is a beef stew that contains beef, onion, allspice, bay leaf, and other spices. It is often served with boiled potatoes and pickled beetroot.

Name: Kapuska
Text Description: This dish is a cabbage stew that is known to be a dish for the poor.

Name: Karelian hot pot
Text Description: This dish is a traditional meat stew prepared using a combination of pork and beef, but elk or lamb can also be used.

Name: Khoresh karafs
Text Description: This dish is a traditional stew with celerty as the main part of the dish.

Name: Kig ha farz
Text Description: This dish is a cooked dish consisting of various meats simmered in a broth with a buckwheat flour based pudding.

Name: Kuru fasulye
Text Description: This dish is premarily made with white beans and olive oil, and onion and tomato paste or tomato sauce are almost invariably used.

Name: Kuurdak
Text Description: This dish is usually described as stewed brown meat.

Name: Lancashire hotpot
Text Description: This dish consists of lamb or mutton and onion, topped with sliced potatoes and slowly baked in a pot at a low heat.

Name: Läskisoosi
Text Description: The dish is made of pork belly fried in butter with onions and flour, stirred in water with salt and pepper. It is often served with mashed potato, pickled cucumber and lingonberry.

Name: Lecsó
Text Description: The dish is a thick vegetable ragout or stew which contains yellow pointed peppers, tomato, onion, salt, and ground sweet and/or hot paprika as a base recipe.

Name: Lobster stew
Text Description: The dish is composed of a lobster, a sofrito, onions, tomatoes, garlic and parsley, boiled then eaten with thin slices of bread.

Name: Locro
Text Description: The dish is a hearty thick squash stew.

Name: Maconochie
Text Description: The dish is a canned stew of sliced turnips, carrots, potatoes, onions, haricot beans, and beef in a thin broth.

Name: Mechado
Text Description: The dish is beef braised with soy sauce and calamansi fruits.

Name: Lobio
Text Description: The dish is composed of various kinds of prepared beans (cooked or stewed), containing coriander, walnuts, garlic and onion.

Name: Mocotó
Text Description: The dish is made from cow's feet, stewed with beans and Vegetable.

Name: Moqueca
Text Description: The dish is typically made with shrimp or fish in a base of tomatoes, onions, garlic, lime, coriander, palm oil and coconut milk.

Name: Tuna pot
Text Description: The dish is a simple dish with tuna, potatoes, onions, peppers, and tomatoes.

Name: Tombet
Text Description: The dish is a traditional vegetable dish consisting of layers of sliced potatoes, aubergines and red bell peppers previously fried in olive oil.

Name: Tocană
Text Description: The dish is a stew prepared with tomato, garlic and sweet paprika. Traditionally, it is consumed with a cornmeal mush.

Name: Tharid
Text Description: The dish is a simple meal of broth and bread, in this instance crumbled flatbread moistened with broth or stew.

Name: Tatws Pum Munud
Text Description: The dish is a traditional stew, made with smoked bacon, stock, potatoes and other Vegetable.

Name: Sulu köfte
Text Description: The dish is a stew or thick soup (çorba) with köfte. It consists of meatballs usually made with minced beef, mixed with rice or bulgur, onion and spices and boiled in their own gravy, with tomato sauce, olive oil, and red pepper paste.

Name: Skirts and kidneys
Text Description: The dish is a stew made from pork and pork kidneys.

Name: Semur
Text Description: The dish is a meat stew (mainly beef) braised in thick brown gravy made of sweet soy sauce, shallots, onions, garlic, ginger, candlenut, nutmeg, and cloves (and sometimes with black pepper, coriander, cumin, and cinnamon).

Name: Sekba
Text Description: The dish is a pork offal stewed in a mild soy sauce-based soup. The stew tastes mildly sweet and salty, made from soy sauce, garlic, and Chinese herbs.

Name: Seco
