Some of the pasta (from one-third to one-half) is fried in oil as part of its preparation, while the rest of it is boiled.

Name: Bob chorba
Text Description: This dish is made from dry beans, onions, tomatoes, spearmint and carrots.

Name: Bissara
Text Description: The dish contains beans, onions, garlic, fresh aromatic herbs and spices. All ingredients are slowly cooked and then blended together to yield a creamy and fragrant dip or side dish.

Name: Boiled peanuts
Text Description: This dish is based on raw or green peanuts, as fully mature peanuts do not make good quality of this dish. Normally salt water is used to boil.

Name: Burmese tofu
Text Description: This dish is made from water and flour ground from yellow split peas and gram flour, a version of chickpea flour The flour is mixed with water, turmeric, and a little salt and heated, stirring constantly, until it reaches a creamy consistency. It is then transferred into a tray and allowed to set.

Name: Borracho beans
Text Description: This dish is made of pinto beans cooked in beer and flavored with cilantro, onion, garlic, bacon, bacon fat, cumin, and chili powder or whole chili peppers. This dish can be served wrapped in tortillas with some form of grilled beef, eaten from a bowl much like chili, or used as a bean dip and eaten with tortilla chips.

Name: Bouneschlupp
Text Description: This dish a green bean soup with potatoes, bacon, and onions.

Name: Chipolata
Text Description: This sausage is typically made from coarse-ground pork seasoned with salt and pepper together with herbs and spices, such as sage, thyme, pimento, or nutmeg.

Name: Medisterpølse
Text Description: This specialty food consist of a thick spiced sausage made of minced pork and lard, stuffed into a casing.

Name: Bondiola sandwich
Text Description: This dish is a sandwich made with thick slices of pork shoulder. The meat consists of slices of roasted or cured pork shoulder and it is usually served on crispy brioche bread. It can be topped with a variety of condiments and vegetables.

Name: Chorizo
Text Description: This dish is a type of pork sausage with varieties that are quite different from each other depending on the countries and the continent. The most common version is a fermented, cured, smoked sausage which gets its smokiness and deep red color from dried, smoked, red peppers.

Name: Longaniza
Text Description: This sausage is similar to salchichón, though thinner; both differ from chorizo in that black pepper is used for them instead of paprika and may have different spices in them like nutmeg.

Name: Devon
Text Description: This sausage is a type of manufactured meat product. It is usually composed of several types of pork, basic spices, and a binder.

Name: Saveloy
Text Description: This dish is a type of highly seasoned sausage, usually bright red, normally boiled and available in fish and chip shops. It is sometimes also available fried in batter.

Name: Käsekrainer
Text Description: This dish is a type of lightly smoked sausages containing roughly torn bits of pork and 10% to 20% cheese (for example Emmentaler) cut into small cubes.

Name: Vienna sausage
Text Description: This dish is a thin parboiled sausage traditionally made of pork and beef in a casing of sheep's intestine, then given a low-temperature smoking.

Name: Kaszanka
Text Description: This dish is a sausage made of a mixture of pig's blood, pork offal (commonly liver), and buckwheat or barley stuffed in a pig intestine. It is usually flavored with onion, black pepper, and marjoram.

Name: Black pudding
Text Description: This dish is made from pork or occasionally beef blood, with pork fat or beef suet, and a cereal, usually oatmeal, oat groats, or barley groats. It has a high proportion of cereal, along with the use of certain herbs such as pennyroyal.

Name: Cervelat
Text Description: This dish is a sausage produced in Switzerland, France, Belgium, the Netherlands, and parts of Germany. The recipe and preparation of the sausage vary regionally.

Name: Salchichón
Text Description: This dish is a summer sausage that is made by smoking, drying, cooking, or some combination. It is made with pork, although some recipes use other meats including ox, veal, or horse.

Name: Linguiça
Text Description: This dish is a sausage made from pork and seasoned with onion, garlic, paprika and other spices. It can be used fresh in cooked preparations or undergo a curing and preservation process through smoking.

Name: Lukanka
Text Description: This dish is semi-dried, has a flattened cylindrical shape, and brownish-red interior in a skin that is normally covered with a white fungus. The mix of small pieces of meat and fat give the interior a grainy structure.

Name: Butifarra Soledeñas
Text Description: This dish is made from ground beef and pork with seasoning and spices. The meat is cut into pieces and boiled. The mixture is encased in intestine and tied off with string into sections.

Name: Češnovka
Text Description: This dish is a spicy pork garlic sausage from Turopolje.

Name: Moronga
Text Description: This dish is a kind of blood sausage. Spices, herbs (such as ruta, oregano, and mint), onions, and chili peppers are added and then boiled in the pig's large intestines for casing for several hours. It is served in a sauce.

Name: Botifarra
Text Description: This dish is based on ancient recipes, either the Roman sausage botulu or the lucanica, made of raw pork and spices, with variants today in Italy and in the Portuguese and Brazilian linguiça

Name: Nem chua
Text Description: This dish is a fermented pork dish. It is mainly composed of a mixture of lean pork and thin strips of cooked rind, garnished with garlic and chilli.

Name: Nem nướng
Text Description: This dish is a grilled pork sausage or grilled meatballs, that is made of ground pork with between a third and a half pork fat. The meat is typically flavoured with chopped shallots, crushed garlic, fish sauce, sugar and black pepper.

Name: Rød pølse
Text Description: This dish is a type of brightly red, boiled pork sausage.

Name: Chả lụa
Text Description: This dish is made of lean pork, potato starch, garlic, ground black pepper, and fish sauce.

Name: Hog maw
Text Description: The dish is the stomach of a pig prepared as food. More specifically, the exterior muscular wall of the stomach organ (with interior lining mucosa removed) contains no fat if cleaned properly.

Name: Kupati
Text Description: This is a sausage that is made from ground pork, intestines or chitterlings, pepper, onions.

Name: Carniolan sausage
Text Description: This dish is a sausage that contains at least 75 to 80% pork (aside from bacon) and at most 20% bacon. It may contain as much as 5% water, the sea salt from salt pans, little garlic, saltpetre and black pepper. No other ingredients are permitted.

Name: Hot link sausage
Text Description: The dish is a type of sausage prepared using pork, beef, or a combination of both. It is sometimes used as an ingredient in other dishes.

Name: Half-smoke
Text Description: This dish is a larger, spicier, and with more coarsely-ground meat than a regular hot dog, with the sausage often to be half-pork and half-beef, smoked, and served with herbs, onion, and chili sauce.

Name: Goetta
Text Description: The dish is made with meat, oats, broth, spices, often onions, and occasionally other vegetables, simmered until thick, poured into loaf pans and chilled or allowed to cool completely so that the loaves become firm enough to slice. It is then cut into slices and fried, often in butter.

Name: Breakfast sausage
Text Description: It is a type of fresh sausage typically made from pork. It can be in the form of smoked or fresh patties, links or loose sausage.

Name: Bologna sausage
Text Description: It is ground pork sausage. Typical seasonings include black pepper, nutmeg, allspice, celery seed and coriander, and myrtle berries give it its distinctive flavor.

Name: Andouille
Text Description: This is a smoked sausage made using pork. It is primarily pig chitterlings, tripe, onions, wine, and seasoning. It is generally grey and has a distinctive odor.

Name: Glamorgan sausage
Text Description: This dish is made of a mixture of cheese, leeks and breadcrumbs, although some recipes swap the leeks for onions or spring onions and may add herbs such as parsley or further flavourings such as mustard. The mixture is then rolled into sausage shapes and then fried. No sausage casing is used, although an egg is used to bind the mixture so that it does not fall apart during cooking.

Name: Stornoway black pudding
Text Description: This is a type of black pudding. Black pudding is a distinct type of blood sausage. It is made from pork or occasionally beef blood, with pork fat or beef suet, and a cereal, usually oatmeal, oat groats, or barley groats. The high proportion of cereal, along with the use of certain herbs such as pennyroyal, distinguishes black pudding from blood sausages eaten in other parts of the world.

Name: Sibiu Salami
Text Description: The dish is a salami made with pork meat, pork fat, salt and condiments, fermented and air-dried.

Name: Botillo
Text Description: This is a dish of meat-stuffed pork intestine. It is a is a meat product made from different pieces left over from the butchering of a pig, including the ribs, tail, and bones with a little meat left on them.

Name: Babic sausage
Text Description: It is a sausage made from beef and pork and strongly seasoned with spices. It usually has a reddish color due to ingredients.

Name: Sobrassada
Text Description: It is a raw, cured sausage made with ground pork, paprika, salt and other spices. It is made by the dehydration of meat under certain weather conditions.

Name: Naem
Text Description: This dish is a pork sausage. It is a fermented food with a sour flavour. It has a short shelf life and is often eaten in raw form after fermentation. It is used as an ingredient in various dishes and is also served as a side dish.

Name: Qazı
Text Description: This is a traditional sausage-like food made from horse meat. It is a common element on a festive meal table. A reviewer described the dish as smoky and earthy. It is often eaten cold, sometimes sliced, and served as an appetiser.

Name: Gringas
Text Description: This flour-based flatbread is filled with cheese, meat, and pineapple.

Name: Mooncake
Text Description: The pastry is a round pastry, with a rich, thick filling usually made from lotus seed paste (other typical fillings include red bean paste or mixed nuts) surrounded by a thin and may contain yolks from salted duck eggs.

Name: Jingisukan
Text Description: The dish is a grilled mutton dish prepared on a convex metal skillet or other grill. It is often cooked alongside beansprouts, onions, mushrooms, and bell peppers, and served with a sauce based in either soy sauce or sake.

Name: Tokushima Ramen
Text Description: The dish is a pork broth ramen that is seasoned with soy-sauce, and has topping of thinly sliced pork belly, bamboo shoots, green onions, bean sprouts, and raw eggs.

Name: Qarta
Text Description: The dishes are boiled and pan-fried horse rectum, taken from the final few inches of the digestive tract before the muscular part of the anus. It is served without sauce or spices. It is prepared in various ways to clean it thoroughly and remove any unpleasant taste due to the provenance of the tissue.

Name: Sundae sausage
Text Description: The sausage dish is generally made by steaming cow or pig's intestines stuffed with various ingredients.

Name: Ishikari-nabe
Text Description: The dish is salmon stewed in a miso-based broth with vegetable. Typical ingredients include daikon, tofu, konjac, Chinese cabbage, potato, Welsh onion, shungiku, shiitake mushroom and butter

Name: Yudoufu
Text Description: This hot pot dish is tofu simmered in a kombu stock and served with ponzu and various condiments.

Name: Mizutaki
Text Description: This dish is chicken pieces and Vegetable stewed in a simple stock, and eaten with dipping sauce such as ponzu. Ingredients include chinese cabbage, Welsh onion, shiitake mushroom or other mushroom, tofu, shungiku, shirataki noodles.

Name: Burro percherón
Text Description: This dish is a variation of classic burrito, which traditionally prepared with grilled or charcoal-roasted meat, avocado, cheese, and tomatoes (although variants exist in each restaurant).

Name: Sai krok Isan
Text Description: This dish is a fermented sausage made with pork and rice, and typically eaten as a snack served with bird's eye chilis, raw cabbage, and sliced ginger.

Name: Sai ua
Text Description: This is minced pork meat, herbs, spices, and red curry paste.

Name: Chalupa
Text Description: This is made by pressing a thin layer of maize dough around the outside of a small mold, in the process creating a concave container and then deep frying the result to produce crisp, shallow corn cups. These are filled with various ingredients such as shredded chicken, pork, chopped onion, chipotle pepper, red salsa, and/or green salsa

Name: Chicharrón
Text Description: This is a dish generally consisting of fried pork belly or fried pork rinds. It may also be made from chicken, mutton, or beef.

Name: Aguachile
Text Description: This is a dish made of shrimp and raw fish fillet, submerged in liquid seasoned with bird peppers, lime juice, salt, slices of cucumber, and slices of red onion.

Name: Cochinita pibil
Text Description: This is a slow-roasted pork dish. The high acid content of the marinade and the slow cooking time tenderise the meat, allowing otherwise tough pieces of meat to be used. This dish is marinated in bitter oranges. In areas where bitter oranges are not common, the juice of sweet oranges combined with lemons, limes, or vinegar is employed to approximate the effect of the bitter orange on the meat.

Name: Queso flameado
Text Description: The food is a hot melted cheese and spicy pork sausage that is often served in hot pan with burst of flames.

Name: Prawn cocktail
Text Description: The dish consists of shelled, cooked prawns in a seafood sauce or cocktail sauce served in a glass.

Name: Curtido
Text Description: The food is usually made with cabbage, onions, carrots, oregano, and sometimes lime juice.

Name: Entomatada
Text Description: The dish is made of a folded corn tortilla that has been fried in oil and then bathed in a tomato sauce made from tomatoes, garlic, onion, oregano, chilli peppers, and salt. The recipes for the tomato sauce vary by cook. The tortilla can be filled with a number of different ingredients. However, the most common are chicken, beef, cheese, or beans.

Name: Escamol
Text Description: This is food known as insect caviar. They are made are from the edible larvae and pupae of ants

Name: Kishka
Text Description: The dish refers to various types of sausage or stuffed intestine with a filling made from a combination of meat and meal, often grain or potato.

Name: Huarache
Text Description: This dish consists of masa dough with smashed pinto beans placed in the centre before it is given an oblong shape, fried, and topped with green or red salsa, onions, potato, cilantro and any manner of protein such as ground beef or tongue, then finished with white cheese. It also often paired with fried cactus leaves.

Name: Japanese-style peanuts
Text Description: This type of snack food is made from peanuts coated in a wheat flour dough and then fried or deep-fried. It comes in a variety of different flavours. The original version's recipe for the extra-crunchy shell has ingredients such as wheat flour, soy sauce, water, sugar, monosodium glutamate, and citric acid.

Name: Machaca
Text Description: This is traditionally dried meat, usually spiced beef or pork, rehydrated and pounded to make it tender.

Name: Manchamanteles
Text Description: This dish is a type of stew made from assorted meat, chili peppers, vegetables, and fruits. A typical recipe contains chicken and/or pork, sausage, pineapple, apple, banana, chili peppers, almonds, cinnamon, lard, and tomatoes.

Name: Memela
Text Description: These are fried or toasted cakes made of masa topped with different fresh ingredients eaten as streetfood or snacks. The flat cakes are slightly thicker and usually oblong/oval.

Name: Menudo
Text Description: This is a soup, made with cow's stomach (tripe) in broth with a red chili pepper base.

Name: Liverwurst
Text Description: This is a sausage made from liver. Many varieties are spread. It usually contains pigs" or calves" liver. Other ingredients are meat (notably veal), fat, and spices

Name: Mixiote
Text Description: This is a traditional pit-barbecued meat dish. The meat is cooked inside a wrapper, traditionally in the outer skin of a specific leaf. It is usually made with mutton or rabbit, but chicken, lamb, and pork are also used. The meat is cubed with the bone and seasoned with chilli peppers, cumin, thyme, marjoram, bay leaves, cloves and garlic.

Name: Mole de olla
Text Description: A traditional soup made of a kind of edible cactus, squash, zucchini, green beans, corn, potato, chambarete and aguja meat, submerged into a broth, seasoned with garlic, onion, and wormseed.

Name: Molote
Text Description: A filled, plantain or corn-based pastry usually served as an appetizer or snack. It consists of a dough made from plantain or corn masa, sometimes blended with mashed potatoes, that is filled with various ingredients, rolled into cigar shapes or ovals or half moons.

Name: Panucho
Text Description: This is a food that is stuffed with refried black beans and topped with chopped cabbage, pulled chicken or turkey, tomato, pickled red onion, avocado, and pickled pepper.

Name: Papadzules
Text Description: In its simplest form it consists of corn flatbread dipped in a sauce of pumpkin seeds filled with hard-boiled eggs, and garnished with a cooked tomato-pepper sauce.

Name: Picadillo
Text Description: It is made with ground meat (most commonly beef), tomatoes (tomato sauce may be used as a substitute), and also raisins, olives, and other ingredients that vary by region.

Name: Hog's pudding
Text Description: This is a type of sausage. Popular variants of the recipe consist of pork meat and fat, suet, bread, as well as oatmeal or pearl barley formed into a large sausage whereas other versions of the recipe contain a high percentage of offal such as lung and liver.

Name: Lincolnshire sausage
Text Description: The sausage dish is made with coarsely chopped or ground pork mixed with binders, seasonings and preservative.

Name: Doctor's sausage
Text Description: This sausage dish is a emulsified boiled sausage with pale pink color and low fat content.

Name: Oxford sausage
Text Description: The modern version is considered, typically, to consist of a mixture of pork and veal, seasoned with lemon and herbs.

Name: Lorne sausage
Text Description: This sausage dish is a traditional food item made from minced meat, rusk and spices.

Name: Bhakkha
Text Description: A fluffy rice cake served in breakfast or as a snack with freshly prepared tomato pickle.

Name: Katiya
Text Description: This food is prepared by mixing spices, chilies, garlic and onion with mutton. Salt, turmeric and oil is added in the clay pot and the mutton is put in it. It is served with rice

Name: Dahi
Text Description: It is a traditional yogurt or fermented milk product. It is usually prepared from cows' milk, and sometimes buffalo milk or goat milk.

Name: South Asian pickle
Text Description: It is a pickled food made from a variety of vegetables, meats and fruits preserved in brine, vinegar, edible oils, and various spices.

Name: Rajas con crema
Text Description: It is one of the dishes most commonly served during parties. Preparation of the dish involves roasting, peeling and slicing the peppers, sauteing them together with sliced onions, and simmering the mixture with cream. Sometimes chicken broth is added for flavor.

Name: Romeritos
Text Description: A dish consisting of tender sprigs of seepweed which are boiled and served in sauce seasoned with shrimp jerky blended into the mix. Typical additional ingredients include boiled potatoes and re-hydrated shrimp.

Name: Bagiya
Text Description: It is a steamed dumpling that consists of an external covering of rice flour and an inner content of sweet substances such like vegetables and other fried items.

Name: Sujuk
Text Description: This sausage mainly consists of ground meat and animal fat usually obtained from beef or lamb.

Name: Salbute
Text Description: This food is a puffed deep fried flatbread that is topped with lettuce, sliced avocado, pulled chicken or turkey, tomato and pickled red onion.

Name: Battered sausage
Text Description: They are made up of a pork sausage dipped in batter and usually served with chips.

Name: Italian sausage
Text Description: This pork sausage is often noted for being seasoned with fennel or anise as the primary seasoning.

Name: Sincronizada
Text Description: This food is made by placing ham, vegetables (like tomatoes, onion, etc.) and a portion of cheese between two flour tortillas.

Name: Tripas
Text Description: They are the small intestines of farm animals that have been cleaned, boiled and grilled.

Name: Totopo
Text Description: The food is a flat, round, or triangular corn item similar to a tortilla, that has been toasted, fried or baked.

Name: Tlacoyo
Text Description: They are stuffed with cheese, fava beans, cooked ground beans, chicharron, and other ingredients before being fried or toasted.

Name: Tlayuda
Text Description: This food consists of a large, thin, crunchy, partially fried or toasted tortilla covered with a spread of refried beans, unrefined pork lard, lettuce or cabbage, avocado, meat, cheese, and sauces.

Name: Tostada
Text Description: This food consists of corn and vegetables. It is a flat or bowl-shaped bread that is deep-fried or toasted.

Name: Tostilocos
Text Description: The food consists of white corn, pickled pork rinds, cucumber, lime juice, mango pieces, hot sauce, chamoy, chili powder, salt, mayonnaise, and cracker peanuts and a variety of savory sauces and condiments.

Name: Caldo de queso
Text Description: This is made with boiled water, diced potatoes, onions, tomato, green chiles and oregano. The cheese is usually added only at the end, once the other are ingredients are boiled.

Name: New Orleans hot sausage
Text Description: This food is made of pork or a blend of beef and pork, and seasoned with cayenne pepper, paprika, onions, garlic, black pepper and salt.

Name: Migas
Text Description: This dish is made from stale bread and other ingredients.

Name: Beefsteak
Text Description: This dish is flat cut of beef with parallel faces, usually cut perpendicular to the muscle fibers.

Name: Carne asada
Text Description: This dish is grilled and sliced beef, usually skirt steak, flap steak, or flank steak though chuck steak can also be used.

Name: Carne a la tampiqueña
Text Description: This dish consists of strip of roasted meat, corn tortilla, white cheese and  avocado-based dip.

Name: Cabrito
Text Description: This food is roast whole goat over a charcoal fire.

Name: Poc chuc
Text Description: This is a dish of meat, commonly pork, that is prepared in citrus marinade and cooked over a grill.

Name: Pollo a la brasa
Text Description: This dish is a variety of rotisserie chicken. It originally consists of a chicken (cooked on a spit over charcoal and seasoned only with salt) served with large french fries, though today additional spices are used to prepare it. It is almost always served with creamy (mayonnaise-based) sauces.

Name: Pollo motuleño
Text Description: This dish consists of chicken cooked with orange juice, achiote, and plantains.

Name: Puntas
Text Description: This dish consists of small cuts of meat cooked in various sauces, either of dried chili or fresh chilis sauces. Initially, the tips were made with strips of leftover beef cut. Then, different types of meat have been used.

Name: Chipotle
Text Description: This ingredient is a smoke-dried ripe type of chili pepper used for seasoning.

Name: Arroz a la tumbada
Text Description: This is a traditional dish prepared with white rice and seafood. It is made with chopped tomato, onion, garlic and red pepper. Rice and fish broth or water is added, then seafood which may include shrimp, clams, crab, calamari and whitefish.

Name: Arroz negro
Text Description: This dish is made with rice and gets its dark color from black bean broth.

Name: Arroz poblano
Text Description: This dish is made with rice and gets its green color from a type of pepper that is processed into a liquid.

Name: Morisqueta
Text Description: This dish consists of cooked rice, combined with beans, and served with a sauce of tomato, onion and garlic.

Name: Huachinango a la Veracruzana
Text Description: This dish consists of a whole red snapper, gutted and de-scaled and marinated in lime juice, salt, pepper, nutmeg and garlic. A sauce is made of onions, garlic, tomato, a type of chili pepper, olives and herbs, and the fish is baked with the sauce until tender.

Name: Caldo de pollo
Text Description: This dish is a soup consists of chicken and vegetables. It uses whole chicken pieces instead of chopped or shredded chicken. The vegetables are also usually of a heartier cut.

Name: Fried ice cream
Text Description: This dish is a dessert made of a scoop of ice cream that is frozen hard, then breaded or coated in a batter before being quickly deep-fried, creating a warm, crispy shell around the still-cold ice cream.

Name: Capirotada
Text Description: This dish consists of toasted savory bread and soaked in a mulled syrup made of whole cane sugar, clove, and cinnamon sticks.

Name: Caldo de siete mares
Text Description: This dish is a fish soup typically made with tomato, fish, or seafood broth with local fresh seafood ingredients and cooked quickly in a thin broth.

Name: Bionico
Text Description: This dish is a fruit salad consisting of a variety of fruits chopped up into small cubes, drenched with cream and topped off with granola, shredded coconut, raisins and sometimes honey.

Name: Chongos zamoranos
Text Description: This dish is a dessert made of curdled milk. It is typically prepared with rennet tablets, milk, sugar and cinnamon. The result is a dish of soft cheese-like consistency on a sweet brown milky syrup.

Name: Champurrado
Text Description: This is a chocolate-based beverage, prepared with either a lime-treated corn dough, a dried version of lime-treated corn dough, or corn flour, cane sugar, water or milk, and occasionally containing cinnamon, anise seed, or vanilla.

Name: Calavera
Text Description: This dish is an edible decorative skulls made from sugar.

Name: Chocolate brownie
Text Description: This dish is a chocolate baked confection come in a variety of forms and may be either fudgy or cakey, depending on their density.

Name: Cocada
Text Description: This dish is a traditional coconut confectionery made with with eggs and shredded coconut.

Name: Coconut candy
Text Description: This dish is a candy made with coconut or coconut flavorings.

Name: Cochinito de piloncillo
Text Description: This dish is a sweet bread made with a type of sweetener made from sugar cane.

Name: Concha
Text Description: This dish is a traditional sweet bread roll that gets its name from its round shape and its striped, seashell-like appearance.

Name: Crème caramel
Text Description: This dish is a custard dessert with a layer of clear caramel sauce.

Name: Frozen banana
Text Description: This dish is a dessert made by placing a banana upon a stick, freezing it, and usually dipping it in melted chocolate or yogurt. It may be covered with toppings such as chopped nuts, sprinkles, sugar and crushed cookies.

Name: Manjar blanco
Text Description: This dish consists of a sweet, white spread or pastry filling made with milk.

Name: Marquesita
Text Description: This dish is a dessert consists of a crepe, rolled and filled with caramelized milk, condensed milk, jam, chocolate or edam cheese.

Name: Marzipan
Text Description: This dish consists primarily of sugar and almond meal (ground almonds), sometimes augmented with almond oil or extract.

Name: Nicuatole
Text Description: This dish is a gelatinous dessert made from ground maize and sugar.

Name: Paleta
Text Description: This dish is a popsicle made using locally available fresh fruit. Its flavors can be divided into two basic categories: milk-based or water-based.

Name: Tres leches cake
Text Description: This dish is a sponge cake soaked in three kinds of milk: evaporated milk, condensed milk, and whole milk. It is a very light cake, with many air bubbles.

Name: Rosca de reyes
Text Description: This dish is a cake consists of a sweet brioche dough aromatised with orange blossom water and decorated with slices of candied or crystallized fruit of various colors. It can be filled with whipped cream, cream, almond paste or others.

Name: Fudge
Text Description: This dish is a type of confection that is made by mixing sugar, butter and milk. It has a variety of flavors, with fruit, nut, chocolate, and caramel being the most popular.

Name: Nopalito
Text Description: This dish is made with diced nopales, the naturally flat stems, called pads, of prickly pear cactus. It has a light, slightly tart flavor, and a crisp, mucilaginous texture.

Name: Wensleydale cheese
Text Description: This is a medium cheese that is supple and crumbly. It has a slight honey aroma.

Name: Sulguni
Text Description: This is a type of cheese that has a sour, moderately salty flavor, a dimpled texture, and an elastic consistency.

Name: Scamorza
Text Description: This is a type of cheese made by cow milk. It is a "stretched curd" cheese, in which the fresh curd matures in its own whey for several hours to allow the acidity to develop through the conversion of lactose to lactic acid.

Name: Ricotta
Text Description: This is a type of whey cheese made from sheep, cow, goat, or water buffalo milk whey left over from the production of other cheeses.

Name: Nori
Text Description: This is a dried edible seaweed. It has a strong and distinctive flavor, and is generally made into flat sheets and used to wrap rolls.

Name: Bresaola
Text Description: The dish is a air-dried, salted beef with dark red color.

Name: Brési
Text Description: The dish is a dried and smoked beef.

Name: Bündnerfleisch
Text Description: The dish is an air-dried meat, usually beef.

Name: Lutefisk
Text Description: The dish is dried whitefish, usually cod, made from aged fish.

Name: Katsuobushi
Text Description: The dish is a simmered, smoked, and fermented skipjack tuna.

Name: Kipper
Text Description: This dish is a whole herring, a small, oily fish, that has been split in a butterfly fashion from tail to head along the dorsal ridge, gutted, salted or pickled, and cold-smoked over smouldering wood chips

Name: Açaí na tigela
Text Description: The dish is made from frozen and mashed fruit of the acai palm with creamy texture.

Name: Beijinho
Text Description: The dish is prepared with condensed milk, grated coconut, sugar, frequently toped with clove.

Name: Bolo de rolo
Text Description: The dish is a cake batter made from flour, eggs, butter, and sugar.

Name: Brigadeiro
Text Description: The dish is made of condensed milk, cocoa powder, butter, and chocolate sprinkle covering outside layer.

Name: Cajuzinho
Text Description: The dish is made of peanuts, cashew nuts, and sugar, shaped like a tiny cashew.

Name: Canjica
Text Description: The dish is a porridge made with white or yellow maize kernels, cooked with milk, sugar, and cinnamon until tender.

Name: Creme de papaya
Text Description: The dish is a papaya blended with vanilla ice cream.

Name: Curau
Text Description: The dish is a sweet custard-like dessert made from pressed juice of unripe maize cooked with milk and sugar.

Name: Mané pelado
Text Description: The dish is a cake made from shredded yuca and coconat, and a salted cheese.

Name: Sagu
Text Description: The dish is made of tapioca pearls, sugar, and red wine.

Name: Rice pudding
Text Description: The dish is made of rice mixed with water or milk and commonly other ingredients such as sweeteners, spices, flavourings, and sometimes eggs.

Name: Paçoca
Text Description: The dish is made of ground peanuts, sugar, honey, and salt, usually mold a shape of box or cylinder candy.

Name: Papo-de-anjo
Text Description: The dish is made of whipped egg yolks, and boiled in sugar syrup to create vibrant colors.

Name: Maria-mole
Text Description: The dish is similar shape to marshmallow, made with sugar, gelatine, egg whites.

Name: Passion fruit mousse
Text Description: The dish is a passion fruit-flavored variation of dessert, with gelatin, egg, milk, and fruit juice.

Name: Olho de sogra
Text Description: The dish is a candy made of dried plum with crystal sugar.

Name: Pavê
Text Description: The dish is an alternating layer of biscuits and a cream made with condensed milk.

Name: Pé de moleque
Text Description: The dish is a candy made of peanuts and molasses.

Name: Queijadinha
Text Description: The dish is a custard tart made from coconut and cheese, sweetend condensed milk, sugar, butter, and egg yolks.

Name: Bacalhau à Zé do Pipo
Text Description: It is an oven baked dish, consisting in layers of cod (previously boiled in milk), onion (or pickles), mashed potatoes with a hint of ground nutmeg, and mayonnaise.

Name: Bacalhau à Gomes de Sá
Text Description: This dish consists of cod, potatoes, eggs, olives, olive oil, and onion.

Name: Čvarci
Text Description: The dish a variant of pork rinds. They are a kind of pork cracklings, with fat thermally extracted from the lard. Preparation involves melting the lard.

Name: Žganci
Text Description: The dish is a traditional "poor man"s food" of hard-working farmhands similar to polenta, although prepared with finer grains. The dish is made from buckwheat flour and cornmeal, cooking oil and salt, which is cooked for fifteen minutes on a low boil.

Name: Brudet
Text Description: The dish is a fish stew with spices, Vegetable and red or white wine, and vinegar.

Name: Zagorski štrukli
Text Description: The dish is a dough with various types of filling, usually made with cottage cheese with eggs, sour cream, and salt. They can be boiled and baked. Pastry is rolled out flat and very thin, to cover the table top. A mixture of cottage cheese with eggs, sour cream and salt is spread thinly over the pastry. Then the pastry is rolled lengthwise from both sides into two joined rolls, and finally cut into 10–20 cm long pieces. For baked version, the pieces are then placed into a baking tray, generously covered in clotted cream, and baked for roughly 45 minutes, until slightly brown on top. For boiled version, the pieces are placed into a pot of boiling water. Onion and parsley are fried separately until slightly brown, and then added into the pot. They are then cooked for roughly 20 minutes.

Name: Kotlovina
Text Description: The dish is a stewed meat dish and sausages stewed in their own juice with onions, potatoes, tomatoes, bell peppers, and paprika.

Name: Meso 'z tiblice
Text Description: The dish is a salty meat made with rubbing garlic, salt, in a wodden containers.

Name: Fritaja
Text Description: The dish is an egg cooked with many plants and Vegetable, sometimes with bacon and garlic sprouts.

Name: Fisherman's soup
Text Description: The dish is a spicy paprika based fish soup with bright red color.

Name: Međimurska gibanica
Text Description: The dish is a layered cake made from filo pastry, cheese, poppy seeds, and apples.

Name: Frittella
Text Description: The dish is made from dough with raisins, orange peel, and lemon peel on them with fillings.

Name: Grahova pretepena juha
Text Description: The dish is a thick bean soup with milk and cream, called white bean soup.

Name: Aspic
Text Description: The dish is a savory gelatin made with a meat stock or broth, set in a mold to encase other ingredients. These often include pieces of meat, seafood, vegetable, or eggs.

Name: Pašticada
Text Description: The dish is a braised beef cooked in a sweet and sour dark sauce.

Name: Krofne
Text Description: The dish is an airy filled doughnuts made with jelly, marmalade, jam, or chocolate with cinnamon.

Name: Turoš
Text Description: The dish is a type of cheese made from cattle's milk with cone shape.

Name: Areias
Text Description: The dish is a biscuit coated with sugar and cinnamon, which resemble sand.

Name: Duck rice
Text Description: The dish is a rice with braised duck condiment, cooked with yam and shrimp with thick dark sauce.

Name: Bacalhau à Brás
Text Description: The dish is a shredded salted cod chopped with fried potatoes, cooked with eggs.

Name: Bifana
Text Description: The dish is a pork chops steak, or loin, pounded thin or sliced with garlic and wine, covered in sandwich bread.

Name: Tripas à moda do Porto
Text Description: The dish is a beef stomach with white beans, carrots, and rice.

Name: Broa de Avintes
Text Description: The dish is a dark brown, dense bread, made with maize and rye flours.

Name: Torricado
Text Description: The dish is made of bread toasted over charcoal and soaked in olive oil, with garlic and salt.

Name: Folar
Text Description: The dish is a bread with melted sugar and cinammon.

Name: Queijo de Azeitão
Text Description: The dish is a simple cheese made from sheep milk.

Name: Pão de Mafra
Text Description: The dish is a staple bread commonly eaten with butter or jam, hams or cheeses.

Name: Polvo à lagareiro
Text Description: The dish is an octopus cooked with olive oil, potatoes, and garlic.

Name: Rojões
Text Description: The dish is a fried pork with clams.

Name: Empadão
Text Description: The dish is made of red meat between layers of potato, rice, or bread with pasta.

Name: Roast chicken
Text Description: The dish is chicken prepared as food by roasting whether in a home kitchen, over a fire, or with a rotisserie. Generally, the chicken is roasted with its own fat and juices by circulating the meat during roasting, and therefore, are usually cooked exposed to fire or heat with some type of rotary grill so that the circulation of these fats and juices is as efficient as possible. It is a dish that appears in a wide variety of cuisines worldwide.

Name: Bife a cavalo
Text Description: The dish consists of grilled or pan-fried steak with rice, beans, and salad.

Name: Xarém
Text Description: The dish is a thick soup made with corn, clams, sardines, and grilled meats.

Name: Cozido à portuguesa
Text Description: The dish is a mixed meal consisting of Vegetable, meat, and other toppings.

Name: Cebolada
Text Description: The dish is a onion stew, sauce, or paste.

Name: Canja de galinha
Text Description: The dish is a chicken soup with carrot, eggs, olive oil, mint, saffron, clove, and white pepper.

Name: Lokma
Text Description: The dish is a dessert made of leavened and deep fried dough balls, soaked in syrup or honey, sometimes coated with cinnamon or other ingredients.

Name: Akkawi
Text Description: It is a white brine cheese, commonly made with pasteurized cow's milk, but can also be made with goat or sheepmilk. It is commonly used as a table cheese eaten by itself or paired with fruit.

Name: Halva
Text Description: It is a thick paste made from flour, butter, liquid oil, saffron, rosewater, milk, turmeric powder, and sweetened with sugar.

Name: Sopa de cacahuete
Text Description: The dish is a soup made from peanuts, often with various other ingredients

Name: Kilishi
Text Description: It is a form of dried meat, typically made with beef, Lamb and mutton or goat.

Name: Koba
Text Description: The food is sweet from ground peanuts, brown sugar, and rice flour. It is made by wrapping a batter of ground peanuts, mashed bananas, honey and corn flour in banana leaves and steaming or boiling the small cakes until the batter has set.

Name: Frittata
Text Description: The dish is crustless quiche, or scrambled eggs, enriched with additional ingredients such as meats, cheeses, or vegetables.

Name: Assidat Zgougou
Text Description: The dish is pine nut porridge/cream. It was originally made out of pine, Flour, milk, cream and, nuts.

Name: Bambalouni
Text Description: It is prepared with a flour dough fried in oil. The dish is eaten sprinkled with sugar or soaked in honey.

Name: Caponata
Text Description: This dish consisting of chopped fried eggplant/aubergine and other vegetables, seasoned with olive oil, tomato sauce, celery, olives, and capers, in a sweet sour sauce.

Name: Mechouia salad
Text Description: This dish is a grilled vegetable, tomatoes, peppers, onions and garlic salad, that may also contain eggplant.

Name: Fricasse
Text Description: This dish is a savory fried pastry often filled with tuna, hard-boiled egg, olives, harissa, preserved lemons, capers and mashed potato, with turmeric as a condiment.

Name: Caruru
Text Description: The food made from okra, onion, shrimp, palm oil and toasted nuts (peanuts and/or cashews).

Name: Fish ball
Text Description: This is a ball-shaped dish made from fish paste, which is then boiled or deep-fried.

Name: Bariis iskukaris
Text Description: It is a traditional rice dish that is cooked and mixed with other ingredients. It is made from long, slender-grained aromatic rice. It is typically topped with raisins, peas, fried potatoes, onions and peppers and served with roasted lamb, beef, goat, camel, or chicken.

Name: Tzimmes
Text Description: The dish is typically made from carrots and dried fruits such as prunes or raisins, often combined with other root vegetables (including yam).

Name: Sabich
Text Description: The dish consists of flatbread stuffed with fried eggplants, hard-boiled eggs, chopped salad, parsley, mango pickle and sauce.

Name: Bamba
Text Description: The dish are made of peanut-butter-flavored puffed maize

Name: Laffa
Text Description: The dish is s a large, thin flatbread with that is traditionally vegan and cooked in an oven. It is most often used to wrap falafel, kebab, and shawarma to make sandwiches, to dip in hummus, matbucha and other dips, or with shakshouka, and other dishes.

Name: Malewa
Text Description: The dish is a smoked bamboo shoot.

Name: Apio
Text Description: The dish is an appetizer which is made from celeriac and carrot and served cold.

Name: Israeli couscous
Text Description: The dish is toasted pasta in tiny balls. The pasta is made of hard wheat flour and toasted in an oven. The pasta was factory-made from the outset and, therefore, is rarely seen as home-made from scratch.

Name: Carrot cake
Text Description: The dish is a cake that contains carrots mixed into the batter.

Name: Kikomando
Text Description: The dish is made by cutting up flatbread pieces, made with all-purpose flour instead of whole-wheat flour and fried beans. In addition to fried beans, other variations have added avocado, meat stew, gravy, chicken, or liver. This dish is served in street food stalls and higher-end restaurants.

Name: Krembo
Text Description: The dish is a chocolate-coated marshmallow treat that consists of a round biscuit base, topped with fluffy marshmallow creme-like foam, coated in a thin layer of sweet baking chocolate, and wrapped in colourful, thin aluminum foil.

Name: Chipsi mayai
Text Description: The dish is a simple potato-egg omelette.

Name: Carrot salad
Text Description: This dish is a salad made with carrots. Recipes vary widely by region. Shredded carrot is often used as a topping for other dishes.

Name: Carrot pudding
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed carrot with meat, shortening, cream, eggs, raisins, sweetener (dates and sugar), spices (clove and mace), scraped carrot, and breadcrumbs.

Name: Hutspot
Text Description: The dish is boiled and mashed potatoes, carrots, and onions.

Name: Kinpira
Text Description: The food is usually made of root vegetables that have been sautéed and simmered. The most common variety is braised burdock root. Other vegetables include carrots and lotus root, skins of squash such as pumpkin, mushrooms or broccoli, and seaweeds. Other foods include tofu, capsicum, wheat gluten, chicken thigh, pork, and beef.

Name: Kubaneh
Text Description: The bread is often served alongside eggs that are baked in their shells along with the bread and grated tomato.

Name: Chai tow kway
Text Description: The dish is stir-fried cubes of radish cake.

Name: Gajar ka halwa
Text Description: The dish is a carrot-based sweet dessert pudding made by placing grated carrots in a pot containing a specific amount of water, milk, sugar, and cardamom and then cooking while stirring regularly. It is often served with a garnish of almonds and pistachios.

Name: Cezerye
Text Description: A semi-gelatinous dessert made from caramelised carrots, shredded coconut, and roasted walnuts, hazelnuts, or pistachios.

Name: Candied carrots
Text Description: A dish are carrots caramelized in butter and brown sugar, sometimes with the addition of an acidic ingredient like orange juice.

Name: Porkkanalaatikko
Text Description: A dish are mashed carrots, mixed with boiled rice or barley, and liquid.

Name: Bourekas
Text Description: A baked pastry that are typically made with either puff pastry or filo dough, depending on the origin of the baker. They are often made out of puff pastry filled with various fillings. Among the popular fillings are cheese, minced meat, mashed potato, spinach and cheese, eggplant, and mushrooms.

Name: Compote
Text Description: A dessert made of whole or pieces of fruit in sugar syrup. Whole fruits are cooked in water with sugar and spices. The syrup may be seasoned with vanilla, lemon or orange peel, cinnamon sticks or powder, cloves, other spices, ground almonds, grated coconut, candied fruit or raisins. It is served either warm or cold.

Name: Tzfatit
Text Description: A semi-hard salty cheese, originally from sheep's milk. The milk is pasteurized at a low 72 °C (162 °F), which preserves the food proteins. Trimming is based largely on the action of enzymes contained in a special ferment and on calcium chloride rather than on the action of lactic acid. The fermentation is quick, about an hour. After the separation of most of the whey, the cheese is stored for several hours in straw or plastic baskets to drain the remaining whey and to form its round shape. For the remainder of the draining time, the cheese is inverted several times to help the draining and to form the basket's pattern on all sides.

Name: Carrot chip
Text Description: carrots that have been fried or dehydrated

Name: Morkovcha
Text Description: It is a spicy marinated carrot salad. It is made of finely julienned carrots, garlic, onion,[4] ground red pepper, ground coriander seeds, vinegar, vegetable oil (or olive oil), salt and pepper. It may also include sesame seeds.

Name: Rujak shanghai
Text Description: boiled sliced gurita (octopus) as well as edible jellyfish, kangkung, and served with thick red sweet and sour sauce, mixed with pineapple juice, and toasted crushed peanuts

Name: Perkedel
Text Description: mashed fried potato mixed with chopped scallion and seasoned with white pepper powder, then shaped into flat round patties and dipped in egg yolk or beaten egg, before being deep fried

Name: Ayam buah keluak
Text Description: dish consisting of chicken (ayam), tamarind gravy and keluak nuts

Name: Pie tee
Text Description: A thin and crispy pastry tart shell often filled with a spicy, shredded Chinese turnips, sweet mixture of thinly sliced vegetables and prawns

Name: Bubur cha cha
Text Description: This dessert is prepared by using pearled sago, sweet potatoes, yams, bananas, coconut milk, pandan leaves, sugar and salt

Name: Asinan
Text Description: The vegetable type uses Chinese cabbage, cabbage, bean sprouts, tofu, and lettuce served in a thin, hot, peanut sauce with vinegar, topped with peanuts and krupuk(Crackers).The Fruit type uses preserved tropical fruits, such as raw mango, water apple, papaya, ambarella, jicama, nutmeg, and pineapple served in sweet, hot, and sour vinegar and chili sauce, sprinkled with peanuts.

Name: Babi hong
Text Description: This is boiled or braised, fried and steamed pork belly in salty soy sauce, sweet soy sauce, and black mushroom soy sauce, Chinese red cooking wine, and oyster sauce

Name: Bakwan
Text Description: beansprouts, shredded cabbages and carrots, battered and deep fried in cooking oil

Name: Bakso
Text Description: This dish is finely ground beef with a small quantity of tapioca flour and salt, and then served in a bowl of beef broth, with yellow noodles, rice vermicelli,broccoli, bean sprout, sprinkled with fried shallots and celery

Name: Sekoteng
Text Description: a ginger-based hot drink which includes peanuts, diced bread, and tapioca pearls (known locally as pacar cina)

Name: Guazi
Text Description: baked seeds of the sunflower, pumpkin, or watermelon seeds

Name: Youtiao
Text Description: This dish is a long golden-brown deep-fried strip of wheat flour dough

Name: Bakpia
Text Description: This dish has flaky version and cake-dough version. The dish itself is filled with either mung bean, pork, purple yam or azuki beans.

Name: Grass jelly
Text Description: The jelly is made by boiling the aged and slightly oxidized stalks and leaves of Platostoma palustre (Mesona chinensis) with potassium carbonate and a little starch for several hours, then let it cool and served with sweet beverages.

Name: Yusheng
Text Description: This dish consists of strips of raw fish (sometimes salmon), mixed with shredded Vegetable and a variety of sauces and condiments, among other ingredients

Name: Tee long pan
Text Description: a steamed rice roll serve with shrimp paste or chilli sauce or with red chilli sauce, crushed roasted peanuts, fried shallots, and dried shrimp.

Name: Soto Klethuk
Text Description: The soup consists of shredded chicken, bean sprouts, vermicelli, eggs, fried onions, and fried cassava.

Name: Burmese fried rice
Text Description: The dish is made using short-grain Burmese fragrant rice and is typically stir-fried with boiled peas. Other common ingredients include egg, onions, and garlic. The seasonings, which may include soy sauce, salt, and sometimes chili, are stir-fried together with the rest of the ingredients

Name: Morisqueta tostada
Text Description: The dish is fried rice with sausage, ham, shrimp, and spring onions. It is commonly eaten with fried dishes like longganisa, tapa, or carne norte guisado.

Name: Bagoong fried rice
Text Description: The dish is fried rice in oil with shrimp paste, garlic, spring onions, black pepper, and salt.

Name: Albaloo polo
Text Description: The dish is made with rice and sour cherries usually served with chicken, koobideh, or other types of kebab as well as some form of stews.

Name: Bai pong moan
Text Description: The dish consisting of fried eggs and white rice. Beaten eggs are preferred and herbs are often added for flavor. Unbeaten eggs are usually cooked until crisp on one side and somewhat raw on the other side. Salt, soy sauce, or fish sauce can be used to flavor the eggs, and soy sauce can also be applied to the rice.

Name: Bubur pedas
Text Description: The dish is made from finely ground sauteed rice and grated coconut.The stock is made either from tetelan (bony meat such as ribs) or chicken broth.Bumbu spices mixture include shallot, garlic, red chili pepper, bruised lemongrass, black pepper, galangal and salam leaf (Indonesian bayleaf).A number of Vegetable, among others carrot, water spinach, fern leaf and kesum leaf, long beans, bean sprouts, bamboo shoots and diced sweet potato incorporated into the pot when the porridge is cooked.Fried shallots, anchovy and peanuts are added on top of the spicy porridge when served.Key lime juice, sweet soy sauce and sambal chili paste might be added as condiments.

Name: Charleston red rice
Text Description: The dish consists of the cooking of white rice with crushed tomatoes instead of water and small bits of bacon or smoked pork sausage. Celery, bell peppers, and onions are the traditional Vegetable used for seasoning.

Name: Concoction rice
Text Description: The dish is made by rice, vegetable oil and salt.

Name: Diri djondjon
Text Description: The dish consisting of rice made with edible black mushrooms called djondjon. When the mushrooms are boiled, they release a grayish-black coloring giving the rice its gray color and the dish's distinctive flavor. The dish is often served with some sort of meat, whether it be fish, chicken, or shrimp (usually mixed in the rice).

Name: Kateh
Text Description: The dish is sticky rice dish and speed of cooking makes it popular for casual dinners.

Name: Loobia polo
Text Description: This dish is made by sautéing onion with a touch of turmeric powder followed by mixing the beef, then adding the cooked green beans with salt and pepper.

Name: Chongyang cake
Text Description: The dish mainly made up of rice flour and sugar is baked and steamed, then decorated with jujube, chestnuts and almonds.

Name: Erkuai
Text Description: The dish is often served stir-fried with Vegetable, and málà sauce, which is a mixture of dried red chilis, Sichuan pepper, and salt.

Name: Mache
Text Description: The dish is characteristically white in color or green due to the pandan extracts.

Name: Seenakku
Text Description: The dish is a popular sweet, and is served with grated coconut.

Name: Bánh bò
Text Description: The dish is a chewy cake made of rice flour, water, sugar, and yeast with honeycomb-like appearance on the inside due to air bubbles. They also have colorful variants.

Name: Puffed rice cakes
Text Description: The dish is a flat hard food made with puffed rice. Typically, it is eaten as a snack or used as a base for other ingredients.

Name: Shir Berenj
Text Description: The dish is a rice pudding flavored with rose water, spices such as cinnamon or cardamom, and often containing almonds. It may be served warm or chilled as a dessert.

Name: Doodhpak
Text Description: This dessert is a type of creamy pudding made from milk, sugar, and rice, flavored with aromatic spices and enriched with nuts. The milk is simmered slowly until it thickens and sweetens, then the dish is topped with chopped dry fruits or nuts. It is typically served with fried flatbreads.

Name: Sara udon
Text Description: The dish consists of a base of noodles, and a topping of fried cabbage, bean sprouts and other Vegetable, as well as squid, prawns, pork, kamaboko etc. There are two main varieties of noodles, thinner crispy noodles fried in oil (called pari pari, bari bari, or bari men). Another variation uses thicker noodles.

Name: Vanillerostbraten
Text Description: The beef cutlet dish prepared with garlic, salt, pepper, butter, onions, and brown bouillon and normally served with fried potatoes.

Name: Pek nga
Text Description: The dish is a pancake usually eaten with a type of fish stew, coconut sticky rice, or dried fish.

Name: Bein mont
Text Description: This dish is a pancake, widely available as a street food. The pancake batter is rice flour based. After cooking the pancakes are immersed in jaggery syrup with coconut shavings and garnished with sesame seeds, peanuts and poppy seeds.

Name: bakabana
Text Description: The dish is a type of fried banana.

Name: Huai'an Pingqiao tofu
Text Description: The dish is a mixed tofu with seafood, mushrooms, and chicken with soft textures.

Name: Alcapurria
Text Description: The dish is a fritter dish. The dough surrounding the filling, the masa, is made primarily of green banana and grated yautía with optional addition of squash. Green banana can be replaced with breadfruit, cassava, taro, green or yellow plantains or other arrowroots.

Name: Kwacoco
Text Description: The dish consisting in pureed cocoyam wrapped and steamed in banana leaves.

Name: Tekeli Pitha
Text Description: The dish is mixed with coconut, sugar and a little powdered milk. Ground cardamom and dried orange rind can also be added.

Name: Dombolo
Text Description: The dish is a steamed bread. It is a popular staple food. The bread is prepared in a container in a pot of boiling water.

Name: Milk roll
Text Description: The dish is a soft, round type of bread. It is made using milk instead of water, as well as white flour, yeast, and sugar.

Name: Khanom sai bua
Text Description: The dish is made of rice and tapioca flours mixed with coarsely sliced dried stem lotus (or pounded stem lotus) and coconut milk, and sprinkled with shredded coconut, and wrapped in banana leaves (or scoop into small ceramic cups like khanom thuai), before steaming for about 25 minutes is the last step.

Name: Suet pudding
Text Description: The dish is a boiled, steamed or baked pudding made with wheat flour and suet (raw, hard fat of beef or mutton found around the kidneys), often with breadcrumb, dried fruits such as raisins, other preserved fruits, and spices. It is may be savoury.

Name: Fruit hat
Text Description: The dish is a category of steamed puddings that made with butter, flour and eggs produce a sponge-like pud topped with sauce that can be put into the base of the bowl and cooked with the pudding. So the sauce melds with the sponge to produce a deliciously gunky top

Name: Galletas pesquera
Text Description: The dish is characteristically very thin and disc-shaped, usually with three or more small perforations.

Name: Moravian spice cookies
Text Description: The dish is the blend of spices and molasses, rolled paper thin, has a reputation as the "World"s Thinnest Cookie".

Name: Picnic biscuit
Text Description: The dish is a type of small, rectangular biscuit.

Name: Nankhatai
Text Description: The dish is a type of dried bread. The main ingredients are refined flour, chickpea flour and semolina.

Name: Repostería
Text Description: The dish is a type of shortbread-like cookie that is lightly baked and dipped into a cinnamon sugar blend until the cinnamon sugar surrounds the cookie. These are often served with coffee or hot spiced Mexican chocolate.

Name: Beaver Tail
Text Description: The dish referred to quick-baked dough "especially in early 19th-century places where people might camp for one night and where there was no frying pan." It is a fried dough pastry that is specially hand-stretched into the shape of a beaver's tail.

Name: Belokranjska povitica
Text Description: The dough is rolled out and stretched out as thin as possible. The filling is made of ricotta cheese, eggs, heavy cream, oil, and butter. The filling is spread evenly on the rolled-out dough, rolled into a spiral, and placed in a greased baking tin.

Name: Chasan
Text Description: The dish is golden brown and crispy. It is made by rolled wirelike strips. Usually, It has a variety of shapes. It is a kind of afternoon tea snack and that is why it is so named.

Name: Cornish pasty
Text Description: The dish made of any kind of meat or fruit, rolled up in a paste made of flour and suet or lard. A couple of ounces of bacon and half a-pound of raw potatoes, both thinly sliced and slightly seasoned, will be found sufficient for the meal. It should be shaped like a "D" and crimped on one side, not on the top. Its ingredients should include beef, turnip, potato and onion, with a light seasoning of salt and pepper, keeping a chunky texture.

Name: Concave cake
Text Description: This dish is a cake with fillings that leak out when sliced, similar in appearance to a volcano. The traditional recipe combines egg, egg yolk, honey, white sugar and low-gluten flour. Filling flavors range from traditional honey to exotic flavors like cheese, matcha and chocolate. It was initially considered unsuccessful due to its namesake shape.

Name: Croline
Text Description: The dish is a flaky (typically puff) pastry parcel filled with various (traditionally) salty or spicy fillings. Normally the top side of the pastry is latticed. They are produced in various shapes and sizes and with different fillings. Though sweet versions are beginning to be produced, typical savoury fillings are mushroom, ham/cheese and salmon/herb. Seafood filled are normally made in a fish shaped pastry.

Name: Flaky pastry
Text Description: The dish is is a light and thin unleavened pastry that is similar to, but distinct from, puff pastry. The preparation time is very short. It relies on large lumps of butter (approximately 1 in or 2.5 cm across) mixed into the dough, as opposed to the large rectangle of butter in puff pastry. The dough is then rolled and folded in a manner similar to puff pastry. The chunks of shortening keep the rolled particles of dough in it separate from each other, so that when the dough is baked they become flakes. This yields a different texture from puff pastry, where rectangles of dough and fat are rolled and folded together in such a way that the result is a number of uniform sheets of pastry. It is used to make pasties, turnovers, sausage rolls, and plaits.

Name: Gundain
Text Description: The dish is a type of pastry made from barley grain and yeast (fermented into a light barley beer), with roasted flour, dry cheese, wild ginseng, and brown sugar.

Name: Hellimli
Text Description: The dish is a savoury pastry made with halloumi cheese.

Name: Hot water crust pastry
Text Description: The dish is a type of pastry used for savoury pies. It is traditionally used for producing hand-made pies. The pastry is made by heating water, melting the fat in it, bringing the mixture to a boil, and finally incorporating the flour. This can be done by beating the flour into the mixture in the pan, or by kneading on a pastry board. Either way, the result is a hot and rather sticky paste that can be used for hand-raising: shaping by hand, sometimes using a dish or bowl as an inner mould. The moulded crust retains its shape as it cools, and is prepared for baking with a filling and additional layer of pastry crust on top. Hand-raised does not produce a neat and uniform finish, as there will be sagging during the cooking of the filled pie. This is generally accepted as the mark of a hand-made pie. It is possible, however, to bake the pastry in a mould, as with other pies.

Name: Huff paste
Text Description: The dish is a stiff pie shell made using a mixture of flour, suet, and boiling water. The pastry when cooked creates a tough protective layer around the food inside. When cooked, the pastry is generally discarded as it is virtually inedible. However, the shell becomes soaked with the meat juices and historically was sometimes eaten by house servants after the meal had concluded. Its main purpose is simply to create a solid container for the pie's ingredients. The flour itself is stronger than normal flour, often made from coarsely ground rye, and suet, which is mixed with hot water.

Name: Inipit
Text Description: The dish is a flat pastry made of flour, milk, lard, and sugar that have various filling sandwiched in between two sheets of the pastry. Originally, the filling consists of a sweetened mashed potato mixture but other fillings especially custard, buttercream, and purple yam have become more common in the modern times.

Name: Ji dan gao
Text Description: The dish is a sponge cake served as desserts. They are prepared by steaming sponge cakes made of rice flour, milk, eggs and sugar.

Name: Kue makmur
Text Description: The dish is made from nuts in a powder form, clarified butter, flour and icing sugar.

Name: Malsouka
Text Description: The dish is a pastry sheet. It is created by spreading wafer-thin layers of batter on a heated pan rather than by rolling a raw dough.

Name: Mantecada
Text Description: The dish is spongy pastry, baked in square or rectangular box-shaped paper instead of in the typical muffin round paper cups. The pastry leaves a characteristic cross-shaped silhouette on the paper when it is removed.

Name: Masan
Text Description: The dish is a pastry, made with roasted flour, dry cubic or curd cheese, yak butter, brown sugar and water.

Name: Nunt
Text Description: The dish is a pastry which vaguely resembles nougat. The self-made sweets are customarily given to neighbours and friends. It is traditionally made from dark forest honey, which is cooked along with sugar and then mixed with coarsely cut walnuts. The result is placed on a smooth, wet board or an oiled marble plate, left to cool, and then cut into small rhombic-shaped pieces.

Name: Pastry heart
Text Description: The dish is a regional dessert item. The dish is a heart shaped flaky puff pastry, similar to a pastry in a palm leaf shape or a butterfly shape or palm leaves pastry, that is usually topped with a white sugar icing that has a hard shell but is soft on the inside.

Name: Yurla
Text Description: The dish is a wheat pastry with butter.

Name: Chestnut pie
Text Description: A pie prepared with chestnuts as a primary ingredient.Shelled whole or chopped chestnuts may be used, which may be boiled or roasted. A chestnut purée may also be used.

Name: Flipper pie
Text Description: A meat pie made from harp seal flippers, cooked with Vegetable in a thick sauce and then covered with pastry.

Name: Lanttusupikas
Text Description: A double-folded buttered flaky crust pie, filled with thin, braised swede slices and pork loin.

Name: Lemon ice box pie
Text Description: An icebox pie consisting of lemon juice, eggs, and condensed milk in a pie crust,[1][2] frequently made of graham crackers and butter.

Name: Milk pie
Text Description: Custard tart pastry consisting of a shortcrust pastry filled with egg custard and condensed milk.

Name: Sea-pie
Text Description: A layered meat pie made with meat or fish. It is made by lining a saucepan or pot with a thick layer of pastry, and then filling the pot with alternating layers of meat (such as pork, beef, fish, or pigeon) or stew, and vegetables; and, topping the layered ingredients with pastry. There is no set list of ingredients; rather, it is made with whatever meat and vegetables are on-hand at the time it is made.

Name: Wagafi bread
Text Description: A type of bread that normally contains a greater amount of flour than normal bread. It is a flat, thin bread. The bread is made in a hole based on local tradition.

Name: Ttongppang
Text Description: It is bread filled with red bean paste and walnut bits that is shaped like stylized human feces.

Name: Canadian white bread
Text Description: Bread made from wheat or white flour. It usually has a protein content of 12 or 13%.

Name: Cholermus
Text Description: It is a kind of pancake, or "shredded", "fried crepe", that is typically eaten for supper.

Name: Hard dough bread
Text Description: The dish is a bread. The dough consists of flour, water, yeast, salt and sugar. Additional ingredients such as treacle, molasses, and vegetable shortening can be used. It typically has a dense consistency and is typically brushed with sugared water before baking. They are usually rectangular and can be bought already sliced or unsliced. Most loaves are wrapped in plastic when bought.

Name: Khubz
Text Description: The dish is the usual word for bread.

Name: Kisra
Text Description: The dish is a popular thin fermented bread.

Name: Palianytsia
Text Description: The dish is a bread that has a semi-circular cut across the top third of the loaf.

Name: Ngome
Text Description: The dish is a flatbread using only millet, water and vegetable oil.

Name: Pambazo
Text Description: The dish is a bread with golden and crispy in its outer layer and white and very light in its inner part.

Name: Penia
Text Description: The dish is a sweet bread made by sugar, butter, eggs, anise seeds, and lemons.

Name: Rēwena bread
Text Description: The dish is a type of sourdough bread leavened with a fermented potato starter.

Name: Grater cake
Text Description: The dish is a dessert of grated coconut in a fondant of sugar.

Name: Asham
Countries: ["Antigua and Barbuda", "Bahamas", "Barbados", "Cuba", "Dominica", "Dominican Republic", "Grenada", "Haiti", "Jamaica", "Saint Kitts and Nevis", "Saint Lucia", "Saint Vincent and the Grenadines", "Trinidad and Tobago"]
Text Description: The dish is made by shelling dry corn, parching it, and then grinding it finely.

Name: Stew peas
Text Description: The dish is a stew dish prepared using coconut milk, gungo peas (pigeon peas) or red peas (kidney beans), uncured meats and salted meats such as pork and beef as primary ingredients.

Name: Red Peas Soup
Text Description: The dish is a soup made of kidney beans, seasonings such as scotch bonnet pepper, pimento seeds, etc. Traditionally, the broth includes a pigtail.

Name: Coconut drop
Text Description: The dish is made with cut up coconut meat, ginger and brown sugar.

Name: Cocktion
Text Description: The dish is made from parched corn and sugar rolled into balls and sometimes colored.

Name: Fio Fio
Text Description: The dish is a soup made of guinea pea and cocoyam.

Name: Frejon
Text Description: The dish is a coconut milk and bean soup.

Name: Funkaso
Text Description: The dish is a savoury fried dumpling made with wheat and eaten with soup, honey, or sugar.

Name: Skilpadjies
Text Description: The dish is a lamb liver wrapped in caul fat, cooked with coriander, onion, salt, and worcestershire sauce.

Name: Marghi special
Text Description: The dish is a soup made of fish with spinach, tomatoes, bean sprouts, and tamarind broth.

Name: Isidudu
Text Description: The dish is a porridge made from ground corn.

Name: Harqma
Text Description: The dish is a soup or stew prepared using lamb.

Name: Tibs
Text Description: The dish is a sauteed vegetable with meat, served in hot to mild temperatures.

Name: Chaudin
Text Description: The dish is a sausage-like variant made from ingredients sewn up in a pig's stomach, cooked with spices, and rice.

Name: Stuffed ribs
Text Description: The dish is a stuffed lamb, shank meat, rice butter, black pepper, salt, allspice, water, almonds, pepper paste, parsley, or basil.

Name: Stuffed mallow
Text Description: The dish is a mallow leaves, stuffed with meat lamb or rice.

Name: Stuffed melon
Text Description: The dish is a melon stuffed with meat lamb and rice.

Name: Occhi di lupo
Text Description: The dish is a large-sized, tubular stuffed pasta, served with a stuffing or filling.

Name: Crappit heid
Text Description: The dish is a fish course consisting of a boiled fish head stuffed with oats and liver.

Name: Guanime
Text Description: The dish is a corn bread made with sugar, salt, flour and butter, wrapped in banana leaves.

Name: Ayam pansuh
Text Description: The dish is a cooked chicken meat in a bamboo stalk, filled with water, seasonings, and covered with tapioca leaves from the cassave plan.

Name: Khai yat sai
Text Description: The dish is an omelette lightly cooked with minced beef or pork, peas, onion, carrots, tomatoes, seasoned with fish sauce and/or oyster sauce.

Name: Ladera
Text Description: This is a category of vegetable dishes cooked in olive oil.

Name: Scovardă
Text Description: This dish is a type of stuffed pastry. The dough is folded around the stuffing which usually consists of different types of cheese.

Name: Carpetbag steak
Text Description: This dish consists of an end cut of steak, such as scotch fillet or eye fillet. A pocket is cut in the meat via a small entry cut and then expanded internally, into which oysters are stuffed, and the opening closed with toothpicks or thread.

Name: Stuffed chine
Text Description: This dish is a traditional dish of salt pork filled with herbs, typically parsley.

Name: Eggplant papoutsaki
Text Description: This dish consists of eggplants which have been boiled or roasted and the tops cut off lengthwise, which is why they resemble little shoes.

Name: Stuffed sorrel
Text Description: This dish is made of sorrel leaves stuffed with meat (lamb) and rice, or more rarely rice only.

Name: Braciolone
Text Description: This dish is a roulade meat dish consisting of of braised beef, veal or pork that is filled with cheese, salami, hard-boiled eggs and breadcrumbs and then rolled.

Name: Weisswurst
Text Description: It is a mild, pale sausage made from finely ground veal and pork, typically boiled and served with mustard and pretzels.

Name: Zoervleis
Text Description: This dish is a regional meat dish traditionally made with horse meat, but nowadays beef is commonly used. The meat is marinated in vinegar and often accompanied by french fries.

Name: Alicot
Text Description: This dish is a stew made of the cheapest parts of poultry, slowly simmered.

Name: Kadyos, baboy, kag langka
Text Description: This dish is a pork soup or stew with pigeon peas, pork, and jackfruit used as the three main ingredients. The soup is also traditionally soured with batuan fruits.

Name: Kadyos, manok, kag ubad
Text Description: This dish is a pork soup or stew with pigeon peas, pork, and jackfruit used as the three main ingredients. This dish does not use a souring agent, and uses chicken and banana pith instead.

Name: Linat-an
Text Description: The dish is a traditional pork stew. It characteristically uses pork ribs (or other bony cuts of pork) boiled and simmered until very tender, lemongrass, string beans, and starchy ingredients for a thicker soup (usually taro).

Name: Lobby
Text Description: The dish is a traditional stew or casserole, containing corned beef, potatoes and onion.

Name: Lunggoi Katsa
Text Description: The dish is composed of stewed sheep's head, with curry, fennel, monosodium glutamate and salt.

Name: Molagoottal
Text Description: The dish is a stew with coconut and lentils as a base.

Name: Spanish fricco
Text Description: The dish is a hearty dish prepared primarily using diced beef, potatoes and onions, typically in a cream soup base prepared using butter and sour cream.

Name: Sonofabitch stew
Text Description: The dish is a cowboy dish. Various recipes exist for this beef stew, and some sources say its ingredients may vary according to whatever is on hand.

Name: Sagamite
Text Description: The dish is made from hominy, cornmeal, or Indian corn and grease (from animal fat).

Name: Rubaboo
Text Description: The dish is is traditionally made of peas and/or corn, with grease (bear or pork) and a thickening agent (bread or flour) that makes up the base of the stew. Pemmican and maple sugar were also commonly added to the mixture.

Name: Qoiri
Text Description: The dish is a stew made with mutton chops, flour, shredded wheat, chillies, dry curd cheese, water, and salt.

Name: Mulligan stew
Text Description: The dish is broadly defined as a stew made of odds and ends or any available ingredients.

Name: Ollada
Text Description: The dish is a stew of potatoes, beans and cabbage or turnips.

Name: Pepper pot soup
Text Description: This dish is a thick stew of beef tripe, vegetables, pepper and other seasonings.

Name: Ostrich stew
Text Description: This dish is a stew prepared using ostrich meat as a primary ingredient. The meat can be diced into cubes, and leg meat from the ostrich is sometimes used.

Name: Caldillo de perro
Text Description: This dish is a fish soup made with hake, garlic, olive oil, lemons, and oranges. It is customarily served with sour orange juice.

Name: Zoque
Text Description: This dish is a cold soup that has red vegetables, such as tomatoes, red pepper, and carrot, as its main ingredients. It is usually served with ham or shrimp.

Name: Sopa de gato
Text Description: This dish is a very thick soup served hot. Typical ingredients in the dish's preparation include water, bread, oil, garlic and salt.

Name: Noppe
Text Description: The dish is a traditional stew served throughout Japan generally made from left-over vegetable parts, sauteed or boiled in sesame oil.

Name: Purin
Text Description: The dish is custard pudding.

Name: Gionbō
Text Description: This sweet is made using a particular variety of dried persimmon, and has the filling made from a soft form of rice cake with bean jam, then sprinkling white sugar over it.

Name: Gyūhi
Text Description: This sweet is a softer variety of rice cake, which is made from either glutinous rice itself or from glutinous rice flour.

Name: Chinese flaky pastry
Text Description: The dish is a form of unleavened flaky pastry. There are 2 versions, but both forms require creating two doughs: a "water" dough and an "oil" dough. The "water" dough requires mixing of flour, oil or fat, and warm water at a ratio of 10:3:4, while the "oil" dough requires direct mixing of flour and oil or fat at a ratio of 2:1 or 3:1, which provides for a crumbly mouthfeel and rich flavour. The two types of dough are systematically folded and rolled out to form multiple laminated layers of flaky dough, filled with various fillings, and baked at a temperature between 180 and 220 °C (356 and 428 °F)

Name: Colston bun
Text Description: The dish is a sweet bun made of a yeast dough flavoured with dried fruit such as currants, candied peel, and sweet spices.

Name: Currant bun
Text Description: The dish is a sweet bun that contains currants or raisins.

Name: London bun
Text Description: The dish is a square-shaped bun made of rich yeast dough flavored with currants and candied peel topped with white sugar icing or crystallised sugar.

Name: Spiced bun
Text Description: The dish is a sweet bun to which spices were added during the baking process.

Name: Penny bun
Text Description: The dish is a small bread bun or loaf.

Name: Rum roll
Text Description: The dish is a sweet yeast bread topped with rum frosting and sometimes including raisins or currants.

Name: Pebete
Text Description: The dish is a soft oval bun made of wheat flour with a thin brown crust, rather like a fatter hot dog roll. It is often used to make a sandwich, typically filled with cheese, cured meat, tomato and mayonnaise

Name: Iced bun
Text Description: The dish is a bread bun with a white or pink icing sugar glaze covering the top. The dough may be enriched (made with eggs, milk, and butter) or simply an oblong bread roll.

Name: Fläsklägg med rotmos
Text Description: The dish consists cured ham hock is cooked for one to two hours together with onions, carrots, and allspice or similar vegetable. Rutabaga, potatoes and carrots are then diced and cooked soft in the broth, then drained and mashed. It may be served with different kinds of mustard; the preferred one is a traditional sweet mustard.

Name: Amish preaching soup
Text Description: The dish is a type of bean soup. Some versions are prepared with beans and ham hocks.

Name: Khanom khai
Text Description: The dish  is made from egg, sugar and flour. It is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The taste of the dessert is similar to cake, whereas its texture is rougher because of the different types of flour and the different proportion of ingredients.

Name: Eggs Beauregard
Text Description: The dish was once made with hard boiled eggs served in cream sauce, but in modern times the term is used for a dish of biscuits and gravy with fried egg and sausage.

Name: Shirred eggs
Text Description: The dish is eggs that have been baked in a flat-bottomed dish; the name originates from the type of dish in which it was traditionally baked. An alternative way of cooking is to crack the eggs into individual ramekins, and cook them in a water bath. It is eggs that have been baked in a gratin dish with a flat bottom.

Name: Balila
Text Description: The dish consists of chickpeas that have been boiled along with lemon juice, garlic, and various spices. It is served as a hot assorted dish.

Name: Yun dou juan
